식당에서 (At a Restaurant).notes: 금(禁 forbid) appears in 금지(prohibition), 금지구역(restricted area). 연(煙 smoke) appears in 담배(cigarette), 흡연(smoking). 석(席 seat) appears in 좌석(seat), 지정석(reserved seat). Most Korean restaurants now non-smoking.

식당에서 (At a Restaurant).example_en: There are ten of us, do you have group seating?
식당에서 (At a Restaurant).notes: 단(團 group) appears in 단체(group), 집단(collective). 체(體 body) appears in 전체(whole), 구체적(specific). 석(席 seat) appears in 좌석(seat), 금연석(non-smoking).

식당에서 (At a Restaurant).example_en: I want to go to a buffet today.
식당에서 (At a Restaurant).notes: Loanword from French 'buffet.' All-you-can-eat style. Korean buffets often have diverse Korean and international dishes. Related: 뷔페식(buffet-style).

식당에서 (At a Restaurant).example_en: I'll order the course meal.
식당에서 (At a Restaurant).notes: 코스(course, from English) + 요리(料理 cooking). 요(料 ingredient) appears in 재료(ingredient), 음료(beverage). 리(理 manage) appears in 관리(management), 처리(processing).

식당에서 (At a Restaurant).example_en: The set menu is cheaper.
식당에서 (At a Restaurant).notes: 세트(set, from English) + 메뉴(menu, from French). Common at fast food and casual restaurants. Usually includes main + side + drink.

식당에서 (At a Restaurant).example_en: The side dishes are really diverse.
식당에서 (At a Restaurant).notes: 반(飯 rice) appears in 공기밥(bowl of rice), 밥(rice). 찬(饌 side dish) appears in 찬거리(ingredients for side dishes). Refillable and free in Korean restaurants. Cultural staple.

식당에서 (At a Restaurant).example_en: Can I get a water refill, please?
식당에서 (At a Restaurant).notes: Loanword from English 'refill.' Korean restaurants typically offer free refills on water, 반찬, and sometimes coffee. Say: 리필해 주세요 or 더 주세요.

식당에서 (At a Restaurant).example_en: One more bowl of rice, please.
식당에서 (At a Restaurant).notes: 공(空 empty) appears in 공간(space), 공항(airport). 기(器 vessel) appears in 그릇(bowl), 용기(container). 밥(rice, native Korean). Often free or small charge.

식당에서 (At a Restaurant).example_en: What beverages do you have?
식당에서 (At a Restaurant).notes: 음(飮 drink) appears in 음주(drinking alcohol), 음식(food). 료(料 ingredient) appears in 재료(ingredient), 요리(cooking), 무료(free).

식당에서 (At a Restaurant).example_en: Dessert comes after the meal.
식당에서 (At a Restaurant).notes: Loanword from French 'dessert.' Korean desserts include 빙수(shaved ice), 떡(rice cake), pastries. Cafes very popular for dessert in Korea.

식당에서 (At a Restaurant).example_en: This is on the house.
식당에서 (At a Restaurant).notes: Loanword from English 'service' but means 'complimentary/free gift' in Korean restaurants. Common: 서비스로 주다(give as complimentary). Cultural: restaurants often give extra dishes as service.

식당에서 (At a Restaurant).example_en: Please call the waiter.
식당에서 (At a Restaurant).notes: Loanword from English 'waiter.' More common to say 여기요 or 저기요 to call servers rather than using this word. Female: 웨이트리스(waitress).

식당에서 (At a Restaurant).example_en: The head chef at this restaurant is famous.
식당에서 (At a Restaurant).notes: 주(主 main) appears in 주인(owner), 주요(main). 방(房 room) appears in 부엌(kitchen), 주방(kitchen). 장(長 chief) appears in 사장(president), 반장(class leader).

식당에서 (At a Restaurant).example_en: In Korea, you don't need to leave a tip.
식당에서 (At a Restaurant).notes: Loanword from English 'tip.' Cultural: tipping NOT customary in Korea and may be refused. Service included in prices. Exception: sometimes at high-end hotels or spas.

식당에서 (At a Restaurant).example_en: Do you know a good restaurant around here?
식당에서 (At a Restaurant).notes: Native Korean compound. 맛(taste) + 집(house) = tasty place. Very common word for restaurant with good food. Related: 맛집 투어(food tour), 유명 맛집(famous restaurant).

식당에서 (At a Restaurant).example_en: Sorry, can I cancel my order?
식당에서 (At a Restaurant).notes: 주문(注文 order) + 취소(取消 cancel). 취(取 take) appears in 취직(employment), 채취(collection). 소(消 extinguish) appears in 소화(digestion), 소방(firefighting).

식당에서 (At a Restaurant).example_en: I have a peanut allergy.
식당에서 (At a Restaurant).notes: 알레르기 from German 'Allergie.' Important phrase for dietary restrictions. List allergies: 땅콩(peanut), 새우(shrimp), 우유(milk), 계란(egg), 밀(wheat) + 알레르기.

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: I don't have time. I need to go quickly.
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: 시(時 time) appears in 시계(clock), 시각(time/hour), 당시(at that time). 간(間 interval) appears in 기간(period), 시간표(schedule), 순간(moment).

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: It's three o'clock now.
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: Native Korean counter for hours. Use native numbers: 한 시(1), 두 시(2), 세 시(3), 네 시(4)...열두 시(12). 12-hour system common in speech.

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: Please wait just ten minutes.
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: 분(分 divide) appears in 구분(division), 본인(oneself), 부분(part). Use Sino-Korean numbers: 십 분(10), 이십 분(20), 삼십 분(30). Pattern: [number] + 분.

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: Please wait just thirty seconds.
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: 초(秒 second) appears in 초침(second hand). Use Sino-Korean numbers like 분. Less common in daily speech than 분. Pattern: [number] + 초.

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: I have class at 9 AM.
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: 오(午 noon) appears in 정오(noon), 오후(PM). 전(前 before) appears in 전날(day before), 이전(before), 전에(ago). Before noon = AM.

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: Let's meet at 2 PM.
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: 오(午 noon) appears in 정오(noon), 오전(AM). 후(後 after) appears in 이후(after), 후기(later period), 사후(after death). After noon = PM.

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: What do you do in the morning?
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: Native Korean. Also means breakfast: 아침 먹다(eat breakfast). Related: 좋은 아침이에요(good morning), 아침형 인간(morning person).

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: Do you want to eat lunch together?
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: 점(點 dot/point) appears in 점수(score), 요점(main point). 심(心 heart) appears in 관심(interest), 중심(center). Means both noon time and lunch meal.

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: Do you have time in the evening?
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: Native Korean. Also means dinner: 저녁 먹다(eat dinner). Related: 저녁 시간(evening time), 저녁형 인간(night person).

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: Don't walk around alone at night.
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: Native Korean. Related: 밤새(all night), 한밤중(middle of night), 밤늦게(late at night). Korea generally very safe at night; vibrant night culture.

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: Waking up at dawn is hard.
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: Native Korean. Roughly 3-6am. Related: 새벽같이(at the crack of dawn), 새벽 기도(dawn prayer service). Many Koreans wake very early.

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: The weather is nice today.
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: Native Korean compound. Time words: 오늘(today), 내일(tomorrow), 어제(yesterday), 모레(day after tomorrow), 그저께(day before yesterday).

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: What are you going to do tomorrow?
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: Native Korean. Related: 내일부터(starting tomorrow), 내일 모레(in a day or two), 내일이면(by tomorrow). Future tense often used with 내일.

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: What did you do yesterday?
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: Native Korean. Past tense always used with 어제. Related: 어제저녁(yesterday evening), 어제부터(since yesterday).

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: I have an exam the day after tomorrow.
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: Native Korean. Time sequence: 그저께(2 days ago) → 어제(yesterday) → 오늘(today) → 내일(tomorrow) → 모레(2 days later).

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: I met a friend the day before yesterday.
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: Native Korean. Less common in speech than 어제 or 오늘. Can also say 엊그제 (same meaning, slightly different dialect).

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: Are you busy now?
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: Native Korean. Common phrases: 지금부터(from now), 지금까지(until now), 지금 당장(right now/immediately).

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: I'll call you later.
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: Native Korean compound. Less specific than 후(後 after). Used for indefinite future. Related: 나중에 봐요(see you later), 나중에 하다(do later).

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: I have to wake up early tomorrow.
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: Native Korean adverb. Related: 일찍 자다(go to bed early), 일찍 오다(come early), 일찍 일어나다(wake up early). Opposite: 늦게(late).

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: I went to sleep late yesterday.
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: Native Korean adverb from 늦다(be late). Related: 늦게 오다(come late), 늦게 자다(sleep late), 늦어서 죄송해요(sorry I'm late).

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: I always eat breakfast.
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: 항(恒 constant) appears in 항구(port). 상(常 always) appears in 평상시(usually), 상식(common sense), 일상(daily life).

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: What time do you usually wake up?
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: 보(普 general) appears in 보편적(universal). 통(通 pass through) appears in 교통(traffic), 소통(communication), 통하다(work/connect). Also means 'average/normal.'

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: I sometimes watch Korean movies.
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: Native Korean. Frequency adverbs from most to least: 항상(always) > 자주(often) > 가끔(sometimes) > 거의 안(rarely) > 전혀 안(never).

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: I have a meeting on Monday.
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: 월(月 moon) appears in 1월(January), 달(moon/month). 요일(曜日 day of week). Days based on celestial bodies: 월(moon), 화(fire), 수(water), 목(wood), 금(metal), 토(earth), 일(sun).

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: I have Korean class on Tuesday.
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: 화(火 fire) appears in 불(fire), 화재(fire disaster). 요일(曜日). Tuesday = fire day in East Asian tradition.

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: I'm a bit busy on Wednesday.
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: 수(水 water) appears in 물(water), 수영(swimming). 요일(曜日). Wednesday = water day in East Asian tradition.

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: Do you have time on Thursday?
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: 목(木 wood/tree) appears in 나무(tree), 목재(lumber). 요일(曜日). Thursday = wood day in East Asian tradition.

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: It's Friday so I'm in a good mood!
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: 금(金 metal/gold) appears in 돈(money), 금속(metal). 요일(曜日). Friday = metal day. 불금(fire Friday) = exciting Friday night culture.

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: What are you going to do on Saturday?
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: 토(土 earth) appears in 흙(earth/soil), 토지(land). 요일(曜日). Saturday = earth day in East Asian tradition.

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: I usually rest on Sundays.
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: 일(日 sun/day) appears in 해(sun), 날(day). 요일(曜日). Sunday = sun day. Many businesses closed or have shorter hours on Sundays.

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: Let's meet this Friday.
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: 이번(this time) + 주(週 week). Time patterns: 이번 주(this week), 다음 주(next week), 지난주(last week), 매주(every week).

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: I'm going on a trip next week.
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: 다음(next) + 주(週 week). Related: 다음 달(next month), 다음 해(next year), 다음번(next time).

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: I caught a cold last week.
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: 지나다(pass) + 주(週 week). Related: 지난달(last month), 지난해(last year), 지난번(last time). Past tense always used.

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: I exercise every day.
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: 매(每 every) appears in 매번(every time), 매달(every month), 매년(every year). 일(日 day). Frequency patterns: 매일(daily), 매주(weekly), 매달(monthly), 매년(yearly).

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: I play soccer every Saturday.
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: 매(每 every) + 주(週 week). Pattern: 매주 + [day]. Related: 주 1회(once a week), 주말마다(every weekend).

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: I started learning Korean this year.
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: Native Korean compound. 올(this) + 해(year). Time patterns: 올해(this year), 작년(last year), 내년(next year), 매년(every year).

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: I went to Korea last year.
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: 작(昨 past) appears in 어제(yesterday). 년(年 year) appears in 내년(next year), 몇 년(how many years). Always use past tense with 작년.

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: I want to go to Korea next year.
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: 내(來 come) appears in 미래(future), 내방(visit). 년(年 year). Often used with future tense or plans.

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: When is your birthday?
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: 생(生 life/birth) appears in 학생(student), 인생(life), 탄생(birth). 일(日 day). Say: 생일 축하해요(happy birthday).

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: What did you do on the weekend?
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: 주(週 week) + 말(end). Saturday and Sunday. Korean work culture: many work on Saturdays, so 주말 is precious. Related: 주말 여행(weekend trip).

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: What are you going to do for the new year?
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: Native Korean. 새(new) + 해(year). Say: 새해 복 많이 받으세요(Happy New Year). Koreans celebrate both solar (1/1) and lunar new year (설날).

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: What do you do for Christmas?
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: Loanword from English 'Christmas.' Popular romantic holiday in Korea, celebrated by couples. Not a major family holiday like in West. Trendy: going to cafes, illuminations.

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: The whole family gathers during holidays.
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: 명(名 name) appears in 이름(name), 유명(famous). 절(節 season/festival) appears in 계절(season), 절기(seasonal division). Major: 설날(Lunar New Year), 추석(harvest festival).

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: Tomorrow is a day off.
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: 휴(休 rest) appears in 휴식(rest), 휴가(vacation). 일(日 day). General term for any day off, not necessarily national holiday.

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: I go to work on weekdays.
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: 평(平 flat/ordinary) appears in 평등(equality), 평범(ordinary). 일(日 day). Monday to Friday. Opposite: 주말(weekend).

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: Mid-July is the hottest.
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: 중(中 middle) appears in 중간(middle), 중앙(center). 순(旬 ten-day period) appears in 상순(early), 하순(late). Divide month into: 상순(1-10), 중순(11-20), 하순(21-31).

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: I'm busy at the end of December.
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: Native Korean. End of time period. Related: 연말(end of year), 월말(end of month), 학기말(end of semester). Also means 'horse' and 'speech' (different words).

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: Let's meet then.
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: Native Korean. 그(that) + 때(time). Time references: 이때(this time), 그때(that time), 언제(when), 그때마다(every time).

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: I just arrived.
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: Native Korean. Very recent past (within minutes). Related: 방금 전(just before), 방금 막(just right now). More immediate than 조금 전(a while ago).

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: I'll arrive soon.
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: Native Korean. Imminent future (within minutes). More immediate than 나중에(later). Related: 곧바로(immediately), 곧 시작해요(starting very soon).

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: Did you wait long?
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: Native Korean adverb. Related: 오래되다(be old/aged), 오랜만(long time no see), 오래 걸리다(take a long time).

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: Please wait just a moment.
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: 잠(暫 brief) appears in 잠깐(brief moment). 시(時 time) appears in 시간(time), 시각(hour). Polite: 잠시만요(just a moment please), 잠깐만요 (similar, slightly more casual).

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: I studied for 3 hours.
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: 동(動 move) appears in 운동(exercise), 활동(activity). 안(間 interval) appears in 시간(time). Pattern: [time duration] + 동안.

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: I went to Korea 2 years ago.
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: 전(前 before) appears in 이전(before), 전날(previous day). Pattern: [time] + 전에 = [time] ago. Examples: 1시간 전(1 hour ago), 며칠 전(a few days ago).

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: Let's meet in 30 minutes.
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: 후(後 after) appears in 이후(afterward), 오후(PM), 후반(latter half). Pattern: [time] + 후에 = after [time]. Examples: 1시간 후(in 1 hour), 식사 후(after meal).

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: I get paid every month.
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: 매(每 every) + 달(month, native Korean). Related: 달마다(every month), 월말(end of month), 월초(beginning of month).

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: I travel every year.
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: 매(每 every) + 년(年 year). Related: 해마다(every year), 연례(annual), 년도(year).

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: How many days does it take?
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: Native Korean. 며(how many) + 칠(days). Question word or indefinite amount. Context determines meaning: 며칠 걸려요?(how many days?) vs 며칠 전(a few days ago).

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: How long does it take from here?
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: Native Korean. 얼마(how much) + -나(to the extent of). Questions: 얼마나 자주?(how often?), 얼마나 오래?(how long?), 얼마나 멀어요?(how far?).

시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).example_en: I studied Korean for half a year.
시간 & 요일 (Time & Days).notes: 반(半 half) appears in 절반(half), 반값(half price). 년(年 year). Six months. Related: 반세기(half century), 반나절(half day).

장소 (Places).example_en: I want to go home.
장소 (Places).notes: Native Korean. Particles: 집에(to home), 집에서(at home), 집으로(toward home). Related: 우리 집(our house), 집 앞(in front of house).

장소 (Places).example_en: How do you get to school?
장소 (Places).notes: 학(學 learn) appears in 학생(student), 대학(university), 수학(math). 교(校 school) appears in 교실(classroom), 교육(education), 중학교(middle school).

장소 (Places).example_en: I work at a company.
장소 (Places).notes: 회(會 gather) appears in 교회(church), 모임(gathering), 기회(opportunity). 사(社 company) appears in 사회(society), 회사원(office worker), 신사(gentleman).

장소 (Places).example_en: What floor is the office on?
장소 (Places).notes: 사(事 matter) appears in 일(work), 사건(incident). 무(務 duty) appears in 의무(duty), 근무(work). 실(室 room) appears in 교실(classroom), 화장실(restroom).

장소 (Places).example_en: I'm sick so I need to go to the hospital.
장소 (Places).notes: 병(病 sickness) appears in 질병(disease), 간호(nursing). 원(院 institution) appears in 학원(academy), 법원(court), 미용원(beauty salon).

장소 (Places).example_en: I bought medicine at the pharmacy.
장소 (Places).notes: 약(藥 medicine) appears in 약품(medicine), 약사(pharmacist), 한약(herbal medicine). 국(局 bureau) appears in 우체국(post office), 방송국(broadcasting station).

장소 (Places).example_en: I bought fruit at the mart.
장소 (Places).notes: Loanword from English 'mart' (market). Common: 대형마트(large mart), 이마트(E-Mart brand), 편의점(convenience store smaller than mart).

장소 (Places).example_en: I'll go buy water at the convenience store.
장소 (Places).notes: 편(便 convenient) appears in 편하다(comfortable), 편리(convenience). 의(宜 suitable). 점(店 store) appears in 상점(shop), 가게(store). Common brands: GS25, CU, 세븐일레븐.

장소 (Places).example_en: I need to go to the bank and send money.
장소 (Places).notes: 은(銀 silver) appears in 은메달(silver medal), 은하수(milky way). 행(行 go/row) appears in 비행기(airplane), 여행(travel), 진행(progress).

장소 (Places).example_en: I sent a package at the post office.
장소 (Places).notes: 우(郵 mail) appears in 우편(mail), 우표(stamp). 체(遞 deliver). 국(局 bureau) appears in 약국(pharmacy), 방송국(broadcasting station).

장소 (Places).example_en: How long does it take to get to the airport?
장소 (Places).notes: 공(空 sky/empty) appears in 공기(air), 공중(in the air), 공간(space). 항(港 port) appears in 항구(port), 공항버스(airport bus).

장소 (Places).example_en: Let's meet at Seoul Station.
장소 (Places).notes: 역(驛 station) appears in 지하철역(subway station), 기차역(train station). Pattern: [place name] + 역. Common meeting spots in Korea.

장소 (Places).example_en: Where is the bus stop?
장소 (Places).notes: 버스(bus, loanword). 정(停 stop) appears in 정지(stop), 정거장(station). 류(留 stay). 장(場 place) appears in 시장(market), 주차장(parking lot).

장소 (Places).example_en: I like studying at cafes.
장소 (Places).notes: Loanword from French 'café.' Cafe culture huge in Korea—many study, work, or meet at cafes. Common: 스타벅스, 카페베네, 이디야.

장소 (Places).example_en: Have you been to that restaurant? They say it's good.
장소 (Places).notes: 식(食 food) appears in 식사(meal), 음식(food), 식품(groceries). 당(堂 hall) appears in 성당(cathedral), 강당(auditorium).

장소 (Places).example_en: I take walks in the park.
장소 (Places).notes: 공(公 public) appears in 공공(public), 공개(disclosure). 원(園 garden) appears in 유치원(kindergarten), 정원(garden), 동물원(zoo).

장소 (Places).example_en: I borrowed a book from the library.
장소 (Places).notes: 도(圖 map/plan) appears in 도표(chart), 지도(map). 서(書 book) appears in 서점(bookstore), 독서(reading). 관(館 building) appears in 박물관(museum), 미술관(art gallery).

장소 (Places).example_en: I saw a new movie at the theater.
장소 (Places).notes: 영(映 project) appears in 영상(video). 화(畫 picture) appears in 그림(picture), 만화(comics). 관(館 building). Korean theaters advanced: assigned seating, food delivery.

장소 (Places).example_en: I bought a gift at the department store.
장소 (Places).notes: 백(百 hundred) appears in 백화(hundred flowers). 화(貨 goods) appears in 화물(cargo). 점(店 store) appears in 상점(shop). High-end shopping; basement food courts famous.

장소 (Places).example_en: I ate tteokbokki at the market.
장소 (Places).notes: 시(市 market/city) appears in 도시(city), 시민(citizen). 장(場 place) appears in 주차장(parking), 운동장(playground). Traditional markets have street food, fresh produce.

장소 (Places).example_en: I went to the shopping mall on the weekend.
장소 (Places).notes: Loanword from English 'shopping mall.' Modern indoor malls very popular. Famous: 코엑스몰(COEX), 롯데몰(Lotte Mall), 타임스퀘어.

장소 (Places).example_en: Where is the restroom?
장소 (Places).notes: 화(化 transform) appears in 변화(change), 문화(culture). 장(粧 makeup). 실(室 room). Literally 'makeup room.' Also: 욕실(bathroom at home), 변소(toilet, old term).

장소 (Places).example_en: I go to church every Sunday.
장소 (Places).notes: 교(敎 teach) appears in 교육(education), 종교(religion). 회(會 gather) appears in 회사(company), 모임(meeting). Christianity significant in Korea; many churches.

장소 (Places).example_en: I visited a temple on the weekend.
장소 (Places).notes: Native Korean for Buddhist temple. Famous: 불국사, 해인사. Alternative Sino-Korean: 사찰(寺刹). Popular tourist and hiking destinations. Temple stays (템플스테이) popular cultural experience.

장소 (Places).example_en: Did you book a hotel?
장소 (Places).notes: Loanword from English 'hotel.' Ranges from luxury (5-star) to budget (모텔 motel). Business hotels common in city centers.

장소 (Places).example_en: I live in an apartment.
장소 (Places).notes: Loanword from English 'apartment.' Most Koreans live in apartments (고층 아파트 high-rise). Different from 빌라(villa, smaller building) or 단독주택(single house).

장소 (Places).example_en: How many rooms are there?
장소 (Places).notes: Native Korean. Used in compounds: 노래방(karaoke), PC방(internet cafe), 찜질방(spa), 게임방(game room), 방 2개(2 rooms/2BR).

장소 (Places).example_en: I'm cooking in the kitchen.
장소 (Places).notes: Native Korean for kitchen. Also: 주방(廚房 kitchen, formal/commercial). Traditional Korean kitchens on floor level; modern ones have standing counters.

장소 (Places).example_en: I watch TV in the living room.
장소 (Places).notes: 거(居 dwell) appears in 거주(residence). 실(室 room) appears in 교실(classroom), 화장실(restroom). Central family space; often shoes-off culture inside.

장소 (Places).example_en: The bathroom is clean.
장소 (Places).notes: 욕(浴 bath) appears in 목욕(bath), 욕조(bathtub). 실(室 room). Home bathroom with shower/bath. Different from 화장실(public restroom).

장소 (Places).example_en: I attend a cram school.
장소 (Places).notes: 학(學 learn) + 원(院 institution). Korean education culture: many students attend after-school academies (영어학원 English, 수학학원 math, 태권도학원 taekwondo).

장소 (Places).example_en: I majored in economics at university.
장소 (Places).notes: 대(大 big) appears in 대형(large), 위대(great). 학(學 learn) + 교(校 school). 4-year university. 대학(college) vs 대학교(university)—often used interchangeably.

장소 (Places).example_en: My child goes to kindergarten.
장소 (Places).notes: 유(幼 young) appears in 유아(infant). 치(稚 childish). 원(院 institution). Preschool education for ages 3-5. Different from 어린이집(daycare).

장소 (Places).example_en: The kids are playing at the playground.
장소 (Places).notes: Native Korean. 놀이(play) + 터(ground/place). Common in apartment complexes and parks. Equipment: 그네(swing), 미끄럼틀(slide), 시소(seesaw).

장소 (Places).example_en: I go to the gym every day.
장소 (Places).notes: 체(體 body) appears in 신체(body), 구체적(specific). 육(育 raise) appears in 교육(education). 관(館 building). Fitness gym or sports gymnasium.

장소 (Places).example_en: I go to the swimming pool often in summer.
장소 (Places).notes: 수(水 water) appears in 물(water). 영(泳 swim) appears in 수영복(swimsuit). 장(場 place) appears in 시장(market), 운동장(field). Indoor pools common year-round.

장소 (Places).example_en: I got a haircut at the hair salon.
장소 (Places).notes: 미(美 beauty) appears in 미인(beauty), 아름답다(beautiful). 용(容 appearance). 실(室 room). For women; men go to 이발소(barber). Modern unisex: 헤어샵.

장소 (Places).example_en: I left my coat at the dry cleaner.
장소 (Places).notes: 세(洗 wash) appears in 세수(face washing). 탁(濯 wash). 소(所 place) appears in 장소(place), 주소(address). Both laundering and dry cleaning services.

장소 (Places).example_en: I need to get gas at the gas station.
장소 (Places).notes: 주(注 pour) appears in 주입(injection). 유(油 oil) appears in 기름(oil), 석유(petroleum). 소(所 place). Full-service common; self-service less common.

장소 (Places).example_en: I lost my wallet so I went to the police station.
장소 (Places).notes: 경(警 guard) appears in 경비(security), 경보(alarm). 찰(察 inspect) appears in 관찰(observation). 서(署 office). Emergency number: 112.

장소 (Places).example_en: The fire station is near my house.
장소 (Places).notes: 소(消 extinguish) appears in 소화(digestion). 방(防 prevent) appears in 예방(prevention). 서(署 office). Emergency number: 119 (fire AND ambulance).

장소 (Places).example_en: I lost my passport so I need to go to the embassy.
장소 (Places).notes: 대(大 big) + 사(使 envoy) appears in 사절(delegation), 천사(angel). 관(館 building). Located in major cities. Consulates in smaller cities: 영사관.

장소 (Places).example_en: I want to go to the beach in summer.
장소 (Places).notes: 해(海 sea) appears in 바다(sea), 해안(coast). 변(邊 edge) appears in 주변(surroundings), 변두리(outskirts). Famous: 해운대(Haeundae), 강릉(Gangneung beaches).

장소 (Places).example_en: I went to the mountain on the weekend.
장소 (Places).notes: Native Korean. Hiking (등산) national hobby—70% of Korea is mountains. Famous: 한라산(Hallasan), 설악산(Seoraksan), 북한산(Bukhansan). Well-maintained trails.

장소 (Places).example_en: I like eating chicken by the Han River.
장소 (Places).notes: Native Korean. Famous: 한강(Han River) through Seoul. Cultural: 치맥(치킨+맥주 chicken & beer) by riverside iconic Korean activity. Riverside parks very popular.

장소 (Places).example_en: I want to go to a jjimjilbang and rest this weekend.
장소 (Places).notes: 찜질(steaming therapy) + 방(room). 24-hour Korean bathhouse with saunas, sleeping areas, food. Affordable relaxation spot. Cultural experience: 양머리(sheep head towel), 식혜(sweet rice drink).

장소 (Places).example_en: The parking lot is in the basement.
장소 (Places).notes: 지(地 ground) appears in 지도(map), 땅(ground). 하(下 under) appears in 아래(below), 하늘(sky). Pattern: 지하 1층(B1), 지하 2층(B2).

장소 (Places).example_en: The night view from the rooftop is beautiful.
장소 (Places).notes: 옥(屋 house) appears in 옥탑방(rooftop room). 상(上 top) appears in 위(above), 이상(more than). Rooftops often used for: cafes, gardens, drying laundry.

장소 (Places).example_en: This restaurant's kitchen is very clean.
장소 (Places).notes: 주(廚 kitchen) appears in 주방장(chef). 방(房 room). More formal than 부엌. Used for commercial kitchens or formal contexts.

장소 (Places).example_en: I dry the laundry on the balcony.
장소 (Places).notes: Loanword from Portuguese 'veranda.' Most Korean apartments have balconies. Common uses: drying laundry, plants, storage. Enclosed balconies common.

장소 (Places).example_en: Don't run in the hallway.
장소 (Places).notes: 복(複 multiple) appears in 복합(complex), 복잡(complicated). 도(道 way) appears in 도로(road), 길(road). Indoor hallway connecting rooms.

장소 (Places).example_en: When it rains, I cross through the underground passage.
장소 (Places).notes: 지(地 ground) + 하(下 under) + 도(道 passage). Underground walkways common in Korean cities, connecting subway stations and buildings. Climate-controlled.

장소 (Places).example_en: If you cross the overpass, you can see the school right away.
장소 (Places).notes: 육(陸 land) appears in 육지(land, not sea). 교(橋 bridge) appears in 다리(bridge). Pedestrian bridge over roads. Alternative to crosswalks at busy intersections.

장소 (Places).example_en: There are many good restaurants in this alley.
장소 (Places).notes: Native Korean. Narrow streets between buildings. Korean alleys often have hidden gems: small restaurants, cafes, shops. Related: 골목길(alley road).

장소 (Places).example_en: A festival is being held at Gwanghwamun Plaza.
장소 (Places).notes: 광(廣 wide) appears in 광대하다(vast), 넓다(wide). 장(場 place) appears in 시장(market), 운동장(field). Famous: 광화문광장, 서울광장.

장소 (Places).example_en: In summer, children play at the fountain.
장소 (Places).notes: 분(噴 spray) appears in 분출(eruption). 수(水 water). 대(臺 platform) appears in 무대(stage), 부대(military unit). Fountains in parks and plazas.

장소 (Places).example_en: There is a beautiful garden at my grandmother's house.
장소 (Places).notes: 정(庭 courtyard) appears in 가정(household). 원(園 garden) appears in 공원(park), 동물원(zoo). Traditional Korean gardens often have pavilions, ponds.

장소 (Places).example_en: In Seoul, there are many apartments and few houses.
장소 (Places).notes: 주(住 dwell) appears in 거주(residence), 주소(address). 택(宅 house) appears in 자택(one's home), 가택(house). Single-family homes; less common than apartments in cities.

장소 (Places).example: 저 빌딩은 몇 층이에요? 정말 높아요.
장소 (Places).example_en: How many floors does that building have? It's really tall.
장소 (Places).notes: Loanword from English 'building.' Used for tall commercial/office buildings. Residential: 아파트. General structure: 건물(建物 building, Sino-Korean).

장소 (Places).example_en: I lived in a rooftop room when I was a college student.
장소 (Places).notes: 옥(屋 house) + 탑(塔 tower) + 방(room). Small rooms on building rooftops, typically affordable student/artist housing. Cultural reference: drama 옥탑방 왕세자.

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: There's a bank on the left.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: Native Korean. 왼(left) + 쪽(side/direction). 쪽 also in 오른쪽(right), 이쪽(this way), 저쪽(that way), 양쪽(both sides).

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: Go to the right.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: Native Korean. 오른(right) + 쪽(side/direction). 쪽 also in 왼쪽(left), 이쪽(this way), 저쪽(that way).

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: Let's meet in front of the school.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: Native Korean. Forms compounds: 앞으로(forward), 앞뒤(front and back), 앞사람(person in front). Opposite: 뒤(back).

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: There's a parking lot behind the building.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: Native Korean. Forms compounds: 뒤로(backward), 앞뒤(front and back), 뒤따르다(to follow). Opposite: 앞(front).

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: There's a book on top of the desk.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: Native Korean. Used in 위에(on top), 위로(upward), 위아래(up and down). Warning: don't confuse with 위험(危險 danger) which is Sino-Korean.

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: There's a bag under the chair.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: Native Korean. Used in 아래에(below), 아래로(downward), 위아래(up and down). Opposite: 위(above).

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: There's a cafe next to the post office.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: Native Korean. Forms: 옆에(next to), 바로 옆(right beside), 옆사람(person next to). Also written 엽 in archaic texts.

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: It's between the bank and the pharmacy.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: Native Korean. Used in 사이에(between), 그사이(in the meantime), 사이좋다(get along well). Time or space gaps.

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: Please go inside the building.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: Native Korean. Forms: 안에(inside), 집안(household/indoors), 안팎(inside and outside). Opposite: 밖(outside).

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: It's raining outside.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: Native Korean. Forms: 밖에(outside), 밖으로(outward), 안밖(inside and outside). Opposite: 안(inside).

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: Can I sit here?
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: Native Korean. Part of proximity system: 여기(here, near speaker) vs 거기(there, near listener) vs 저기(over there, far from both).

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: Please wait there.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: Native Korean. Part of proximity system: refers to place near listener or previously mentioned. Forms: 거기저기(here and there).

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: What's that building you can see over there?
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: Native Korean. Part of proximity system: refers to place far from both speaker and listener. Forms: 저기저기(various far places).

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: Please come this way.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: Native Korean. 이(this) + 쪽(direction). Part of 이/그/저 system. Directional equivalent of 여기(here).

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: If you go that way, there's a station.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: Native Korean. 그(that) + 쪽(direction). Part of 이/그/저 system. Directional equivalent of 거기(there).

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: The restroom is over that way.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: Native Korean. 저(that over there) + 쪽(direction). Part of 이/그/저 system. Directional equivalent of 저기(over there).

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: It's close from here.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: Native Korean. Adverb form of 가깝다(to be close). Conjugation: 가까워요, 가까웠어요. Opposite: 멀리(far away).

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: My home is far from the office.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: Native Korean. Adverb form of 멀다(to be far). Conjugation: 멀어요, 멀었어요. Used for physical and emotional distance.

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: There's a mart across from the bank.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: Native Korean. 건너(across, from 건너다 'to cross') + 편(side). Similar: 맞은편(opposite side).

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: There's a cafe on the opposite side of the station.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: Native Korean. 맞은(facing, from 맞다 'to face') + 편(side). Often interchangeable with 건너편.

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: Go straight on this road.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: 직(直 straight) appears in 직선(straight line), 정직(honesty), 직각(right angle). 진(進 advance) appears in 진행(progress), 진입(entry).

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: Go right at the intersection.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: Phrase. 오른쪽(right side) + -으로(direction particle) + 가세요(polite imperative 'go'). Use at 사거리(intersection).

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: Go left at the convenience store.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: Phrase. 왼쪽(left side) + -으로(direction particle) + 가세요(polite imperative 'go'). Common direction instruction.

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: Where is the restroom?
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: Phrase. 어디(where) + -에(location particle) + 있어요(exist, polite). Most common way to ask 'where is it?'

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: Can I go this way?
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: Native Korean. Forms: 길을 잃다(get lost), 길을 건너다(cross street), 지름길(shortcut). Essential for directions.

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: Please show me the map.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: 지(地 land) appears in 지역(region), 지리(geography), 지하(underground). 도(圖 diagram) appears in 도표(chart), 도안(design).

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: If you turn the corner, there's a cafe.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: Native Korean. From 모(corner) + 퉁이(rounded edge). Forms: 모퉁이를 돌다(turn corner). Related: 모서리(edge, corner).

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: Go left at the intersection.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: 사(四 four) appears in 사계절(four seasons), 사각형(square). 거리 is native Korean for 'street.' Literally 'four-way street.'

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: Cross at the crosswalk.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: 횡단(橫斷 crossing) appears in 횡단(traverse), 횡선(horizontal line). 보도(步道 walkway) appears in 인도(sidewalk), 보행자(pedestrian).

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: Come out through exit 3.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: 출(出 exit) appears in 출발(departure), 출장(business trip), 출입(in and out). 구(口 opening) appears in 입구(entrance), 구멍(hole).

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: Seoul is in the northern part of Korea.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: 북(北 north) appears in 북한(North Korea), 북극(North Pole), 북부(northern region). 쪽 is native Korean for 'direction.'

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: Busan is in the south.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: 남(南 south) appears in 남한(South Korea), 남극(South Pole), 동남아(Southeast Asia). 쪽 is native Korean for 'direction.'

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: The sun rises in the east.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: 동(東 east) appears in 동해(East Sea), 동아시아(East Asia), 동부(eastern region). 쪽 is native Korean for 'direction.'

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: The sun sets in the west.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: 서(西 west) appears in 서해(West Sea), 서울(Seoul, though etymology debated), 서부(western region). 쪽 is native Korean for 'direction.'

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: There's a fountain in the center of the plaza.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: 중(中 middle) appears in 중간(middle), 중심(center), 중앙정부(central government). 앙(央 center) appears in 중앙선(center line).

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: There's a cafe at the end of this street.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: Native Korean. Conjugation: 끝나다(to end), 끝내다(to finish). Forms: 끝부분(final part). Opposite: 처음(beginning).

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: I'll explain again from the beginning.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: Native Korean. Forms: 처음부터(from the start), 처음이다(it's the first time). Opposite: 끝(end).

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: The pharmacy is on the opposite side of the street.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: 반대(反對 opposite) appears in 반대하다(to oppose), 반대말(opposite word), 정반대(exact opposite). 쪽 is native Korean for 'side.'

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: Please go up the stairs.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: 계(階 steps) appears in 계층(social class), 계급(rank), 단계(stage). 단(段 level) appears in 단계(stage), 수단(means).

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: The elevator is broken.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: English loanword 'elevator.' Often shortened to 엘베 in casual speech. Used with 타다(ride), 내리다(get off).

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: Take the escalator to this floor.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: English loanword 'escalator.' Used with 타다(ride), 내려가다(go down). Common in 지하철(subway), 백화점(department store).

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: Is there a bank nearby?
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: 근(近 near) appears in 접근(approach), 근무(work at a place), 최근(recent). 처(處 place) appears in 장소(location), 처지(situation).

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: The cafe is on the first floor.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: Number + 층. 층(層 floor) appears in 2층(second floor), 지하층(basement floor). Korea uses American system: 1층 = ground floor.

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: We have to go around because of construction.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: Native Korean compound. 돌다(to turn/rotate) + -아 + 가다(to go). Conjugation: 돌아가요, 돌아갔어요. Can mean 'detour' or 'return home.'

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: If you pass the bank, you'll see the school.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: Native Korean compound. 지나다(to pass) + -아 + 가다(to go). Conjugation: 지나가요, 지나갔어요. Also means 'time passes.'

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: Just follow this road.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: Native Korean compound. 따르다(to follow) + -아 + 가다(to go). Conjugation: 따라가요, 따라갔어요. Used for following people or directions.

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: Please cross at the crosswalk.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: Native Korean compound. 건너다(to cross) + -아 + 가다(to go). Conjugation: 건너가요, 건너갔어요. Use with 길(street), 다리(bridge).

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: Turn right at the next corner.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: Native Korean. Conjugation: 돌아요, 돌았어요. Meanings: turn, rotate, spin. Forms: 한 바퀴 돌다(go around once).

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: Please place it horizontally.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: 가로(horizontal) contrasts with 세로(vertical). Used in 가로등(street lamp), 가로수(roadside tree). Some Chinese influence on usage.

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: Please stand it up vertically.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: Native Korean. 세우다(to stand/erect) + -로(direction). Contrasts with 가로(horizontal). Used in dimensions and orientation.

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: This store is really good.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: Native Korean. Forms: 가게 주인(store owner), 가게를 열다(open a store), 가게 문을 닫다(close shop).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: There are a lot of items.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 물(物 thing) appears in 물품(goods), 물자(materials), 동물(animal). 건(件 item) appears in 사건(incident), 조건(condition).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: Let's go buy a gift.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: Native Korean. Conjugation: 사요, 샀어요. Forms: 사 주다(buy for someone), -(으)러 가다(go to buy). Opposite: 팔다(sell).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: What do they sell here?
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: Native Korean. ㄹ-irregular verb: drops ㄹ before ㄴ, ㅂ. Conjugation: 팔아요, 팔았어요. Passive: 팔리다(be sold).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: The price is a bit expensive.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 가(價 price) appears in 가치(value), 시가(market price), 정가(list price). 격(格 level) appears in 자격(qualification), 격식(formality).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: How much is this?
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: Phrase. 얼마(how much, native) + -예요(polite copula). Essential shopping phrase. Point at item while asking.

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: It's too expensive. Please give me a discount.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: Native Korean. Conjugation: 비싸요, 비쌌어요. Forms: 너무 비싸다(too expensive). Opposite: 싸다(cheap).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: This place is really cheap!
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: Native Korean. Two meanings: cheap (Conjugation: 싸요, 쌌어요) and to wrap (싸요, 쌌어요). Context determines meaning.

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: Is it on discount?
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 할(割 divide/cut) appears in 분할(division), 할당(allocation). 인(引 pull/draw) appears in 인용(quotation), 인하(reduction). Common: 할인 쿠폰.

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: Is there a sale now?
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: English loanword 'sale.' Used with -하다: 세일해요(having a sale). Common: 세일 기간(sale period), 세일 행사(sale event).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: I'd like to exchange the size.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: Native Korean. ㅜ-irregular conjugation: 바꿔요, 바꿨어요. General word for change/switch/exchange. Forms: 바꿔 드릴게요(I'll exchange it for you).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: Can I get a refund?
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 환(還 return) appears in 회환(return trip), 환급(refund/reimbursement). 불(拂 pay) appears in 지불(payment), 납불(payment). Used with -받다, -하다.

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: Is an exchange possible?
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 교(交 exchange) appears in 교류(exchange/interaction), 교체(replacement). 환(換 swap) appears in 전환(conversion), 교체(change).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: Do you have a different size?
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: English loanword 'size.' Used with -가(subject): 사이즈가 안 맞다(doesn't fit). Common: 프리사이즈(free size/one-size-fits-all).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example: 이거 좀 커요. 작은 거 있어요?
쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: This is a bit big. Do you have a small one?
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: Native Korean. ㅡ-irregular: modifier form is 큰. Conjugation: 커요, 컸어요. Forms: 크기(size, noun). Opposite: 작다.

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: This one is too small.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: Native Korean. ㅡ-irregular: modifier form is 작은. Conjugation: 작아요, 작았어요. Opposite: 크다(big).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: Do you have other colors?
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 색(色 color) appears in 색조(tone), 색상(color/hue). 깔 is native Korean emphasizing the nuance. Alternative: 색(color alone).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: Please give me the red one.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: Native Korean color + 색. 빨갛다(to be red) → 빨간(red, modifier). Other colors: 파란색(blue), 노란색(yellow).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: The blue one is prettier.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: Native Korean color + 색. 파랗다(to be blue) → 파란(blue, modifier). Other colors: 빨간색(red), 하얀색(white).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: Do you have black pants?
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: Native Korean color + 색. 검다(to be black) → 검은(black, modifier). Also: 까만색(deep black). Other colors: 흰색(white).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: The white one looks the cleanest.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: Native Korean color + 색. 하얗다(to be white) → 하얀(white, modifier). Also: 흰색(simpler form). Other colors: 검은색(black).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: I'll pay by card. Here you go.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: Phrase. 카드(card, loanword) + -로(by means of) + 할게요(I'll do, future commitment). Standard payment phrase.

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: I'll pay cash. Do you have change?
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: Phrase. 현금(現金 cash) + -로(by means of) + 할게요(I'll do). Some stores offer cash discounts.

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: Do you need a bag?
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: Native Korean. Refers to 비닐봉투(plastic bag) or 종이봉투(paper bag). Cost: typically 50-100원. Eco-tip: bring reusable bag.

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: Receipt, please. I need to submit it to my company.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: Phrase. 영수증(領收證 receipt) + 주세요(please give). Keep for returns, exchanges, and tax deductions.

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: Can I try on this dress?
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: Phrase. 입다(wear clothes) + -어 보다(try doing) + -아도 되다(may I). Essential fitting room question.

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: Excuse me, how much is this?
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: Phrase. 이거(this, colloquial for 이것) + 얼마예요(how much). Point at item while asking.

쇼핑 (Shopping).example: 좀 깎아 주세요. 두 개 살게요.
쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: Please give a discount. I'll buy two.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: Phrase. 깎다(to cut/discount) + -아 주세요(please do for me). Use ONLY at 전통시장(traditional market), not chain stores.

쇼핑 (Shopping).example: 마음에 안 들어요. 다른 거 있어요?
쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: I don't like it. Do you have something else?
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: Phrase. 다른(different/other) + 거(thing, colloquial for 것) + 있어요(do you have). Polite way to request alternatives.

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: I bought new shoes.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: Native Korean. 신다(to wear shoes) + 발(foot). Forms: 신발을 신다(put on shoes), 신발장(shoe cabinet).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: There are a lot of pretty clothes.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: Native Korean. Forms: 옷가게(clothing store), 옷을 입다(wear clothes), 옷걸이(clothes hanger), 의류(apparel, Sino-Korean).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: These pants are comfortable.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: Native Korean. Always plural in meaning. Forms: 청바지(jeans), 반바지(shorts). Verb: 입다(wear pants).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: The skirt is too short.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: Native Korean. Forms: 미니치마(mini skirt), 긴 치마(long skirt), 치마저고리(traditional hanbok skirt and top).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: You look cooler when you wear a hat.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: Native Korean. Use 쓰다(wear) for hats/glasses, NOT 입다(wear clothes). Forms: 야구 모자(baseball cap), 모자를 쓰다(wear hat).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: The bag is heavy.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: Native Korean. Forms: 책가방(school bag), 가방을 메다(carry bag on shoulder), 배낭(backpack), 핸드백(handbag).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: These days I do a lot of online shopping.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: Loanword compound. 온라인(online from English) + 쇼핑(shopping from English). Korea has huge online shopping market: 쿠팡, 11번가.

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: How long does delivery take?
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 배(配 distribute) appears in 배달(delivery), 배치(arrangement). 송(送 send) appears in 송신(transmission), 발송(dispatch). Forms: 배송비(shipping cost).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: It's free shipping for orders over 30,000 won.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 무료(無料 free) appears in 무료 체험(free trial), 무료 샘플(free sample). 배송(delivery). Common threshold: 30,000원 이상(over 30,000 won).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: The package arrived.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 택(託 entrust) appears in 위탁(consignment). 배(配 deliver) appears in 배송(delivery). Korea's main parcel system: CJ, 한진, 로젠.

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: I ordered it online.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 주문(注文 order) appears in 주문서(order form), 주문 취소(cancel order). Works for both restaurants and shopping. Conjugation: 주문해요, 주문했어요.

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: I put it in the shopping cart.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: Native Korean compound. 장(market) + 바구니(basket). Used for physical shopping carts and online shopping carts.

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: I'll pay by card.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 결(決 settle) appears in 결정(decision), 결심(resolution). 제(濟 pay) appears in 경제(economy). Forms: 결제 수단(payment method), 결제 완료(payment complete).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: Can I pay by credit card?
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 신용(信用 credit) appears in 신용 등급(credit rating), 신용 조회(credit check). 카드(card from English). High usage rate in Korea.

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: You need to have a balance for a debit card.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 체크(check from English) + 카드(card from English). Debit card that draws directly from bank account. Popular with younger Koreans.

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: I'll collect the points.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: English loanword 'points.' Forms: 포인트 적립(earn points), 포인트로 사다(buy with points). All major Korean stores have point systems.

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: If you have a coupon, you get a discount.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: French/English loanword 'coupon.' Mobile coupons (모바일 쿠폰) very common in apps like 쿠팡. Forms: 쿠폰 사용(use coupon).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: The size doesn't fit so I'd like to exchange it.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 교환(交換 exchange) appears in 교환 가능(exchangeable), 교환 기간(exchange period). Conjugation: 교환해요, 교환했어요. For swapping items of same value.

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: Returns are possible within seven days.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 반(返 return) appears in 반송(return shipment), 왕복(round trip). 품(品 goods) appears in 품질(quality), 상품(product). Forms: 반품 기간(return period).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: This is a defective item. Please exchange it.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 불량(不良 defective) appears in 불량 식품(defective food). 품(品 product) appears in 제품(product), 상품(goods). Grounds for immediate exchange/refund.

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: It sold out quickly because it was popular.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 품(品 goods) appears in 상품(product), 제품(product). 절(絕 cut off) appears in 절약(saving), 단절(severance). Alternative: 매진(sold out).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: New arrivals came out today.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 신(新 new) appears in 신제품(new product), 신년(new year). 상품(商品 product) appears in 상품권(gift certificate). Literally 'new goods.'

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: It's much cheaper if you buy it secondhand.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 중(中 middle) appears in 중간(middle), 중소기업(small-medium business). 고(古 old) appears in 고대(ancient times). Popular: 중고나라(secondhand marketplace app).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: What brand do you like?
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: English loanword 'brand.' Forms: 명품 브랜드(luxury brand), 국내 브랜드(domestic brand). Korea is major luxury shopping destination.

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: These pants don't fit.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: Phrase. 사이즈(size) + -가(subject) + 안(not) + 맞다(fit). Common exchange reason. Alternative: 사이즈가 작아요/커요.

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: Do you have this T-shirt in other colors?
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: Phrase. 다른(other) + 색(color) + 있어요(do you have). Essential shopping question when browsing clothing.

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: The weather is really nice today.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: Native Korean. 날(day) + 씨(seed/element, adds nuance). Common: 날씨 좋다(nice weather), 날씨 예보(weather forecast).

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: It's too hot in summer.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: Native Korean. ㅂ-irregular: 더워요, 더웠어요. For weather/air temperature. Different from 뜨겁다(hot to touch). Opposite: 춥다.

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: It's really cold outside today.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: Native Korean. ㅂ-irregular: 추워요, 추웠어요. For weather/air temperature. For cold objects/drinks use 차갑다. Opposite: 덥다.

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: When spring comes, the weather is warm.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: Native Korean. Conjugation: 따뜻해요, 따뜻했어요. Describes weather, clothing, or personality (warm-hearted). Pleasant temperature between 춥다 and 덥다.

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: The breeze is refreshing.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: Native Korean. Conjugation: 시원해요, 시원했어요. Means both 'cool' (weather) and 'refreshing' (breeze, drinks). Opposite: 덥다.

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: It's raining a lot, so I need an umbrella.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: Native Korean. Forms: 비가 오다(to rain), 비를 맞다(get rained on), 빗소리(sound of rain). Warning: 빗(comb) is different word.

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: It will rain tomorrow.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: Phrase. 비(rain) + -가(subject) + 오다(to come). Literally 'rain comes.' Conjugation: 와요, 왔어요, 올 거예요(will rain).

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: The first snow has fallen!
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: Native Korean. Two meanings: snow and eye. Context makes it clear. Forms: 눈이 오다(to snow), 첫눈(first snow, culturally special).

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: It snows a lot in winter.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: Phrase. 눈(snow) + -이(subject) + 오다(to come). Alternative: 눈이 내리다(snow falls). Conjugation: 와요, 왔어요.

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: The wind is blowing hard today.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: Native Korean. Two meanings: wind and wish/hope. Forms: 바람이 불다(wind blows), 강한 바람(strong wind), 바람을 쐬다(get fresh air).

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: A cool breeze is blowing on the mountain.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: Phrase. 바람(wind) + -이(subject) + 불다(to blow). Conjugation: 불어요, 불었어요. Also: 촛불을 불다(blow out candles).

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: The sky is clear so I feel good.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: Native Korean. ㄱ-irregular: 맑아요, 맑았어요. Describes clear sky or clear water. Forms: 맑은 날씨(clear weather). Opposite: 흐리다.

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: The sky is cloudy today.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: Native Korean. Conjugation: 흐려요, 흐렸어요. Describes cloudy/overcast sky. Also means 'blurry/dim' for vision. Opposite: 맑다.

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: There are many clouds so the sun isn't visible.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: Native Korean. Forms: 구름이 끼다(clouds gather), 구름이 걷히다(clouds clear). Types: 흰 구름(white clouds), 먹구름(dark clouds).

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: There was a lot of fog this morning.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: Native Korean. Forms: 안개가 끼다(fog sets in), 안개 속(in the fog). Heavy fog is called 짙은 안개.

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: A typhoon is coming, so we need to be careful.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 태(颱 typhoon) appears in 태평양(Pacific Ocean). 풍(風 wind) appears in 폭풍(storm), 강풍(strong wind). Korea experiences typhoons late summer/early fall.

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: I didn't bring an umbrella so I got rained on.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: Native Korean. Forms: 우산을 쓰다(use/carry umbrella), 우산을 펴다(open umbrella), 우산을 접다(close umbrella).

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: During the rainy season, it rains every day.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 장(長 long) appears in 장시간(long time), 장거리(long distance). 마 is native element meaning 'rain.' June-July rainy season in Korea.

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: In spring, many flowers bloom.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: Native Korean. Forms: 봄날(spring day), 봄꽃(spring flowers), 벚꽃(cherry blossoms). March-May. Common: 봄이 되다(spring comes).

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: I want to go to the sea in summer.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: Native Korean. Forms: 여름방학(summer vacation), 한여름(midsummer). June-August. Hot and humid with 장마(rainy season).

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: In autumn, the fall foliage is really beautiful.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: Native Korean. Forms: 가을 날씨(autumn weather), 단풍(autumn leaves/foliage). September-November. Best season for hiking and viewing 단풍.

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: In winter, you have to wear warm clothes.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: Native Korean. Forms: 겨울방학(winter vacation), 겨울옷(winter clothes). December-February. Very cold with frequent snow.

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: Today the temperature is 30 degrees.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 온(溫 warmth) appears in 온천(hot spring), 보온(heat retention). 도(度 degree) appears in 각도(angle), 속도(speed).

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: It's too humid in summer.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 습(濕 damp) appears in 습도(humidity), 습기(moisture), 제습기(dehumidifier). Conjugation: 습해요, 습했어요. Korea's summers are very 습해요.

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: In winter, the air is dry.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 건조(乾燥 dry) appears in 건조기(dryer), 피부 건조(dry skin). Conjugation: 건조해요, 건조했어요. Korea's winters are very 건조해요.

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: The fine dust is bad, so I wear a mask.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 미세(微細 fine) appears in 미세한(minute), 미세 조정(fine adjustment). 먼지(dust, native). Serious air quality issue, especially spring.

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: The weather forecast said it will be clear tomorrow.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 일기(日氣 daily weather) appears in 날씨(weather). 예보(豫報 forecast) appears in 예측(prediction), 일기 예보(weather forecast). Check daily!

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: When the sun rises, the weather gets warm.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: Native Korean. Two meanings: sun and year. Forms: 해가 뜨다(sun rises), 해가 지다(sun sets). Related: 일출(sunrise), 일몰(sunset).

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: The moon is really bright tonight.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: Native Korean. Two meanings: moon and month. Forms: 달이 뜨다(moon rises), 보름달(full moon). Cultural: 추석(harvest festival) celebrates full moon.

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: You can see many stars in the countryside.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: Native Korean. Two meanings: star and celebrity. Forms: 별을 보다(watch stars), 별똥별(shooting star), 유명한 별(famous celebrity).

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: A sudden rain shower came.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: Native Korean. Brief, heavy rain shower. Forms: 소나기가 오다(sudden rain comes), 소나기를 피하다(avoid sudden rain). Also famous Korean short story title.

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: The sound of thunder is scary.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 천둥(天雷 thunder, Sino-Korean) appears in 천둥이 치다(thunder strikes). Often paired: 천둥과 번개(thunder and lightning).

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: Lightning flashed.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: Native Korean. Forms: 번개가 치다(lightning strikes), 번쩍(flash, onomatopoeia). Often paired with 천둥(thunder). Formal: 낙뢰(lightning strike).

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: The car got damaged because hail fell.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: Native Korean (possibly Sino-Korean influenced). Forms: 우박이 내리다(hail falls). Frozen precipitation that damages vehicles and crops.

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: The drought is severe this year.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: Native Korean. From 가물다(to be dry/lacking rain). Forms: 가뭄이 들다(drought sets in), 가뭄 피해(drought damage).

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: Frost settled in the morning.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: Native Korean. Forms: 서리가 내리다(frost settles), 서릿발(frost crystals). Late autumn and early winter phenomenon.

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: Dew has formed on the grass blades.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: Native Korean. Forms: 이슬이 맺히다(dew forms), 이슬비(drizzle). Poetic: 아침 이슬(morning dew, also famous Korean song title).

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: The heat wave is intense this summer.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: Native Korean compound. 무(intensifier) + 더위(heat from 덥다). Forms: 무더운 날씨(sweltering weather). Formal news term: 폭염(heat wave).

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example: 한파가 와서 영하 이십 도까지 내려갔어요.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: A cold wave came and it dropped to minus twenty degrees.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 한(寒 cold) appears in 한겨울(midwinter), 추한(cold). 파(波 wave) appears in 파도(ocean wave), 열파(heat wave). Winter cold snaps in Korea.

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: The yellow dust was bad so I wore a mask.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 황(黃 yellow) appears in 황색(yellow color), 황금(gold). 사(沙 sand) appears in 모래(sand), 사막(desert). Yellow dust from China, spring problem.

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: The wind chill temperature is minus ten degrees.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 체감(體感 felt sensation) appears in 체감하다(to feel/sense). 온도(temperature). Wind chill factor: often much colder than actual temperature.

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: Today's high temperature is thirty-five degrees.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 최고(最高 highest) appears in 최고가(highest price), 최고점(peak). 기온(氣溫 air temperature). Daily high, usually afternoon.

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: Tomorrow's low temperature is minus five degrees.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 최저(最低 lowest) appears in 최저가(lowest price), 최저선(bottom line). 기온(氣溫 air temperature). Daily low, usually dawn/early morning.

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: The temperature dropped suddenly.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 기(氣 air) appears in 공기(air), 날씨(weather), 기후(climate). 온(溫 warmth) appears in 온도(temperature), 체온(body temperature).

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: In winter it drops below zero.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 영(零 zero) appears in 영점(zero point). 하(下 below) appears in 아래(below), 하강(descent). Used with degrees: 영하 5도(minus 5 degrees).

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: During the day it goes up to five degrees above zero.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 영(零 zero) appears in 영점(zero point). 상(上 above) appears in 위(above), 상승(rise). Used with degrees: 영상 5도(5 degrees above zero).

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: I went to the beach to see the sunrise.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 일(日 sun) appears in 일몰(sunset), 일요일(Sunday), 일광(sunlight). 출(出 come out) appears in 출발(departure), 출현(appearance).

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: Sunset time is getting earlier.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 일(日 sun) appears in 일출(sunrise), 일기 예보(weather forecast). 몰(沒 sink) appears in 몰락(downfall). Poetic: 노을(sunset glow).

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: Let's rest in the shade.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: Native Korean. Forms: 나무 그늘(tree shade), 그늘에서 쉬다(rest in shade), 시원한 그늘(cool shade). Opposite: 양지(sunny spot).

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: It's warm if you sit in the sunny spot.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 양(陽 sun) appears in 태양(sun), 양지바른(sunny). 지(地 land) appears in 땅(land), 지역(region). Opposite: 음지(shady spot).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: My head hurt so I took medicine.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: Native Korean. Means both 'head' and 'hair.' 머리카락(strand of hair). Common: 머리가 아프다(have a headache), 머리를 감다(wash hair), 머리를 자르다(get a haircut).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: I wash my face in the morning.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: Native Korean. 얼굴을 씻다(wash face), 얼굴이 빨개지다(face turns red). Also in 상대방(the other person/party).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: My eyes are tired so I want to rest a bit.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: Native Korean. Also means 'snow' - context makes it clear. 눈이 나쁘다(have bad eyesight), 눈을 감다(close eyes), 눈치가 빠르다(quick to read situations).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: I caught a cold and my nose is stuffed.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: Native Korean. 코가 막히다(nose is stuffed), 코피(nosebleed), 코를 풀다(blow nose).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: Please open your mouth wide.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: Native Korean. 입을 열다(open mouth), 입이 짧다(picky eater), 입맛(appetite). Different from 입다(to wear).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example: 음악을 너무 크게 들으면 귀가 아파요.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: If you listen to music too loud, your ears hurt.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: Native Korean. 귀가 어둡다(hard of hearing), 귀를 기울이다(listen carefully), 귀걸이(earrings).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: I brush my teeth three times a day.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: Native Korean 이, Sino-Korean 치아. 이를 닦다(brush teeth), 이가 아프다(tooth hurts), 충치(cavity), 이빨(informal for teeth).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: My throat hurts so I can't talk.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: Native Korean. Means both 'neck' and 'throat.' 목이 쉬다(voice is hoarse), 목을 축이다(wet one's throat), 목소리(voice).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: If you use the computer for a long time, your shoulders hurt.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: Native Korean. 어깨가 무겁다(feel heavy responsibility), 어깨동무(arm around shoulder), 어깨를 으쓱하다(shrug).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: I exercised a lot so my arms hurt.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: Native Korean. 팔을 벌리다(spread arms), 팔짱을 끼다(fold arms), 팔꿈치(elbow). Different from 팔다(to sell).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: I wash my hands before eating.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: Native Korean. 손을 씻다(wash hands), 손이 크다(generous), 손님(guest). Related: 손가락(finger).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: I cut my finger while cooking.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: Native Korean. 손(hand) + 가락(long thin object). 엄지손가락(thumb), 검지(index finger), 약지(ring finger). 손가락질하다(point at).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: When I exercise, my chest pounds.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: Native Korean. Refers to chest/breast and figuratively 'heart.' 가슴이 아프다(heartache), 가슴이 두근거리다(heart pounds).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: I'm hungry. Let's go eat!
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: Native Korean. 배가 고프다(hungry), 배가 부르다(full), 배탈(stomachache). Also means 'ship' or 'pear' - context makes it clear.

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: If you sit for a long time, your back hurts.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: Native Korean. 등을 돌리다(turn one's back), 등이 굽다(hunched back). Also counter for 'rank' - context differs.

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: I hurt my lower back lifting something heavy.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: Native Korean. 허리가 가늘다(slim waist), 허리를 숙이다(bow), 허리띠(belt).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: I walked a lot so my legs hurt.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: Native Korean. 다리가 길다(long legs), 다리를 꼬다(cross legs). Also means 'bridge' - context makes it clear.

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: The new shoes are small so my feet hurt.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: Native Korean. 발이 크다(big feet), 발을 구르다(stomp), 발바닥(sole of foot), 발가락(toe).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: I fell and hurt my knee.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: Native Korean. 무릎을 꿇다(kneel), 무릎을 치다(slap knee in realization). 무릎팍(kneecap area).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).english: to hurt; to be sick/in pain
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: Where does it hurt?
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: Native Korean adjective. Irregular ㅡ conjugation: 아파요, 아팠어요. 아픈(hurting), 아프면(if it hurts). ~가 아프다(something hurts).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: I caught a cold so I'm resting at home.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: 감(感 feeling/sensation) appears in 감사(thanks), 감정(emotion). 기(氣 energy/spirit) appears in 기분(mood), 공기(air). Seasonal illness.

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: I had a fever so I couldn't go to school.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: 열(熱 heat/fever) appears in 열정(passion), 열대(tropical), 발열(fever). Different from 열(ten) or 열다(to open).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: My cough won't stop.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: Native Korean 기침. 기침하다(to cough), 기침약(cough medicine), 기침이 나다(cough comes out).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: My headache was bad so I took medicine.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: 두(頭 head) appears in 두뇌(brain), 두개골(skull). 통(痛 pain) appears in 통증(pain), 복통(stomachache), 치통(toothache).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: I ate spoiled food and got a stomachache.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: Native Korean. 배(stomach) + 탈(trouble). 배탈이 나다(get stomachache). Often from spoiled food or overeating.

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: Please take the medicine after eating.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: 약(藥 medicine) appears in 약품(pharmaceutical), 약제(medicine), 약사(pharmacist). Also 약(weak) - different character and context.

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: I bought cold medicine at the pharmacy.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: 약(藥 medicine) appears in 약사(pharmacist), 진통제(painkiller). 국(局 office/bureau) appears in 우체국(post office), 방송국(broadcasting station).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: I was sick so I went to the hospital.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: 병(病 sick) appears in 질병(disease), 병실(ward). 원(院 institution) appears in 학원(academy), 입원(hospitalization), 퇴원(discharge).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: The doctor prescribed medicine for me.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: 의(醫 medical) appears in 의학(medicine), 의료(medical care). 사(師 master/expert) appears in 간호사(nurse), 요리사(chef), 교사(teacher).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: The nurse gave me a shot.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: 간호(看護 care/nursing) appears in 간호하다(to nurse), 간병(care). 사(師 master) appears in 의사(doctor), 교사(teacher). Female-dominated profession.

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: I'm relieved the surgery went well.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: 수(手 hand) appears in 수화(sign language), 수공(handcraft). 술(術 technique) appears in 기술(technology), 미술(art), 심폐소생술(CPR).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: I'm scared of shots.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: 주(注 inject) appears in 주입(inject), 주의(attention). 사(射 shoot) appears in 발사(launch), 사격(shooting). 주사를 맞다(get injection).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: I'm going to the hospital for a health checkup.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: 검사(檢査 examine/inspect) appears in 검진(checkup), 검토(review). Different from 검사(prosecutor). 검사를 받다(undergo examination).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: I have a cat allergy.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: Loanword from German 'Allergie.' 알레르기가 있다(have allergies), 알레르기 반응(allergic reaction). Common: 음식 알레르기(food allergy).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: I exercise every day for my health.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: 운동(運動 exercise/sport) - 운(運 move/transport) appears in 운반(transport), 행운(luck). 동(動 move) appears in 동작(movement), 활동(activity).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: Our grandmother is very healthy.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: 건강(健康 health) - 건(健 strong) appears in 건전(sound/healthy). 강(康 healthy) appears in 강건(robust). Common wish: 건강하세요(stay healthy).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: I worked a lot today so I'm tired.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: 피곤(疲困 tired) - 피(疲 fatigue) appears in 피로(fatigue). 곤(困 difficulty) appears in 곤란(difficulty). Irregular 하다: 피곤해요.

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: I couldn't sleep last night.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: Native Korean. 잠을 자다(sleep), 잠이 오다(feel sleepy), 잠에서 깨다(wake from sleep), 잠꾸러기(sleepyhead).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: I usually sleep at 11 PM.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: Native Korean. Irregular: 자요, 잤어요. 잘 자요(sleep well), 늦잠(oversleeping). Different from 자(ruler/measure).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).english: to wake up; to get up
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: I wake up at 7 in the morning.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: Native Korean. 일어나다(wake/rise up). 일찍 일어나다(wake early), 늦게 일어나다(wake late). Also means 'happen/occur.'

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example: 혈압이 높으면 소금을 적게 먹어야 해요.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: If your blood pressure is high, you should eat less salt.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: 혈(血 blood) appears in 혈액(blood), 혈관(blood vessel). 압(壓 pressure) appears in 압력(pressure), 기압(atmospheric pressure). 혈압을 재다(measure blood pressure).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example: 당뇨가 있으면 단 음식을 조심해야 해요.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: If you have diabetes, you need to be careful with sweet foods.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: 당뇨(糖尿 diabetes) - 당(糖 sugar) appears in 당분(sugar content), 설탕(sugar). 뇨(尿 urine) appears in 소변(urine). Type 1: 1형 당뇨.

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example: 이 병은 치료가 가능해요. 걱정하지 마세요.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: This illness is treatable. Don't worry.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: 치료(治療 treatment) - 치(治 heal/govern) appears in 정치(politics), 치안(public order). 료(療 heal) appears in 의료(medical care), 요양(recuperation).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: I got a prescription from the doctor.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: 처방(處方 prescription) - 처(處 handle) appears in 처리(process). 방(方 method) appears in 방법(method). 전(箋 note) appears in 전단(flyer).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example: 어떤 증상이 있어요? 자세히 말해 주세요.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: What symptoms do you have? Please tell me in detail.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: 증상(症狀 symptom) - 증(症 illness) appears in 병증(disease symptom). 상(狀 state/condition) appears in 상태(state), 현상(phenomenon).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: My body temperature is 38 degrees. I have a fever.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: 체온(體溫 body temperature) - 체(體 body) appears in 신체(body), 체중(weight). 온(溫 warm) appears in 온도(temperature), 온천(hot spring).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example: 밥을 너무 빨리 먹으면 소화가 안 돼요.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: If you eat too fast, you can't digest well.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: 소화(消化 digestion) - 소(消 disappear) appears in 소비(consume), 소멸(extinction). 화(化 change) appears in 변화(change), 문화(culture).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: If your immunity is weak, you easily catch colds.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: 면역(免疫 immunity) - 면(免 escape) appears in 면제(exemption). 역(疫 epidemic) appears in 역병(plague), 방역(quarantine). 면역력(immune strength).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example: 요즘 스트레스를 많이 받아요. 쉬고 싶어요.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: I'm very stressed lately. I want to rest.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: Loanword from English 'stress.' 스트레스를 받다(receive stress), 스트레스 해소(stress relief). Very common in modern Korean culture.

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: I take vitamins every day. They're good for health.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: Loanword from English 'vitamin.' Types: 비타민 C, 비타민 D. 멀티비타민(multivitamin), 비타민제(vitamin supplement).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: I'm on a diet, so I eat less for dinner.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: Loanword from English 'diet.' Always means weight loss, not general diet. 다이어트하다(to diet), 다이어트 중(on a diet). Very popular topic.

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: I gained weight. I need to start exercising.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: 체중(體重 body weight) - 체(體 body) appears in 신체(body), 체력(stamina). 중(重 heavy/weight) appears in 중량(weight), 무거움(heaviness).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: How tall are you? I'm 170cm.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: Loanword from English 'key' but used for height. 키가 크다(tall), 키가 작다(short). Also used for actual keys in some contexts.

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: If you have good stamina, you don't get tired.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: 체력(體力 stamina) - 체(體 body) appears in 신체(body), 체중(weight). 력(力 strength) appears in 능력(ability), 노력(effort), 전력(full power).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: I get a health checkup every year. It's important.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: 건강(健康 health) + 검진(檢診 checkup). 검(檢 inspect) appears in 검사(examination). 진(診 diagnose) appears in 진단(diagnosis), 진료(medical treatment).

교통 (Transportation).example_en: I take the bus to school every day.
교통 (Transportation).notes: Loanword from English 'bus.' Types: 시내버스(city bus), 고속버스(express bus), 마을버스(village bus). 버스 정류장(bus stop), 버스 카드(bus card).

교통 (Transportation).example_en: In Seoul, the subway is the most convenient.
교통 (Transportation).notes: 지하(地下 underground) - 지(地 ground) appears in 지도(map), 토지(land). 하(下 below) appears in 하늘(sky-opposite), 아래(below). 철(鐵 iron/rail) appears in 철도(railroad).

교통 (Transportation).example_en: I was late so I took a taxi.
교통 (Transportation).notes: Loanword from English 'taxi.' Types: 모범택시(deluxe taxi), 콜택시(call taxi), 카카오택시(Kakao taxi app). 택시 미터기(taxi meter).

교통 (Transportation).example_en: It takes two hours to arrive by airplane.
교통 (Transportation).notes: 비행(飛行 flight) - 비(飛 fly) appears in 비상(emergency), 비약(leap). 행(行 go) appears in 여행(travel), 은행(bank). 기(機 machine) appears in 기계(machine).

교통 (Transportation).example_en: I want to go to Busan by train.
교통 (Transportation).notes: 기차(汽車 train) - 기(汽 steam) appears in 증기(steam). 차(車 vehicle) appears in 자동차(car), 전차(streetcar). Types: KTX, 새마을호, 무궁화호.

교통 (Transportation).example_en: I went to Jeju Island by boat.
교통 (Transportation).notes: Native Korean. Means boat/ship. 배를 타다(ride boat), 배멀미(seasickness). Also means 'stomach' or 'pear' - context makes it clear.

교통 (Transportation).example_en: I ride a bicycle in the park.
교통 (Transportation).notes: 자전거(自轉車 bicycle) - 자(自 self) appears in 자동(automatic). 전(轉 turn) appears in 회전(rotation). 차(車 vehicle) appears in 자동차(car).

교통 (Transportation).example_en: I want to buy a new car.
교통 (Transportation).notes: 자동차(自動車 automobile) - 자(自 self) appears in 자연(nature). 동(動 move) appears in 운동(exercise), 이동(movement). 차(車 vehicle). Short form: 차.

교통 (Transportation).example_en: There are really many delivery motorcycles.
교통 (Transportation).notes: Loanword from English 'auto' + Japanese 'bai' (bike). 배달 오토바이(delivery motorcycle). Modern term: 모터사이클(motorcycle).

교통 (Transportation).example: 여기서 몇 번 버스를 타야 해요?
교통 (Transportation).example_en: What number bus should I take here?
교통 (Transportation).notes: Native Korean. 버스를 타다(ride bus), 말을 타다(ride horse). Also means 'burn' in different context. Irregular: 타요, 탔어요.

교통 (Transportation).example_en: I get off at the next stop.
교통 (Transportation).notes: Native Korean. 버스에서 내리다(get off bus), 짐을 내리다(unload). Also means 'lower/descend.' Conjugates: 내려요, 내렸어요.

교통 (Transportation).example_en: Transfer from Line 2 to Line 3.
교통 (Transportation).notes: Native Korean compound. 갈아(change) + 타다(ride). Used for transfers between vehicles/lines. 2호선에서 갈아타다(transfer from Line 2).

교통 (Transportation).example_en: I booked the ticket in advance.
교통 (Transportation).notes: 표(票 ticket) appears in 표를 사다(buy ticket), 입장표(admission ticket), 영화표(movie ticket). Also means 'mark/sign' in different contexts.

교통 (Transportation).example_en: How much is the bus fare?
교통 (Transportation).notes: 요금(料金 fare) - 요(料 material/fee) appears in 자료(material/data), 음료(beverage). 금(金 money) appears in 돈(money-native), 현금(cash).

교통 (Transportation).example_en: I need to charge money on my transit card.
교통 (Transportation).notes: 교통(交通 traffic/transport) + 카드(card). Rechargeable cards like T-money. 교통카드를 찍다(tap card), 충전하다(recharge).

교통 (Transportation).example_en: Drive carefully!
교통 (Transportation).notes: 운전(運轉 driving) - 운(運 transport) appears in 운동(exercise), 행운(luck). 전(轉 turn) appears in 회전(rotation), 전환(conversion).

교통 (Transportation).example_en: I like driving.
교통 (Transportation).notes: 운전(運轉 driving) - 운(運 transport) appears in 운송(transport), 운반(carry). 전(轉 turn) appears in 자전거(bicycle). 운전면허(driver's license).

교통 (Transportation).example_en: Can I park here?
교통 (Transportation).notes: 주차(駐車 parking) - 주(駐 station/park) appears in 주둔(stationing). 차(車 vehicle) appears in 자동차(car), 기차(train). 주차 금지(no parking).

교통 (Transportation).example_en: The parking lot is full.
교통 (Transportation).notes: 주차(駐車 parking) + 장(場 place/area). 장(場 area) appears in 시장(market), 공항(airport-different 항), 운동장(playground).

교통 (Transportation).example_en: What time do you arrive at the airport?
교통 (Transportation).notes: 도착(到着 arrival) - 도(到 arrive/reach) appears in 도달(reach). 착(着 arrive/attach) appears in 착륙(landing), 출착(departure/arrival).

교통 (Transportation).example_en: The airplane departs at 3 PM.
교통 (Transportation).notes: 출발(出發 departure) - 출(出 exit/go out) appears in 출구(exit), 출국(departure from country). 발(發 start) appears in 발사(launch), 출발역(departure station).

교통 (Transportation).example_en: Please come out through Exit 3.
교통 (Transportation).notes: 출구(出口 exit) - 출(出 exit) appears in 출입(entry/exit), 출국(exit country). 구(口 mouth/opening) appears in 입구(entrance), 구멍(hole).
