자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Native Korean. Polite: 살아요. Past: 살았어요. ㄹ verb (ㄹ drops before ㄴ,ㅂ,ㅅ: 사는, 삽니다, 사세요). Common: 서울에 살다(live in Seoul), 어디에 살아요?(where do you live?), 오래 살다(live long). Related: 생활(lifestyle), 거주하다(to reside, formal).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: I'm learning Korean.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Native Korean. Polite: 배워요(우+어→워). Past: 배웠어요. Common: 한국어를 배우다(learn Korean), 요리를 배우다(learn cooking), 새로운 것을 배우다(learn something new). Opposite: 가르치다(to teach). Related: 학습하다(to learn, formal), 수업을 듣다(take a class).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: I teach English.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Native Korean. Polite: 가르쳐요(치+어→쳐). Past: 가르쳤어요. Common: 영어를 가르치다(teach English), 학생을 가르치다(teach students), 가르쳐 주세요(please teach me). Opposite: 배우다(to learn). Related: 교육(education), 선생님(teacher), 강의하다(to lecture).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: Please help me.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Native compound. 돕다(to help, ㅂ irregular → 도와) + 주다(to give). Polite: 도와줘요(주+어→줘). Past: 도와줬어요. The 주다 adds nuance of doing it as a favor. Common: 좀 도와주세요(please help me), 도와줄 수 있어요?(can you help?). Noun: 도움(help).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: I borrow books from the library.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Native Korean. Polite: 빌려요(리+어→려). Past: 빌렸어요. Same word for both borrow AND lend; context determines direction. Common: 책을 빌리다(borrow a book), 돈을 빌리다(borrow money), 도서관에서 빌리다(borrow from library). Related: 대출하다(to loan, formal), 빌려주다(to lend).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: I lost my phone.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Native compound. 잃다(to lose) + 버리다(completive, 'completely'). Polite: 잃어버려요(리+어→려). Past: 잃어버렸어요. The 버리다 emphasizes the loss is complete and irreversible. Common: 지갑을 잃어버리다(lose wallet), 핸드폰을 잃어버리다(lose phone). Related: 분실하다(to lose, formal).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: I cry when I watch sad movies.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Native Korean. Polite: 울어요. Past: 울었어요. ㄹ verb (ㄹ drops before ㄴ,ㅂ,ㅅ: 우는, 웁니다, 우세요). Common: 슬퍼서 울다(cry from sadness), 기뻐서 울다(cry from joy), 아기가 울다(baby cries). Noun: 울음(crying), 눈물(tears). Opposite: 웃다(laugh).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: I laughed because that story was funny.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Native Korean. Polite: 웃어요. Past: 웃었어요. Both laughing and smiling. Common: 크게 웃다(laugh loudly), 웃는 얼굴(smiling face), 웃기다(to be funny). Noun: 웃음(laughter), 미소(smile, gentler). Opposite: 울다(cry). Related: 웃음소리(sound of laughter).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: I clean my room every weekend.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Sino-Korean compound. 청(淸 clean/clear) + 소(掃 sweep) + 하다. Polite: 청소해요(하→해). Common: 방을 청소하다(clean a room), 대청소(big/spring cleaning), 청소기(vacuum cleaner). Related: 정리하다(to tidy up), 쓸다(to sweep), 닦다(to wipe).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: I need to do laundry.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Native compound. 빨래(laundry) + 하다. Polite: 빨래해요(하→해). Common: 빨래를 널다(hang laundry to dry), 빨래를 개다(fold laundry), 빨래를 돌리다(run the laundry machine). Related: 세탁하다(to launder, formal), 세탁기(washing machine), 건조기(dryer).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: I cook at home.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Sino-Korean compound. 요리(料理 cooking/cuisine) + 하다. Polite: 요리해요(하→해). Common: 한국 요리(Korean cuisine), 요리사(chef), 요리를 잘하다(to be good at cooking). Related: 만들다(to make food), 끓이다(to boil), 볶다(to stir-fry), 굽다(to grill/bake).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: I drive to work every day.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Sino-Korean compound. 운(運 carry/transport) + 전(轉 turn/rotate) + 하다. Polite: 운전해요(하→해). Common: 운전면허(driver's license), 운전자(driver), 운전을 배우다(learn to drive). Related: 몰다(to drive, native Korean), 주행하다(to drive/travel, formal).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: I go by subway.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Native Korean. Polite: 타요(ㅏ+아 contracts). Past: 탔어요. For riding or taking transportation. Common: 지하철을 타다(take the subway), 버스를 타다(take the bus), 자전거를 타다(ride a bicycle), 비행기를 타다(take a plane). Opposite: 내리다(get off). Note: 타다 also means 'to burn.'

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).english: to get off, to go down
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: I get off at the next station.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Native Korean. Polite: 내려요(리+어→려). Past: 내렸어요. Multiple meanings: to get off transport, to go down, to fall (rain/snow). Common: 버스에서 내리다(get off bus), 비가 내리다(rain falls), 눈이 내리다(snow falls), 다음 역에서 내리다(get off at next station). Opposite: 타다.

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: It takes 30 minutes from home to school.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Native Korean. Polite: 걸려요(리+어→려). Past: 걸렸어요. Multiple meanings: to take time, to catch illness, to be hung up. Common: 30분 걸리다(takes 30 minutes), 감기에 걸리다(catch a cold), 전화가 걸리다(a call comes through). Related: 소요되다(to take time, formal).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: I changed to a new phone.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Native Korean. Polite: 바꿔요(꾸+어→꿔). Past: 바꿨어요. Common: 돈을 바꾸다(exchange money), 자리를 바꾸다(change seats), 핸드폰을 바꾸다(change phones). Related: 교환하다(to exchange, formal), 변하다(to change, intransitive). Intransitive: 바뀌다(to be changed).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).english: to fix, to repair, to correct
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: I fixed the computer.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Native Korean. Polite: 고쳐요(치+어→쳐). Past: 고쳤어요. For fixing, repairing, or correcting. Common: 컴퓨터를 고치다(fix a computer), 습관을 고치다(fix a bad habit), 실수를 고치다(correct a mistake). Related: 수리하다(to repair, formal), 수정하다(to revise).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: Please throw the ball. I'll catch it.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Native Korean. Polite: 던져요(지+어→져). Past: 던졌어요. Common: 공을 던지다(throw a ball), 쓰레기를 던지다(toss trash), 돌을 던지다(throw a stone). Figurative: 질문을 던지다(throw out a question). Related: 날리다(to fling), 투구하다(to pitch, in baseball).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).english: to catch / to grab / to hold
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: I raised my hand to catch a taxi.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Native Korean. Polite: 잡아요(ㅏ takes 아). Past: 잡았어요. To catch, grab, or hold. Common: 택시를 잡다(catch a taxi), 손을 잡다(hold hands), 기회를 잡다(seize an opportunity), 물고기를 잡다(catch fish). Related: 붙잡다(to hold onto tightly).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: Please push the door. It won't open.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Native Korean. Polite: 밀어요. Past: 밀었어요. Doors in Korea often have 미세요(push) written on them. Common: 문을 밀다(push a door), 밀어내다(push away), 카트를 밀다(push a cart). Opposite: 당기다(pull). Related: 밀려나다(to be pushed out).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: You have to pull this door to open it.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Native Korean. Polite: 당겨요(기+어→겨). Past: 당겼어요. Doors in Korea often have 당기세요(pull) written on them. Common: 문을 당기다(pull a door), 줄을 당기다(pull a rope), 활시위를 당기다(draw a bowstring). Opposite: 밀다(push). Also: 끌어당기다(to attract/draw in).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).english: to lift / to carry / to hold up
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example: 이 상자 좀 들어 주세요. 무거워요.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: Please lift this box for me. It's heavy.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Native Korean. Polite: 들어요. Past: 들었어요. ㄹ verb. Extremely versatile with many meanings depending on context. Common: 짐을 들다(carry luggage), 마음에 들다(to like/be pleased with), 예를 들다(to give an example), 잠이 들다(to fall asleep), 돈이 들다(to cost money).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).english: to put down / to let go / to release
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: Please put your bag down here.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Native Korean. Polite: 놓아요 or contracted 놔요 (both correct). Past: 놓았어요/놨어요. To put down, place, or let go. Common: 가방을 놓다(put down a bag), 내려놓다(put down), 놓아주다(let go/release), 놓치다(to miss an opportunity). Related: 두다(to place/leave).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: Do you put sugar in your coffee?
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Native Korean. Polite: 넣어요. Past: 넣었어요. To put something into a container or space. Common: 가방에 넣다(put in a bag), 설탕을 넣다(add sugar), 주머니에 넣다(put in pocket), 냉장고에 넣다(put in fridge). Opposite: 빼다(take out). Related: 집어넣다(to shove in).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).english: to take out / to remove / to subtract
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example: 양파를 빼 주세요. 양파를 못 먹어요.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: Please leave out the onion. I can't eat onion.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Native Korean. Polite: 빼요(ㅐ+어 contracts). Past: 뺐어요. To remove, take out, or subtract. Common: 양파를 빼 주세요(please leave out the onion), 주머니에서 빼다(take out from pocket), 빼놓다(to omit/leave out). Opposite: 넣다(put in). Related: 제외하다(to exclude, formal).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).english: to fall / to drop / to run out
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: I dropped my phone and the screen cracked.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Native Korean compound. Polite: 떨어져요(지+어→져). Past: 떨어졌어요. Multiple meanings: to fall physically, to run out, to fail. Common: 잎이 떨어지다(leaves fall), 배터리가 떨어지다(battery runs out), 시험에 떨어지다(fail an exam). Related: 떨어뜨리다(to drop something, transitive).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: The elevator was broken, so I went up by stairs.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Native compound. 올라(up) + 가다(go). Polite: 올라가요(ㅏ+아 contracts). Past: 올라갔어요. Common: 계단으로 올라가다(go up the stairs), 산에 올라가다(go up a mountain), 가격이 올라가다(prices go up). Opposite: 내려가다(go down). Related: 오르다(to rise/ascend).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: To take the subway, go down the stairs.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Native compound. 내려(down) + 가다(go). Polite: 내려가요(ㅏ+아 contracts). Past: 내려갔어요. Common: 계단으로 내려가다(go down stairs), 지하로 내려가다(go underground), 온도가 내려가다(temperature goes down). Opposite: 올라가다(go up). Related: 하산하다(to descend a mountain, formal).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: When I go inside the house, I wash my hands.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Native compound. 들어(in) + 가다(go). Polite: 들어가요(ㅏ+아 contracts). Past: 들어갔어요. Common: 집에 들어가다(go inside home), 방에 들어가다(enter a room), 회사에 들어가다(join a company). Opposite: 나가다(go out). Related: 입장하다(to enter, formal).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: I'll go outside for a bit. I'll be right back.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Native compound. 나(out) + 가다(go). Polite: 나가요(ㅏ+아 contracts). Past: 나갔어요. Common: 밖에 나가다(go outside), 나가세요(please leave/get out), 밖에 나가서 놀다(go outside and play). Opposite: 들어가다(go in). Related: 외출하다(to go out, formal), 퇴장하다(to exit, formal).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: When will you come back to Korea?
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Native compound. 돌아(back/around) + 오다(come). Polite: 돌아와요(오+아→와). Past: 돌아왔어요. Common: 집에 돌아오다(come back home), 언제 돌아올 거예요?(when will you come back?). Related direction: 돌아가다(to go back). Related: 귀국하다(to return to home country).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: I need to take the child to the hospital.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Native compound. 데려(taking along) + 가다(go). Polite: 데려가요(ㅏ+아 contracts). Past: 데려갔어요. Only for living beings (people, animals), NOT objects (use 가져가다 for objects). Common: 병원에 데려가다(take to hospital), 아이를 데려가다(take the child). Opposite: 데려오다(bring).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: Can I bring a friend to the party?
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Native compound. 데려(taking along) + 오다(come). Polite: 데려와요(오+아→와). Past: 데려왔어요. Only for living beings, NOT objects (use 가져오다 for objects). Common: 친구를 데려오다(bring a friend), 강아지를 데려오다(bring a puppy). Opposite: 데려가다(take away).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: I sent an email. Please check it.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Native Korean. Polite: 보내요(ㅐ+어 contracts). Past: 보냈어요. To send or to spend (time). Common: 이메일을 보내다(send email), 편지를 보내다(send a letter), 시간을 보내다(spend time), 택배를 보내다(send a package). Related: 발송하다(to dispatch, formal), 전송하다(to transmit).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: I called a taxi. It will come soon.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Native Korean. 르 irregular: 불러요(polite, 르→ㄹㄹ). Past: 불렀어요. Two distinct meanings: to call someone and to sing. Common: 이름을 부르다(call someone's name), 노래를 부르다(sing a song), 택시를 부르다(call a taxi). Related: 호출하다(to summon, formal), 소환하다(to summon).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: Please answer the teacher's question.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Sino-Korean compound. 대(對 toward/face) + 답(答 answer) + 하다. Polite: 대답해요(하→해). Common: 질문에 대답하다(answer a question), 빨리 대답하다(answer quickly), 대답을 못 하다(unable to answer). Related: 답변하다(to reply, formal), 응답하다(to respond), 답(answer, short form).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: Please explain this word in a simple way.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Sino-Korean compound. 설(說 speak/explain) + 명(明 clear/bright) + 하다. Literally 'to speak clearly.' Polite: 설명해요(하→해). Common: 쉽게 설명하다(explain simply), 자세히 설명하다(explain in detail). Noun: 설명(explanation), 설명서(manual/instructions).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).english: to promise / to make an appointment
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: We promised to meet tomorrow.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Sino-Korean compound. 약(約 promise/arrange) + 속(束 bind/bundle) + 하다. Polite: 약속해요(하→해). 약속 means both 'promise' and 'appointment.' Common: 약속을 지키다(keep a promise), 약속을 잡다(make plans/an appointment), 약속 시간(appointment time).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example: 여행 준비 다 했어요? 내일 출발이에요.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: Are you all done preparing for the trip? We depart tomorrow.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Sino-Korean compound. 준(準 standard/level) + 비(備 equip/prepare) + 하다. Polite: 준비해요(하→해). Common: 시험 준비(exam preparation), 여행 준비(trip preparation), 준비물(things to prepare), 준비 다 했어요?(are you all ready?). Related: 마련하다(to arrange/prepare).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).english: to organize / to tidy up / to sort out
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: I need to tidy up my room. It's too messy.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Sino-Korean compound. 정(整 arrange/tidy) + 리(理 manage/organize) + 하다. Polite: 정리해요(하→해). Common: 방을 정리하다(tidy a room), 생각을 정리하다(organize thoughts), 짐을 정리하다(sort/pack luggage). Related: 치우다(to put away/clear), 정돈하다(to arrange neatly).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).english: to confirm / to check / to verify
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: Please confirm the reservation.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Sino-Korean compound. 확(確 certain/sure) + 인(認 recognize/acknowledge) + 하다. Polite: 확인해요(하→해). Common: 예약을 확인하다(confirm a reservation), 이메일을 확인하다(check email), 확인해 주세요(please check/verify). Related: 검토하다(to review), 점검하다(to inspect).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).english: to reserve / to book / to make a reservation
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: I reserved a restaurant. We can go at 7.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Sino-Korean compound. 예(豫 advance/beforehand) + 약(約 promise/arrange) + 하다. Polite: 예약해요(하→해). Common: 호텔을 예약하다(book a hotel), 식당을 예약하다(reserve a restaurant), 예약 취소(cancel a reservation). Related: 예매하다(to book tickets specifically for shows/transport).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: I divide the cake into four pieces.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Native Korean. Polite: 나눠요(누+어→눠). Past: 나눴어요. To divide or share. Common: 나눠 먹다(share food), 이야기를 나누다(have a conversation, literally 'share stories'), 반으로 나누다(divide in half). Related: 분배하다(to distribute, formal), 나눗셈(division in math).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: Collecting stamps is my hobby.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Native Korean. ㅡ irregular: 모아요(polite, ㅡ drops, previous syllable 모 has ㅗ so 아). Past: 모았어요. Common: 우표를 모으다(collect stamps), 돈을 모으다(save/gather money), 사람을 모으다(gather people). Related: 수집하다(to collect, formal), 저축하다(to save money, formal).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: Please fill the cup with water.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Native Korean. Polite: 채워요(우+어→워). Past: 채웠어요. To fill something up. Common: 물을 채우다(fill with water), 배를 채우다(fill one's stomach), 빈칸을 채우다(fill in the blank), 목표를 채우다(meet a goal/quota). Opposite: 비우다(to empty).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: I need to empty the trash can.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Native Korean. Polite: 비워요(우+어→워). Past: 비웠어요. To empty or vacate. Common: 쓰레기통을 비우다(empty the trash), 자리를 비우다(vacate a seat/be away from desk), 마음을 비우다(empty one's mind, let go). Opposite: 채우다(to fill).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: I lock the door before going out.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Native Korean. ㅡ irregular: 잠가요(polite, ㅡ drops, previous syllable 잠 has ㅏ so 아). Past: 잠갔어요. To lock or to turn off (water). Common: 문을 잠그다(lock the door), 수도를 잠그다(turn off the faucet/tap). Opposite: 열다(open/unlock). Related: 자물쇠(padlock), 잠금(lock).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: I hid the present inside the closet.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Native Korean. Polite: 숨겨요(기+어→겨). Past: 숨겼어요. To hide or conceal something (transitive). Common: 선물을 숨기다(hide a gift), 비밀을 숨기다(hide a secret), 감정을 숨기다(hide emotions). Intransitive (hide oneself): 숨다. Related: 감추다(to conceal, synonym).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: I discovered a new great restaurant!
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Sino-Korean compound. 발(發 release/reveal) + 견(見 see/discover) + 하다. Polite: 발견해요(하→해). Common: 새로운 맛집을 발견하다(discover a new restaurant), 문제를 발견하다(discover a problem). Passive: 발견되다(to be discovered). Related: 찾아내다(to find out, native Korean).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: Please choose just one from the menu.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Sino-Korean compound. 선(選 choose/elect) + 택(擇 pick/select) + 하다. Polite: 선택해요(하→해). Common: 하나를 선택하다(choose one), 메뉴를 선택하다(choose from the menu). Native Korean synonym: 고르다(to pick). Noun: 선택(choice), 선택지(options/choices available).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example: 아직 뭘 할지 결정 못 했어요.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: I haven't decided what to do yet.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Sino-Korean compound. 결(決 decide/settle) + 정(定 fix/determine) + 하다. Polite: 결정해요(하→해). Common: 결정을 내리다(make a decision), 아직 결정 못 했어요(haven't decided yet). Passive: 결정되다(to be decided). Related: 정하다(to set/determine, simpler form).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: I couldn't hold back my laughter.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Native Korean. Polite: 참아요(ㅏ takes 아). Past: 참았어요. To endure, bear, or hold back. Common: 눈물을 참다(hold back tears), 웃음을 참다(hold back laughter), 참을 수 없다(can't endure/bear it), 좀만 참으세요(please bear with it a little). Related: 견디다(to withstand, longer endurance).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: Never give up!
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Sino-Korean compound. 포(抛 throw away) + 기(棄 abandon/discard) + 하다. Polite: 포기해요(하→해). Common: 꿈을 포기하다(give up a dream), 절대 포기하지 마세요(never give up), 포기할 수 없다(can't give up). Related: 단념하다(to give up, formal), 체념하다(to resign oneself).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: I finally succeeded on the exam!
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Sino-Korean compound. 성(成 achieve/accomplish) + 공(功 merit/achievement) + 하다. Polite: 성공해요(하→해). Common: 시험에 성공하다(succeed on exam), 사업에 성공하다(succeed in business). Noun: 성공(success), 대성공(great success). Opposite: 실패하다(to fail). Related: 성공적(successful).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: I failed on the first try.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Sino-Korean compound. 실(失 lose) appears in 실수(mistake), 실망(disappointment). 패(敗 defeat) appears in 패배(defeat), 승패(win or lose). Polite: 실패해요(하→해). Common: 사업에 실패하다(fail in business), 실패를 두려워하지 마세요(don't fear failure). Opposite: 성공하다.

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).english: to make an effort; to try hard
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: I make an effort to study Korean every day.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Sino-Korean compound. 노(努 strive/exert) + 력(力 power/force) + 하다. Polite: 노력해요(하→해). Common: 열심히 노력하다(try very hard), 노력의 결과(result of effort), 노력이 필요하다(effort is needed). Related: 애쓰다(to strive, native Korean), 분투하다(to struggle hard).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: Happy birthday!
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Sino-Korean compound. 축(祝 celebrate/wish) + 하(賀 congratulate) + 하다. Polite: 축하해요(하→해). Common: 생일 축하해요!(Happy birthday!), 축하합니다!(Congratulations!, formal), 졸업 축하해요(congrats on graduation). Related: 축하 파티(celebration party), 축제(festival).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: I'm always cheering for you!
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Sino-Korean compound. 응(應 respond/answer) + 원(援 aid/support) + 하다. Polite: 응원해요(하→해). To cheer for or support someone. Common: 팀을 응원하다(cheer for a team), 항상 응원하고 있어요(I'm always rooting for you). Noun: 응원(cheering), 응원단(cheering squad/cheerleaders).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).english: to lie; to tell a lie
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: You shouldn't lie!
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Native compound. 거짓(false/fake) + 말(words) + 하다. Polite: 거짓말해요(하→해). Common: 거짓말하면 안 돼요(you shouldn't lie), 거짓말쟁이(liar), 거짓말을 들키다(get caught lying). Related: 속이다(to deceive), 사기 치다(to scam). Opposite: 솔직하다(to be honest).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: I was worried because you suddenly disappeared.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Native Korean. Polite: 사라져요(지+어→져). Past: 사라졌어요. To disappear or vanish. Common: 갑자기 사라지다(suddenly disappear), 사라진 물건(missing item), 구름이 사라지다(clouds disappear). Opposite: 나타나다(appear). Related: 없어지다(to go missing), 소멸하다(to extinguish, formal).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: You finally showed up!
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Native Korean. Polite: 나타나요(ㅏ+아 contracts). Past: 나타났어요. To appear, show up, or emerge. Common: 갑자기 나타나다(suddenly appear), 드디어 나타났다(finally showed up), 증상이 나타나다(symptoms appear). Opposite: 사라지다(disappear). Related: 등장하다(to make an entrance).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).english: to increase; to grow; to improve
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: My Korean skills have improved a lot.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Native Korean. Polite: 늘어요. Past: 늘었어요. ㄹ verb. For increasing, growing, or improving skills. Common: 실력이 늘다(skills improve), 체중이 늘다(gain weight), 한국어가 많이 늘었어요(your Korean has improved a lot). Transitive: 늘리다(to increase something). Opposite: 줄다(decrease).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: The number of customers has decreased a lot lately.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Native Korean. Polite: 줄어요. Past: 줄었어요. ㄹ verb. For decreasing, shrinking, or reducing. Common: 손님이 줄다(customers decrease), 체중이 줄다(lose weight), 양이 줄다(amount decreases). Transitive: 줄이다(to reduce something). Opposite: 늘다(increase).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: Our team won 3 to 1!
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Native Korean. Polite: 이겨요(기+어→겨). Past: 이겼어요. To win or to beat/overcome. Common: 시합에서 이기다(win a match), 유혹을 이기다(overcome temptation), 3 대 1로 이기다(win 3 to 1). Opposite: 지다(lose). Related: 승리하다(to win, formal).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: We lost by a narrow margin.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Native Korean. Polite: 져요(지+어→져). Past: 졌어요. To lose in a competition. Common: 경기에서 지다(lose a game), 아깝게 지다(lose by a narrow margin), 지고 싶지 않다(don't want to lose). Opposite: 이기다(win). Related: 패배하다(to be defeated, formal). Note: 지다 has other meanings like 해가 지다(sun sets).

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: It ended in a 2-2 tie.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Native Korean. Polite: 비겨요(기+어→겨). Past: 비겼어요. To tie or draw in a game. Common: 2 대 2로 비기다(tie 2-2), 무승부로 비기다(end in a draw). Related: 무승부(a tie/draw), 동점(tied score). Falls between 이기다(win) and 지다(lose) in competition vocabulary.

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: I graduated from university last year.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: Sino-Korean compound. 졸(卒 finish/end) + 업(業 work/study/profession) + 하다. Polite: 졸업해요(하→해). Common: 대학교를 졸업하다(graduate from university), 졸업식(graduation ceremony), 졸업생(graduate). Opposite: 입학하다(to enroll/enter school). Related: 졸업장(diploma).

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: The weather is very nice today.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean intensifier. More emphatic than 많이. Common in both speech and writing.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: This issue is very important.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: 매(每 each) appears in 매일(every day), 매년(every year), 매번(every time). Formal register, common in writing.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: This food is really delicious.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean adverb expressing sincerity. 정말요? (Really?) expresses surprise. Casual but polite.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: It's really fun!
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native word meaning 'the real thing' as noun or 'really' as adverb. Casual register; 진짜요? = For real?

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: Please help me (a bit).
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Contracted form of 조금. Softens imperative requests: 좀 도와주세요 sounds gentler than 도와주세요.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: Please give me just a little water.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean. Full formal version of 좀. Collocations: 조금씩(little by little), 조금 더(a bit more).

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: Please eat a lot. (Enjoy your meal.)
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Adverb from 많다(many/much). Essential phrase: 많이 드세요(enjoy your meal, lit. eat a lot).

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: Come quickly!
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: From 빠르다(fast); ㅡ irregular: 빨라요. Cultural note: 빨리빨리(hurry-hurry) is famous Korean work culture.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: Please speak slowly.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean adverb from 천천하다(to be slow). Essential phrase for learners: 천천히 말해 주세요.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: You speak Korean well.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean adverb from 잘하다(to do well). Set phrases: 잘 먹겠습니다(before meals), 잘 지내요?(How are you?).

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: I can't go today.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Negation adverb placed before verbs. 못 = unable/incapable vs 안 = unwilling. 못하다 = to be bad at.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: I don't eat meat.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Negation adverb placed before verbs. With 하다 verbs: 공부 안 해요(NOT 안 공부해요). 안 = won't vs 못 = can't.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: See you again!
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean. Multiple meanings: again, also, and. Can link items: 사과, 또 바나나(apples and also bananas).

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: Please say it one more time.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean meaning repeat/restart. Subtle difference from 또: 다시 = do over; 또 = additional occurrence.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: I already ate.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean adverb stating fact without surprise. Compare 벌써(already, with surprise). 이미 늦었어요(it's too late).

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: It's not finished yet.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean. Pattern: 아직 + positive = still doing; 아직 + negative = not yet. 아직도 = still(emphasized).

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: It's already 12 o'clock?
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean expressing surprise at earliness. Unlike 이미, shows emotional reaction: 벌써?!(already?!).

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: I'm always grateful.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: 항(恒 constant) appears in 항구적(permanent). 상(常 always) appears in 일상(daily life), 상식(common sense), 정상(normal).

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: I come to this restaurant often.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean. Frequency scale: 항상 > 자주 > 가끔 > 드물게. Very common in conversation.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: What time do you usually wake up?
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: 보(普 common) appears in 보편(universal), 보급(distribution). 통(通 pass through) appears in 교통(traffic), 통일(unification), 소통(communication).

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: I sometimes watch movies.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean. Less frequent than 자주. 가끔씩 is emphasized form with same meaning.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: I absolutely never lie.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: 절(絕 cut off) appears in 절망(despair), 절친(best friend). 대(對 oppose) appears in 반대(opposite), 대결(confrontation), 대립(opposition).

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: I don't understand at all.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: 전(全 entire) appears in 전체(whole), 전국(nationwide), 전부(all), 안전(safety). Always used with negatives.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: The homework is almost done.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean adverb meaning almost/nearly. Collocations: 거의 다(almost all), 거의 없다(hardly any).

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: It will probably rain tomorrow.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean. Often paired with -(으)ㄹ 거예요 for future guessing. Less certain than 확실히.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: You must come! / Make sure to come!
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean with dual meaning: definitely(abstract) or tightly(physical). For emphasis: 꼭 해야 돼요(you must do it).

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: Wash your hands first.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean. Politeness: 먼저 드세요(please eat first), 먼저 가세요(you go first). Opposite: 나중에.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: I'll call you later.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean. 나중 = later time(noun) + 에(at). Opposite: 먼저. Common: 나중에 봐요(see you later).

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: Do you want to eat lunch together?
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: 같이 is casual/spoken; 함께 is formal/written. 함(函 together) appears in 함께하다. Both mean together.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: I travel alone.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean. 혼자서 emphasizes solitude. Collocations: 혼자 살다(live alone), 혼자 가다(go alone).

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: I'll go right away.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean with multiple uses: time(immediately), location(right here). 바로 그거예요(that's exactly it).

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: It suddenly rained.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean adverb. Describes unexpected change. Common: 갑자기 생각났어요(I suddenly remembered).

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: The exam is finally over!
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean expressing relief/joy after waiting. Positive nuance. Similar: 마침내(at last).

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: I drank coffee, and then took a walk.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean conjunction. From 그러(like that) + 고(and). Links clauses showing sequence or addition.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: It rained. So I took an umbrella.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean conjunction. From 그러(like that) + 어서(so). Shows cause-effect relationship.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: I want to go. But I don't have time.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean conjunction. From 그러(like that) + ㄴ데(but). Shows contrast or topic change.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: It's difficult but fun.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean conjunction. From 하(do) + 지만(though). Formal adversative conjunction.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).english: then, if so, in that case
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example: 배고프다고요? 그러면 같이 밥 먹으러 가요.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: You're hungry? Then let's go eat together.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean conjunction. From 그러(like that) + 면(if). Shows conditional relationship.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: It's hard. But still, I won't give up.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean conjunction. From 그러(like that) + 어도(even if). Shows concession despite difficulty.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: I couldn't go. Because I was sick.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean. From 왜(why) + 냐(question) + 하(do) + 면(if). Often paired with -기 때문이에요.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: It takes roughly about thirty minutes.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: 대(大 big) appears in 대체로(generally), 대강(roughly). 략(略 abbreviate) appears in 생략(omission), 전략(strategy), 요약(summary).

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: What time exactly are we meeting?
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: 정(正 correct) appears in 정답(correct answer), 정직(honesty), 수정(correction). 확(確 certain) appears in 확인(confirmation), 확대(expansion), 확장(expansion).

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: I clearly put it here but it's gone.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: 분(分 divide) appears in 분석(analysis), 구분(distinction), 분리(separation). 명(明 bright) appears in 명백(obvious), 설명(explanation), 증명(proof).

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: Can you definitely finish it by tomorrow?
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: 확(確 certain) appears in 확인(confirm), 정확(accurate), 명확(clear). 실(實 real) appears in 실제(reality), 사실(fact), 현실(reality).

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: Honestly speaking, it's a bit expensive.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean adverb. From 솔직하다(to be honest/frank). Common opener: 솔직히 말하면(honestly speaking).

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example: 한국 음식 중에 특히 불고기를 좋아해요.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: Among Korean foods, I especially like bulgogi.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: 특(特 special) appears in 특별(special), 특징(characteristic), 독특(unique). 히 is adverb ending.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: On weekends I mostly rest at home.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: 주(主 main) appears in 주인(owner), 주요(main/key), 주장(claim), 주제(topic/theme).

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: In the end, it rained so we couldn't go.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: 결(結 tie) appears in 결론(conclusion), 결과(result), 결혼(marriage). 국(局 bureau) appears in 국면(phase), 약국(pharmacy), 국가(nation).

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: At last, the exam is over!
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean. From 마침(just then) + 내(out). Implies long-awaited outcome. Similar to 드디어.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example: 서울은 비가 왔어요. 한편, 부산은 맑았어요.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: It rained in Seoul. Meanwhile, it was sunny in Busan.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: 한(一 one) appears in 한쪽(one side), 한번(once). 편(便 convenient/side) appears in 편지(letter), 편리(convenience), 왼편(left side).

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).english: moreover / besides / on top of that
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: It's raining, and on top of that, it's windy.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean conjunction. Casual tone. Adds information, often surprising: 비싸고, 게다가 맛없어요(expensive and on top of that, tasteless).

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example: 비가 많이 와요. 따라서 우산을 가져가세요.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: It's raining a lot. Therefore, take an umbrella.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean. From 따르(follow) + 아서(so). Formal conjunction showing logical consequence.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).english: that is / namely / in other words
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: Tomorrow, that is, Monday, we start.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: 즉(卽 immediate) appears in 즉시(immediately), 즉각(instantly), 즉석(on the spot).

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example: 과일을 좋아해요. 예를 들면, 사과나 딸기요.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: I like fruit. For example, apples or strawberries.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: 예(例 example) appears in 예시(example), 예외(exception). Full phrase: 예를 들면; shortened: 예를 들어.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example: 형은 키가 커요. 반면에 저는 작아요.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: My older brother is tall. On the other hand, I'm short.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: 반(反 opposite) appears in 반대(opposition), 반응(reaction), 위반(violation). 면(面 side) appears in 표면(surface), 측면(aspect), 방면(direction).

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: I was worried, but it was actually fun instead.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean. Indicates opposite of expectation. Contrary outcome: 걱정했는데 오히려 쉬웠어요(I worried but it was actually easy).

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: Anyway, we have to do it.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean. Casual tone. Dismisses previous discussion to move on: 어쨌든 가자(anyway, let's go).

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: Of course I'll help!
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: 물(勿 not) appears in 금물(forbidden). 론(論 discuss) appears in 논문(thesis), 결론(conclusion), 이론(theory).

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: Actually, I don't really know either.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: 사(事 matter) appears in 사건(incident), 사고(accident), 행사(event). 실(實 real) appears in 실제(reality), 진실(truth), 현실(reality).

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: In any case, good work.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean. Similar to 어쨌든 but slightly softer. Wraps up discussion: 아무튼 잘됐네요(anyway, it worked out well).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example: 우리 집에 개가 한 마리 있어요.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: We have one dog at our house.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Counter: 마리(for animals). Diminutive: 강아지(puppy). Collocations: 개짓다(bark), 개밥(dog food).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The cat is sleeping on the sofa.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Casual: 냥이. Onomatopoeia: 야옹(meow). Counter: 마리.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: A bird is singing on top of the tree.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean (homophone with 새=new). Counter: 마리. Species: 참새(sparrow), 독수리(eagle).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: I caught a fish in the river.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Literally 물(water) + 고기(meat/flesh). 생선 refers to fish as food. Counter: 마리.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The rabbit is eating a carrot.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Folklore: 달토끼(moon rabbit) makes rice cakes. Counter: 마리.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example: 산에서 곰을 보면 절대 뛰면 안 돼요.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: If you see a bear on the mountain, you must never run.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Mythology: 단군신화(Dangun founding myth). Metaphor: slow/clumsy person.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: Long ago, tigers lived in the mountains.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Symbol of Korea. Proverb: 호랑이도 제 말 하면 온다(speak of the devil). Zodiac animal.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: They say the lion is the king of animals.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Not to confuse with 사자(四字 four characters). Counter: 마리.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: An elephant's nose (trunk) is really long.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean formation related to 코(nose). Collocations: 코끼리 등(elephant's back for riding).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The monkey eats bananas up in the tree.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Zodiac: 원숭이띠(year of monkey). Collocations: 원숭이처럼 재빠르다(agile as monkey).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: Many people are afraid of snakes.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Zodiac animal. Species: 독사(venomous snake). Metaphor: treacherous person.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The turtle walks slowly.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Base: 거북 + diminutive 이. Folk tale: 토끼와 거북이(tortoise and hare). Symbol of longevity.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: I saw a mouse in the kitchen!
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. First zodiac animal: 쥐띠. Specific: 생쥐(house mouse). Counter: 마리.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: I tried riding a horse on Jeju Island.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Homophone: 말(speech/words), context matters. Related: 경마(horse racing), 말타다(ride horse). Zodiac animal.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: If you go to the countryside, there are many cows.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Premium: 한우(Korean beef cattle). Food: 소고기(beef). Zodiac: 소띠(year of ox).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The pig is playing in the mud.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Food: 돼지고기(pork). Culture: dreaming of pig = lucky omen(wealth). Zodiac: 돼지띠.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The chicken crowed in the morning.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Meat: 닭고기(chicken). Korean favorite: 치킨(fried chicken). Silent ㄹ before consonants. Zodiac animal.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: Ducks are swimming in the park pond.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Meat: 오리고기(duck). Sound: 꽥꽥(quack). Popular in Korean cuisine.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example: 잠이 안 올 때 양을 세요.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: When you can't sleep, count sheep.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Homophone: 양(amount), 양(洋 Western). Meat: 양고기(lamb/mutton). Zodiac: 양띠.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: In spring, many pretty butterflies fly around.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Related: 나비넥타이(bow tie, lit. butterfly necktie). Poetic symbol in Korean literature.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: Bees collect honey from flowers.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Types: 꿀벌(honey bee), 말벌(hornet). Collocations: 벌집(beehive), 벌에 쏘이다(get stung).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The ants are walking in a line.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Known for hard work. Fable: 베짱이와 개미(grasshopper and ant). Counter: 마리.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The spider is spinning a web.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Related: 거미줄(spider web). Collocations: 거미가 줄을 치다(spider spins web).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: In summer, there are too many mosquitoes.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Summer pest. Collocations: 모기에 물리다(be bitten by mosquito), 모기장(mosquito net).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: I'm resting under a tree.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Classifier for trees: 그루. Types: 소나무(pine), 참나무(oak). Compound: 나뭇잎(leaf), 나뭇가지(branch).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: I gave flowers as a gift to my girlfriend.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Counter: 송이. ㅊ irregular: 꽃이(flower-subject). Collocations: 꽃을 피우다(bloom), 꽃다발(bouquet).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The children are running and playing on the grass.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Homophone: 풀(glue). Types: 잔디(grass/lawn), 잡초(weed). Collocations: 풀을 뜯다(graze).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: In autumn, the leaves turn red.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Tree leaves. Collocations: 나뭇잎(tree leaf), 낙엽(fallen leaves). Counter: 장(sheet).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: I went to the mountain with friends on the weekend.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Counter: 개. Famous: 한라산(Hallasan), 설악산(Seoraksan). Hiking culture: 등산(mountain climbing).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: I rode a bicycle along the Han River.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Major rivers: 한강(Han River), 낙동강(Nakdong). Collocations: 강가(riverside), 강물(river water).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: I want to go to the sea in summer.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Related: 해변(beach), 바닷가(seaside). Collocations: 바다에 가다(go to the sea).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The lake is really beautiful.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: 호(湖 lake) appears in 서호(West Lake), 호반(lakeside). 수(水 water) appears in 물(water), 수영(swimming), 급수(water supply).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: Jeju Island is the largest island in Korea.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Famous: 제주도(Jeju Island), 독도(Dokdo). Counter: 개.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: It's hard to find water in the desert.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: 사(沙 sand) appears in 모래(sand), 사구(sand dune). 막(漠 vast) appears in 광막(vastness). Desert.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: Walking in the forest makes you feel better.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Large forest: 산림(mountain forest). Collocations: 숲속(inside forest), 울창한 숲(dense forest).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The sky is really clear today.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Related: 하늘색(sky blue). Collocations: 하늘이 맑다(sky is clear), 파란 하늘(blue sky).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The ground is wet because it rained.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Ground/earth. Collocations: 땅을 파다(dig ground), 땅값(land price). Related: 지구(Earth).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: I picked up a pretty stone from the river.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Types: 자갈(pebble), 바위(rock/boulder). Counter: 개. Collocations: 돌다리(stone bridge).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The children are making a castle out of sand.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Places: 모래사장(sandy beach), 사막(desert). Collocations: 모래성(sandcastle).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The waves are really high today.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Ocean waves. Collocations: 파도가 치다(waves crash), 파도타기(surfing). Related: 물결(wave).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: You can hear the refreshing sound of water from the waterfall.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: 폭(瀑 waterfall) appears in waterfalls. 포(布 cloth) appears in 布. Waterfall. Famous: 백록담, 천지연 폭포.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: A rainbow appeared after the rain stopped.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Rainbow. Seven colors: 일곱 색깔 무지개. Collocations: 무지개가 뜨다(rainbow appears).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: I bought one red rose.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Rose flower. Collocations: 장미꽃(rose), 장미 정원(rose garden). Symbol: love.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: Sunflowers always look toward the sun.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean compound. 해(sun) + 바라기(looking at). Sunflower. Literally 'sun-facing flower'.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: Let's go see cherry blossoms in spring.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. 벚(cherry tree) + 꽃(flower). Cherry blossom. Spring festival: 벚꽃 축제.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The autumn leaves on the mountain are really pretty.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Autumn foliage/leaves. Fall activity: 단풍 구경(viewing autumn leaves). Related: 단풍잎.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The children want to go to the zoo.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: 동(動 move) appears in 동작(movement), 운동(exercise). 물(物 thing) appears in 물건(object). 원(園 garden). Zoo.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: I watched a dolphin show at the aquarium.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: 수(水 water) + 족(族 group) appears in 가족(family). 관(館 building). Aquarium.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: I want to raise a pet.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: 애(愛 love) + 완(玩 play) appears in 장난(play). 동물(animal). Pet animal.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: I walk the puppy every evening.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: 산(散 scatter) + 책(策 walk). To walk (a pet). Collocations: 개를 산책시키다(walk the dog).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: An eagle is flying high in the sky.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Eagle. Large bird of prey. Related: 독(eagle) + 수리(raptor).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: A crow is sitting on the power line.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Crow/raven. Black bird. Collocations: 까마귀 울음소리(crow's call). Cultural: bad omen.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: Sparrows are eating bread crumbs.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Sparrow. Small common bird. Collocations: 참새 떼(flock of sparrows).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: There are too many pigeons in the park.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Pigeon/dove. Peace symbol. Collocations: 비둘기가 날다(pigeons fly), 비둘기 먹이 주기.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The parrot imitates human speech.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Parrot. Colorful talking bird. Collocations: 앵무새처럼 따라하다(repeat like parrot).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: Penguins can't fly but they swim well.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Loanword from English 'penguin'. Antarctic bird. Collocations: 펭귄 걸음걸이(penguin walk).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: I saw a whale in the sea near Jeju Island.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Whale. Large marine mammal. Collocations: 고래 구경(whale watching). Related: 고래고기(whale meat).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The dolphin jumped out of the water.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Dolphin. Literally 돌(turn) + 고래(whale). Smart marine mammal. Shows: 돌고래 쇼.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: Sharks are scary but cool animals.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Shark. Predatory fish. Types: 백상아리(great white). Collocations: 상어가 헤엄치다.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: An octopus has eight legs.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Octopus. Eight-legged sea creature. Food: 문어 요리. Collocations: 문어 다리.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: I caught a small crab at the beach.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Crab. Sea creature with claws. Food: 게장(marinated crab). Collocations: 게가 기어가다(crab crawls).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: I've seen a deer on the mountain.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Deer. Forest animal with antlers. Collocations: 사슴뿔(antlers). Related: 노루(roe deer).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: Foxes are very smart animals.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Fox. Clever animal. Folklore: 여우 구슬(fox bead legend). Metaphor: cunning person.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: Wolves appear often in old stories.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Wolf. Wild canine. Story: 양치기 소년과 늑대(boy who cried wolf). Pack: 늑대 무리.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: A squirrel is eating acorns up in the tree.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Squirrel. Tree-dwelling rodent. Collocations: 다람쥐가 나무를 타다, 다람쥐 쳇바퀴(hamster wheel metaphor).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: Bats are animals that are active at night.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Bat. Flying mammal. Nocturnal: 밤에 활동. Collocations: 박쥐처럼 매달리다(hang like bat).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: Dragonflies fly around a lot in autumn.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Dragonfly. Summer insect. Also means 'sleeping place' - context matters. Collocations: 잠자리가 날다.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: A ladybug landed on my hand.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean compound. 무당(shaman, due to colors) + 벌레(bug). Ladybug. Beneficial insect.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example: 비가 온 후에 지렁이가 땅 위로 나와요.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: Earthworms come above ground after it rains.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Earthworm. Soil creature. Fishing: 지렁이 미끼(worm bait). Collocations: 지렁이가 기어가다.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: You need to be careful of jellyfish at the beach in summer.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean compound. 해(sea) + 파리(fly/insect). Jellyfish. Sting: 해파리에 쏘이다.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: Today's Korean class was fun.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: 수(授 give) appears in 교수(professor), 전수(transmission). 업(業 work) appears in 사업(business), 직업(occupation), 산업(industry).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I haven't finished all my homework yet.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: 숙(宿 lodge) appears in 숙소(lodging), 숙박(accommodation). 제(題 topic) appears in 문제(problem), 주제(subject), 제목(title).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example: 다음 주에 시험이 있어서 공부해야 돼요.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I have to study because there's an exam next week.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: 시(試 test) appears in 시도(attempt), 시행(implementation). 험(驗 examine) appears in 경험(experience), 실험(experiment), 검사(inspection).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: My grades went up a lot this semester.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: 성(成 achieve) appears in 성공(success), 성장(growth), 완성(completion). 적(績 achievement) appears in 실적(performance), 업적(achievement).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: Please open your textbook to page 30.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: 교(教 teach) appears in 교사(teacher), 교실(classroom), 교육(education). 과(科 subject) appears in 과목(subject), 과학(science). 서(書 book) appears in 도서(books), 서점(bookstore).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I wrote down the important content in my notebook.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: 공(空 empty) appears in 공간(space), 빈공간(empty space). 책(冊 book) appears in 책(book), 수첩(notebook). Also called 노트 in modern Korean.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example: 연필로 먼저 쓰고 나중에 펜으로 써요.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: First write with pencil, then later write with pen.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: 연(鉛 lead) appears in 연필심(pencil lead). 필(筆 writing tool) appears in 붓(brush), 만년필(fountain pen), 필기(note-taking). Counter: 자루.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: Can you lend me just one ballpoint pen?
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Loanword: 볼(ball) + 펜(pen). Formal writing: 검정 볼펜(black pen). Counter: 자루.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I erased the wrong part with an eraser.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Native Korean. From 지우다(erase) + 개(tool suffix). For pen: 화이트(white-out). Counter: 개.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: The teacher is writing on the blackboard.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: 칠(漆 lacquer) appears in 옻칠(lacquer). 판(板 board) appears in 간판(sign), 게시판(bulletin board). Modern: 화이트보드(whiteboard).

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I was fired because the company situation was bad.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 해(解 release) appears in 해결(solution), 해방(liberation). 고(雇 employ) appears in 고용(employment). Dismissal/firing.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I signed the contract.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 계(契 contract) appears in 계기(opportunity). 약(約 promise) appears in 약속(promise), 조약(treaty). Contract/agreement.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I'm busy because the deadline is tomorrow.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Native Korean. From 마감하다(close/deadline). Very common: 마감일(deadline), 마감 시간(closing time). Deadline/closing.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: We started a new project.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Loanword from English 'project'. Work assignment. Collocations: 프로젝트를 진행하다(carry out project), 프로젝트 팀.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I'm an office worker.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 회사(company) + 원(員 member). Office worker/company employee. Common job title in Korea.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: That person is a famous entrepreneur.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 사업(business) + 가(家 -ist). Businessman/entrepreneur. Successful: 성공한 사업가.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I'm working as a freelancer.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Loanword from English 'freelancer'. Independent contractor. Modern work: 프리랜서로 일하다.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I worked part-time at a cafe when I was a college student.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Loanword from German 'Arbeit' via Japanese. Part-time job. Short: 알바. Common: 아르바이트하다.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I worked as an intern in the summer.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Loanword from English 'intern'. Internship: 인턴십. Common entry: 인턴 사원(intern employee).

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I negotiated my annual salary.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 연(年 year) appears in 작년(last year), 내년(next year). 봉(俸 salary) appears in 봉급(salary). Annual salary.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: This company has good benefits.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 복(福 fortune) appears in 행복(happiness), 복권(lottery). 지(祉 welfare). Employee benefits/welfare.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: Working hours are from 9 to 6.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 근무(work) + 시간(time). Working hours. 9 to 6: 오전 9시부터 오후 6시까지.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: Shall we eat together during lunch break?
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 점심(lunch) + 시간(time). Lunch break. Typical: 12시부터 1시까지(12-1pm).

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: There's a team dinner this evening.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 회(會 gathering) + 식(食 meal). Company dinner/drinking. Korean work culture: 회식 문화.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: Work stress has been severe lately.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Loanword from English 'stress'. Work pressure. Common: 스트레스를 받다(be stressed), 스트레스 해소(stress relief).

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I achieved good results this year.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 성(成 achieve) appears in 성공(success), 성장(growth). 과(果 fruit) appears in 결과(result), 과일(fruit). Achievement/results.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I achieved this quarter's goal.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 목(目 eye) appears in 항목(item), 과목(subject). 표(標 mark) appears in 목표물(target). Goal/target.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I'm organizing the documents.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 서(書 document) appears in 보고서(report), 도서(books). 류(類 category) appears in 종류(type), 분류(classification). Documents/paperwork.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: Please make 10 copies of this document.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 복(複 double) appears in 중복(duplication). 사(寫 copy) appears in 사진(photo), 묘사(description). Copy/photocopy.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: Please send the documents by fax.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Loanword from English 'fax'. Less common now. Verbs: 팩스를 보내다(send fax).

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I'm giving a presentation to the client tomorrow.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Loanword from English 'presentation'. Short: 프레젠, 발표. Business: 프레젠테이션하다.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: We're carrying out the project in cooperation with another team.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 협(協 cooperate) appears in 협상(negotiation), 협조(cooperation). 력(力 power) appears in 노력(effort), 능력(ability). Cooperation/collaboration.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: Competition is fierce in the job market these days.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 경(競 compete) appears in 경기(competition). 쟁(爭 争) appears in 투쟁(struggle), 논쟁(debate). Competition.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: If office supplies are running low, tell the general affairs team.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 사무(office work) + 용품(supplies). 용(用 use) appears in 사용(use). 품(品 item). Office supplies.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: The copier broke down, so I requested a repair.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 복사(copy) + 기(機 machine) appears in 기계(machine), 세탁기(washing machine). Photocopier.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I scan documents with the scanner and send them by email.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Loanword from English 'scanner'. Document scanner. Verb: 스캔하다(to scan).

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example: 공유 캘린더에 회의 일정을 넣어 주세요.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: Please put the meeting schedule on the shared calendar.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Loanword from English 'calendar'. Scheduling calendar. Korean: 달력. Wall/desk: 캘린더.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: An announcement was posted on the bulletin board.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 게(揭 post) appears in 게시(posting). 시(示 show) appears in 표시(display). 판(板 board). Bulletin board.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I always wear a name tag at work.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 명(名 name) appears in 이름(name), 명함(business card). 찰(札 tag). Name tag/badge.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: They check attendance every morning.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 출(出 go out) + 석(席 seat) appears in 좌석(seat). Attendance. Work: 출석 체크(attendance check).

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I was late today because I missed the bus.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 지(遲 late) appears in 지체(delay). 각(覺 awareness). Being late/tardy. Bad: 지각하면 안 돼요.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I left early because I wasn't feeling well.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 조(早 early) appears in 일찍(early). 퇴(退 leave). Leaving early. Request: 조퇴하고 싶어요.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I was absent from work today because I was sick.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 결(缺 lack) appears in 결석(absence). 근(勤 work). Absence from work. Sick: 병으로 결근하다.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: There's a team workshop next week.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Loanword from English 'workshop'. Training workshop. Company: 워크숍에 참석하다.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I'm attending a marketing seminar this afternoon.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Loanword from English 'seminar'. Academic/business seminar. Attend: 세미나에 가다.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: We brainstormed for the new project.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Loanword from English 'brainstorming'. Idea generation. Meeting: 브레인스토밍 회의.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: The teamwork was really great on this project.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Loanword: team + work. Teamwork. Important: 팀워크가 중요하다(teamwork is important).

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: The project succeeded thanks to the team leader's leadership.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Loanword from English 'leadership'. Leadership skills. Develop: 리더십을 기르다.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I've grown a lot at this company.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 성(成 grow) appears in 성공(success), 성인(adult). 장(長 long) appears in 장기(long-term). Growth/development.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I was assigned to plan a new product.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 기(企 plan) appears in 기업(enterprise). 획(劃 draw) appears in 계획(plan). Planning/proposal.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: The budget for this project is insufficient.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 예(豫 prepare) appears in 예정(schedule). 산(算 calculate) appears in 계산(calculation), 산수(arithmetic). Budget.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example: 이번 달 매출이 지난달보다 많이 올랐어요.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: This month's sales went up a lot compared to last month.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 매(賣 sell) appears in 판매(sales), 매도(selling). 출(出 go out). Sales revenue/turnover.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I'm planning to invest in that company.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 투(投 throw) appears in 투표(voting). 자(資 capital) appears in 자본(capital), 자금(funds). Investment.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I clean my room every weekend.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 청(淸 clean) appears in 청결(cleanliness), 청량(refreshing), 청신(clear mind). 소(掃 sweep) appears in 소탕(sweep out), 일소(wipe out). Common: 방을 청소하다(clean the room).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: The weather is nice, so I'm doing laundry.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native Korean verb. 빨래 means laundry (from washing action). Related: 빨래를 널다(hang laundry), 빨래를 개다(fold laundry). Common: 빨래를 돌리다(run the wash).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I do the dishes after dinner.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native Korean. From 설다(wash dishes) + 거지(old action noun). Related: 설거지통(dish basin), 설거지 비누(dish soap). Common: 식후에 설거지하다.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: Today I'm cooking.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 요(料 ingredient) appears in 재료(material), 요금(fee), 연료(fuel). 리(理 manage) appears in 관리(management), 처리(processing), 물리(physics). Common: 저녁을 요리하다.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I iron my shirt before going to work.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native Korean. 다리미(iron) from flattening/smoothing. Related: 다림판(ironing board), 다림질판. Common: 셔츠를 다림질하다(iron a shirt).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I sweep the yard with a broom.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native Korean verb (irregular ㄹ). Conjugates: 쓸어요/쓸었어요. Related: 빗자루로 쓸다(sweep with broom). Common: 마루를 쓸다(sweep the floor).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I wipe the table clean.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native Korean verb. Multiple uses: 이를 닦다(brush teeth), 구두를 닦다(polish shoes), 창문을 닦다(wipe windows). Common: 깨끗이 닦아요(wipe clean).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I'm tidying up the desk.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 정(整 organize) appears in 정돈(tidying), 정렬(arrangement), 조정(adjustment). 리(理 manage) appears in 관리(management), 처리(processing). Common: 책상을 정리하다(organize desk).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: In Korea, you must do recycling.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 분(分 divide) appears in 구분(division), 분류(classification), 분석(analysis). 리(離 separate) appears in 이별(separation), 거리(distance). 수(收 collect) appears in 수입(income), 수집(collection). 거(去 remove) appears in 제거(removal), 거부(refuse).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: Please throw away the trash.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native Korean word. Related: 쓰레기통(trash can), 음식물 쓰레기(food waste), 재활용 쓰레기(recyclables). Common: 쓰레기를 버리다(throw away trash).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: Where is the trash can?
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native compound: 쓰레기(trash) + 통(container). Related: 분리수거통(recycling bin), 휴지통(wastebasket). Common: 쓰레기통을 비우다(empty trash).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: We ran out of detergent.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 세(洗 wash) appears in 세탁(laundry), 세수(face wash), 세차(car wash). 제(劑 agent/medicine) appears in 약제(medicine), 소독제(disinfectant), 첨가제(additive). Common: 세제를 넣다(add detergent).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I wash my hands well with soap.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native Korean word. Related: 손비누(hand soap), 물비누(liquid soap), 비누칠(soaping). Common: 비누로 손을 씻다(wash hands with soap).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: This shampoo smells nice.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Loanword from English 'shampoo.' Related: 린스(rinse/conditioner), 트리트먼트(treatment). Common: 샴푸로 머리를 감다(wash hair with shampoo).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I'll bring a new towel.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native Korean word. Related: 손수건(handkerchief), 목욕 수건(bath towel), 타올(towel). Common: 수건으로 물기를 닦다(dry with towel).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I squeeze toothpaste onto the toothbrush.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 치(齒 tooth) appears in 치과(dentist), 치아(teeth), 충치(cavity). 약(藥 medicine) appears in 약국(pharmacy), 감기약(cold medicine), 연고약(ointment). Common: 치약을 짜다(squeeze toothpaste).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I change my toothbrush every 3 months.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 치(齒 tooth) appears in 치과(dentist), 치아(teeth), 충치(cavity). 솔(brush) is native Korean. Related: 전동 칫솔(electric toothbrush), 칫솔모(bristles). Common: 칫솔질하다(brush teeth).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I get dressed while looking in the mirror.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native Korean word. Related: 손거울(hand mirror), 전신거울(full-length mirror), 화장 거울(makeup mirror). Common: 거울을 보다(look in mirror).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I comb my hair with a comb.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native Korean word. From verb 빗다(to comb). Related: 머리빗(hair comb), 빗질(combing action). Common: 빗으로 머리를 빗다(comb hair).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I dry my hair with a hair dryer after showering.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Konglish: 드라이(dry) + 기(機 machine). Related: 헤어드라이어, 선풍기(fan). Common: 드라이기로 머리를 말리다(dry hair with dryer).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I put the laundry in the washing machine.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 세(洗 wash) appears in 세제(detergent), 세수(face wash), 세차(car wash). 탁(濯 rinse) appears in 세탁소(laundromat). 기(機 machine) appears in 기계(machine), 비행기(airplane), 청소기(vacuum). Common: 세탁기를 돌리다(run washing machine).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: Please put the milk in the refrigerator.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 냉(冷 cold) appears in 냉동(freezing), 냉방(cooling), 냉면(cold noodles). 장(藏 store) appears in 저장(storage), 창고(warehouse), 보장(guarantee). 고(庫 warehouse) appears in 차고(garage), 문고(library). Common: 냉장고에 넣다(put in fridge).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I heat up rice in the microwave.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 전(電 electricity) appears in 전기(electricity), 전화(phone), 전등(light). 자(子 child/particle) appears in 원자(atom), 전자(electron). 레인지(range) is loanword. Common: 전자레인지에 데우다(heat in microwave).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: It's too hot, so I turn on the air conditioner.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Loanword from English 'air conditioner.' Related: 냉방(cooling), 실외기(outdoor unit), 에어컨 필터. Common: 에어컨을 켜다/끄다(turn on/off AC).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: A heater is essential in winter.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Loanword from English 'heater.' Related: 난방(heating), 온풍기(warm air heater), 전기 히터. Common: 히터를 틀다(turn on heater).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: It's cool when I turn on the fan.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 선(扇 fan) appears in 부채(hand fan), 선동(agitation). 풍(風 wind) appears in 바람(wind), 태풍(typhoon), 풍경(scenery). 기(機 machine) appears in 기계(machine), 청소기(vacuum). Common: 선풍기를 틀다(turn on fan).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I turn on the light when I enter the room.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 전(電 electricity) appears in 전기(electricity), 전화(phone), 전력(power). 등(燈 lamp) appears in 손전등(flashlight), 가로등(streetlight), 형광등(fluorescent). Common: 전등을 켜다/끄다(turn light on/off).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I plug the charger into the outlet.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Loanword from German/Dutch 'konzent/contact.' Related: 플러그(plug), 멀티탭(power strip), 어댑터(adapter). Common: 콘센트에 꽂다(plug into outlet).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I change the channel with the remote control.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Konglish: shortened from 'remote control.' Related: TV 리모컨, 에어컨 리모컨. Common: 리모컨으로 채널을 바꾸다(change channel with remote).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I put the key in my bag.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native Korean. From 열다(open) + 쇠(metal). Related: 열쇠고리(keyring), 카드키(key card), 비밀번호(password). Common: 열쇠로 문을 열다(open door with key).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I locked the lock on the door.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native Korean compound: 자물(lock) + 쇠(metal). Related: 자물쇠를 잠그다(lock), 열쇠(key). Common: 자물쇠를 채우다(put on lock).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: It's cold, so please cover yourself with a blanket.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native Korean word. Related: 이불을 덮다(cover with blanket), 이불을 개다(fold blanket), 요(mattress pad). Common: 이불을 펴다(lay out blanket).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: This pillow is very comfortable.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native Korean word. Related: 베개를 베다(rest head on pillow), 베갯잇(pillowcase). Common: 푹신한 베개(soft pillow).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I lie on the bed and read a book.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 침(寢 sleep) appears in 침실(bedroom), 침구(bedding), 취침(going to bed). 대(臺 platform) appears in 무대(stage), 연대(platform), 좌대(pedestal). Common: 침대에 눕다(lie on bed).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I sit on the sofa and watch TV.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Loanword from English 'sofa.' Related: 쿠션(cushion), 소파베드(sofa bed). Common: 소파에 앉다(sit on sofa).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: There is a laptop on the desk.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 책(冊 book) appears in 책방(bookstore), 서적(books), 도서(books). 상(床 table/platform) appears in 식탁(dining table), 침대(bed). Common: 책상 위에 두다(put on desk).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: Please have a seat.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 의(椅 chair) appears in 안락의자(armchair), 휠체어(wheelchair). 자(子 object suffix) appears in 탁자(table), 상자(box). Common: 의자에 앉다(sit on chair).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: There is a pen in the drawer.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native Korean word. Related: 서랍장(chest of drawers), 서랍 손잡이(drawer handle). Common: 서랍을 열다/닫다(open/close drawer).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I take clothes out of the wardrobe.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 옷(clothes) is native + 장(欌 cabinet) appears in 책장(bookshelf), 찬장(cupboard), 냉장고(refrigerator). Common: 옷장 정리하다(organize wardrobe).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I open the curtains in the morning.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Loanword from English 'curtain.' Related: 블라인드(blinds), 암막 커튼(blackout curtains). Common: 커튼을 열다/치다(open/close curtains).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I laid a carpet in the living room.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Loanword from English 'carpet.' Related: 러그(rug), 매트(mat), 깔개. Common: 카펫을 깔다(lay carpet).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I water the flowerpot.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 화(花 flower) appears in 꽃(flower), 국화(chrysanthemum), 화초(flowering plant). 분(盆 pot/basin) appears in 분재(bonsai), 분지(basin). Common: 화분에 물을 주다(water flowerpot).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I put the family photo in a picture frame.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 액(額 frame) appears in 금액(amount), 거액(large sum). 자(字 character) appears in 글자(letter), 숫자(number), 한자(Chinese character). Common: 사진을 액자에 넣다(frame photo).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: A clock is hanging on the wall.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 시(時 time) appears in 시간(hour/time), 시각(moment), 때(time). 계(計 measure) appears in 계산(calculation), 온도계(thermometer), 계획(plan). Common: 시계를 보다(check time).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I write appointments on the calendar.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 달(月 month/moon) appears in 월요일(Monday), 월급(monthly salary), 초승달(crescent moon). 력(曆 calendar) appears in 역법(calendar system), 양력(solar calendar). Common: 달력에 표시하다(mark on calendar).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I open the window in the morning to ventilate.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 환(換 exchange) appears in 교환(exchange), 환불(refund), 전환(conversion). 기(氣 air) appears in 공기(air), 날씨(weather), 기후(climate). Common: 창문을 열어 환기하다(ventilate by opening window).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: The window screen is torn, so mosquitoes are getting in.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 방(防 prevent) appears in 방지(prevention), 예방(prevention), 방어(defense). 충(蟲 insect) appears in 해충(pest), 벌레(insect). 망(網 net) appears in 그물망(net), 철망(wire mesh). Common: 방충망을 설치하다(install screen).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: The drain is clogged, so the water won't go down.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 배(排 drain) appears in 배출(discharge), 배기(exhaust). 수(水 water) appears in 물(water), 수도(water supply), 수영(swimming). 구(口 opening) appears in 입구(entrance), 출구(exit). Common: 배수구가 막히다(drain clogged).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: Water is leaking from the faucet.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 수(水 water) appears in 물(water), 수영(swimming), 급수(water supply). 도(道 way) appears in 길(road), 도로(road), 철도(railroad). 꼭지(spout) is native. Common: 수도꼭지를 잠그다(turn off faucet).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: The light bulb burned out, so I need to replace it.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 전(電 electricity) appears in 전기(electricity), 전화(phone), 전력(power). 구(球 sphere) appears in 지구(Earth), 야구(baseball), 공(ball). Common: 전구를 갈다(change light bulb).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: The remote control batteries are dead.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 건(乾 dry) appears in 건조(dry), 건포도(raisins), 건강(health). 전(電 electricity) appears in 전기(electricity), 전화(phone). 지(池 reservoir) appears in 저수지(reservoir), 연못(pond). Common: 건전지를 교체하다(replace battery).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I sealed the box with tape.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Loanword from English 'tape.' Related: 스카치테이프(scotch tape), 박스테이프(packing tape), 양면테이프(double-sided). Common: 테이프로 붙이다(attach with tape).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: You need a hammer to drive a nail into the wall.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native Korean word. Related: 못(nail), 망치질(hammering). Common: 망치로 못을 박다(hammer a nail).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: Please tighten the screw with a screwdriver.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Loanword from English 'screwdriver.' Related: 십자 드라이버(Phillips), 일자 드라이버(flathead). Common: 나사를 조이다/풀다(tighten/loosen screw).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I hammered a nail into the wall and hung a picture frame.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native Korean word for nail (not negation). Related: 못질(hammering), 압정(thumbtack). Common: 못을 박다(drive nail).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: The screw came loose, so I need to tighten it again.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native Korean word. Related: 나사못(screw), 볼트(bolt), 너트(nut). Common: 나사를 조이다/풀다(tighten/loosen screw).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I painted the room walls with white paint.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Loanword from English 'paint.' Related: 페인트칠(painting), 붓(brush), 롤러(roller). Common: 벽을 페인트로 칠하다(paint wall).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I'm moving to a new apartment next month.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 이(移 move) appears in 이동(movement), 이전(transfer), 전이(transition). 사(舍 house) appears in 사택(official residence), 여사(madam). Common: 이사 가다(move house).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I did the interior design of the new house myself.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Loanword from English 'interior (design).' Related: 셀프 인테리어(DIY), 리모델링(remodeling). Common: 인테리어를 하다(do interior design).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I ordered furniture online.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 가(家 home) appears in 가족(family), 가정(household), 집(house). 구(具 tool) appears in 도구(tool), 기구(equipment), 문구(stationery). Common: 가구를 배치하다(arrange furniture).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example: 수납 공간이 부족해서 정리가 안 돼요.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I can't organize because there's not enough storage space.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 수(收 collect) appears in 수집(collection), 수입(income), 수확(harvest). 납(納 store) appears in 납품(delivery), 납부(payment), 수용(acceptance). Common: 수납 공간(storage space).
