집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I mop the floor with a rag.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native Korean word. Related: 물걸레(wet mop), 마른걸레(dry rag), 걸레질(mopping). Common: 걸레로 바닥을 닦다(mop floor).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: A lot of dust has built up on the fan.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native Korean word. Related: 먼지를 털다(dust off), 미세먼지(fine dust/PM2.5). Common: 먼지가 쌓이다(dust accumulates).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: Mold has appeared in the bathroom.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native Korean word. Related: 곰팡이가 피다(mold grows), 곰팡이 제거제(mold remover). Common: 습한 곳에 곰팡이가 생기다(mold in damp places).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: There's a bug in my room and I'm scared.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native Korean word. Related: 해충(pest), 바퀴벌레(cockroach), 모기(mosquito). Common: 벌레가 들어오다(bug gets in).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: The phone is broken.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: 전(電 electricity) appears in 전기(electric), 전등(light), 전력(power). 화(話 speech/talk) appears in 회화(conversation), 대화(dialogue), 통화(phone call). 기(機 machine) appears in 기계(machine), 비행기(airplane). Common: 유선 전화기(landline phone).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I bought a new cell phone.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Konglish from 'hand phone.' Standard: 휴대폰(portable phone). Related: 스마트폰(smartphone), 휴대 전화. Common: 핸드폰을 켜다/끄다(turn phone on/off).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: Please tell me your phone number.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: 전(電 electricity) appears in 전기(electric), 전화기(phone). 화(話 speech) appears in 대화(dialogue), 회화(conversation). 번(番 number) appears in 번째(ordinal), 차례(turn). 호(號 mark) appears in 신호(signal), 부호(sign). Common: 전화번호를 가르쳐 주세요(please tell me your number).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I got a text message.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: 문(文 writing) appears in 문학(literature), 문화(culture), 문서(document). 자(字 character) appears in 글자(letter), 한자(Chinese character), 숫자(number). Means 'text message' in modern usage.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I texted my friend.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Verb form of 문자(text message). Related: 카톡하다(send KakaoTalk), 메시지 보내다(send message). Common: 나중에 문자할게(I'll text you later).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).english: to be on a call / to talk on the phone
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I'm on a call right now.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: 통(通 pass through) appears in 통로(passage), 교통(traffic), 소통(communication). 화(話 speech) appears in 대화(dialogue), 회화(conversation), 신화(myth). Common: 지금 통화 중이에요(I'm on a call now).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: Please don't hang up.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Native Korean verb. Multiple meanings: 전화를 끊다(hang up), 줄을 끊다(cut string), 담배를 끊다(quit smoking). Common: 전화가 끊겼어요(call dropped/was cut off).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: Please answer the phone.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Native Korean verb. Wide usage: 전화를 받다(answer call), 선물을 받다(receive gift), 월급을 받다(receive salary). Common: 전화 좀 받아 주세요(please answer the phone).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: The ringtone is too loud.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Native compound: 벨(bell, loanword) + 소리(sound). Related: 진동(vibration), 무음(silent mode). Common: 벨소리를 바꾸다/줄이다(change/lower ringtone).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I need to charge my phone.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: 충(充 fill) appears in 충분(sufficient), 충만(fullness), 보충(supplement). 전(電 electricity) appears in 전기(electricity), 전화(phone), 전력(power). Common: 핸드폰을 충전하다(charge phone).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: Did you bring a charger?
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: 충(充 fill) appears in 충분(sufficient), 충족(fulfillment). 전(電 electricity) appears in 전기(electric), 전화(phone). 기(機 machine) appears in 기계(machine), 세탁기(washing machine). Common: 충전기를 가져오다(bring charger).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: The battery is almost dead.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Loanword from English 'battery.' Related: 배터리가 다 됐어요(battery dead), 배터리 수명(battery life). Common: 배터리가 떨어지다(battery running out).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: Is there WiFi here?
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Loanword from English 'WiFi.' Related: 무선 인터넷(wireless internet), 공용 와이파이(public WiFi). Common: 와이파이에 연결하다(connect to WiFi).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I forgot my password.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: 비(秘 secret) appears in 기밀(confidential), 비서(secretary), 은밀(secrecy). 밀(密 dense/secret) appears in 친밀(intimate), 밀도(density). 번(番 number) appears in 차례(turn), 번째(ordinal). 호(號 mark) appears in 신호(signal). Common: 비밀번호를 입력하다(enter password).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I created a new account.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: 계(計 count/plan) appears in 계산(calculation), 회계(accounting), 계획(plan). 정(定 fixed) appears in 결정(decision), 확정(confirmation), 고정(fixed). Common: 계정을 만들다(create account).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I can't log in.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Loanword from English 'log in.' Related: 로그아웃(log out), 접속(access), 인증(authentication). Common: 계정에 로그인하다(log into account).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I searched for it on the internet.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: 검(檢 inspect) appears in 검사(inspection), 점검(checkup), 검토(review). 색(索 search) appears in 탐색(search/exploration), 사색(meditation). Common: 인터넷에서 검색하다(search on internet).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I downloaded this app.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Loanword from English 'download.' Also: 다운받다(casual form). Related: 파일 다운로드(file download). Common: 앱을 다운로드하다(download app).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I uploaded a photo.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Loanword from English 'upload.' Also: 올리다(casual native). Related: 파일 업로드, 사진 업로드. Common: 사진을 업로드하다(upload photo).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: Let's take a photo together!
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Native phrase. 사진(寫眞 photograph) + 찍다(take/click). Related: 셀카 찍다(take selfie), 인증샷(proof photo). Common: 같이 사진 찍어요(let's take a photo together).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I watched a funny video.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: 동(動 move) appears in 운동(exercise), 이동(movement), 활동(activity). 영상(映像 image/video) - 영(映 reflect) appears in 반영(reflection), 상영(screening). Common: 동영상을 보다/찍다(watch/record video).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: This app is really convenient.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Loanword from English 'app' (application). Related: 앱 스토어(app store), 앱을 깔다(install app). Common: 유용한 앱(useful app).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I send messages through KakaoTalk.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Brand name of Korea's dominant messenger app. Commonly shortened to 카톡. Related: 카톡하다(send KakaoTalk), 카톡 친구(KakaoTalk friend). Cultural: essential app in Korea.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I posted a photo on Instagram.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Brand name, Instagram. Commonly shortened to 인스타. Related: 인스타 스토리(IG story), 팔로우(follow). Common: 인스타에 올리다(post on Instagram).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I watch cooking videos on YouTube.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Brand name, YouTube. Related: 유튜버(YouTuber), 유튜브 채널(YouTube channel), 구독(subscribe). Common: 유튜브로 보다(watch on YouTube).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I search for good restaurants on Naver.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Korea's leading search engine and portal (brand name). Related: 네이버 지도(Naver Maps), 네이버 블로그. Cultural: more popular than Google in Korea.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I wrote a travel review on my blog.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Loanword from English 'blog.' Related: 블로거(blogger), 포스팅(posting), 댓글(comment). Common: 블로그에 글을 쓰다(write blog post).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I left a comment.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Native Korean word. Related: 댓글을 달다(leave comment), 악플(malicious comment), 댓글창(comment section). Common: 댓글로 의견을 남기다(leave opinion in comments).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I got a lot of likes.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Native phrase from 좋다(to be good). Related: 좋아요를 누르다(press like), 좋아요 개수(number of likes). Common on social media.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I shared this post with my friend.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: 공(共 together) appears in 공동(joint), 공통(common), 공공(public). 유(有 have) appears in 소유(ownership), 보유(possession), 유무(presence). Common: 링크를 공유하다(share link).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I follow that singer.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Loanword from English 'follow.' Related: 팔로워(follower), 팔로잉(following), 언팔하다(unfollow). Common: 계정을 팔로우하다(follow account).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I'm getting too many notifications.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Native word from 알리다(to notify/inform). Related: 알림 설정(notification settings), 푸시 알림(push notification). Common: 알림을 끄다/켜다(turn off/on notifications).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I change the language in settings.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: 설(設 set up) appears in 설치(installation), 설립(establishment), 설계(design). 정(定 fixed) appears in 결정(decision), 확정(confirmation), 지정(designation). Common: 설정을 바꾸다(change settings).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I need to update the app.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Loanword from English 'update.' Related: 최신 업데이트(latest update), 자동 업데이트(auto update). Common: 앱을 업데이트하다(update app).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I deleted old photos.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: 삭(削 shave/delete) appears in 절삭(cutting), 연삭(grinding). 제(除 remove) appears in 제거(removal), 배제(exclusion), 제외(exception). Common: 파일을 삭제하다(delete file).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I saved the file.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: 저(貯 save/store) appears in 저금(savings), 비축(reserve). 장(藏 hide/store) appears in 보장(guarantee), 창고(warehouse), 은장도(hidden dagger). Common: 파일을 저장하다(save file).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I copied the link.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: 복(複 duplicate) appears in 복잡(complex), 복합(composite), 중복(duplication). 사(寫 write/copy) appears in 묘사(description), 사진(photograph). Common: 링크를 복사하다(copy link).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: Please paste it here.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Native compound: 붙이다(attach/paste) + 넣다(put in). Related: 복사 붙여넣기(copy-paste), Ctrl+V. Common: 여기에 붙여넣기 하세요(paste it here).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I sent a cute emoticon.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Loanword from English 'emoticon.' In Korea, refers to animated stickers. Related: 이모티콘 팩(sticker pack), 카톡 이모티콘. Cultural: big business on KakaoTalk.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I took a selfie and posted it.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Konglish from 셀프(self) + 카메라(camera). Related: 셀카봉(selfie stick), 셀카 각도(selfie angle). Common: 셀카를 찍다(take selfie).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example: 데이터를 너무 많이 써서 속도가 느려졌어요.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I used too much data, so the speed slowed down.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Loanword from English 'data' (mobile data). Related: 데이터를 쓰다(use data), 무제한 데이터(unlimited data). Common: 데이터가 떨어지다(run out of data).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I want to switch to a cheaper plan.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: 요(要 need/rate) appears in 요청(request), 필요(necessity), 중요(important). 금(金 money) appears in 돈(money), 금액(amount), 현금(cash). 제(制 system) appears in 제도(system), 체제(regime). Common: 요금제를 바꾸다(change plan).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: Which carrier are you using?
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: 통(通 pass through) appears in 통로(passage), 교통(traffic), 통화(phone call). 신(信 trust/message) appears in 신뢰(trust), 편지(letter), 신용(credit). 사(社 company) appears in 회사(company), 사회(society). Common: 통신사를 변경하다(change carrier).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example: 화면이 너무 어두워요. 밝기를 올려 주세요.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: The screen is too dark. Please turn up the brightness.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: 화(畫 picture) appears in 그림(picture), 영화(movie), 계획(plan). 면(面 surface/face) appears in 표면(surface), 얼굴(face), 지면(ground). Common: 화면을 터치하다(touch screen).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: It's safe to set a lock on your phone.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Native word from 잠그다(to lock). Related: 잠금 화면(lock screen), 패턴 잠금(pattern lock), 지문 인식(fingerprint). Common: 잠금을 설정하다(set lock).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: Enter the password to unlock.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: 해(解 release) appears in 해결(resolution), 이해(understanding), 풀다(untie). 제(除 remove) appears in 제거(removal), 삭제(deletion), 배제(exclusion). Common: 잠금을 해제하다(unlock).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: The speaker volume is too low.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Loanword from English 'speaker.' Related: 블루투스 스피커(Bluetooth speaker), 음량(volume). Common: 스피커 소리를 키우다/줄이다(increase/decrease speaker volume).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example: 마이크가 안 돼서 통화할 수 없어요.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I can't make a call because the microphone isn't working.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Loanword from English 'microphone.' Related: 마이크를 켜다/끄다(turn mic on/off), 음소거(mute). Common: 마이크가 안 돼요(mic not working).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: The camera on this phone is really good.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Loanword from English 'camera.' Related: 전면 카메라(front camera), 후면 카메라(rear camera). Cultural: camera quality very important in Korea.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I listen to music with earphones in.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Loanword from English 'earphone.' Related: 무선 이어폰(wireless earbuds), 헤드폰(headphones). Common: 이어폰을 끼다(put in earphones).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I connected to the speaker via Bluetooth.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Loanword from English 'Bluetooth.' Related: 블루투스 페어링(Bluetooth pairing), 무선 연결(wireless connection). Common: 블루투스로 연결하다(connect via Bluetooth).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example: 요즘 인공지능 기술이 빠르게 발전하고 있어요.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: AI technology is developing rapidly these days.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: 인(人 person) appears in 사람(person), 인간(human), 인류(humanity). 공(工 work) appears in 공사(construction), 가공(processing). 지(智 wisdom) appears in 지혜(wisdom), 지식(knowledge). 능(能 ability) appears in 가능(possible), 능력(ability). Abbreviation: AI.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I back up my photos to the cloud.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Loanword from English 'cloud' (storage). Related: 클라우드 저장소(cloud storage), 백업(backup). Common: 클라우드에 저장하다(save to cloud).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I get too many spam messages.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Loanword from English 'spam.' Related: 스팸 문자(spam text), 스팸 메일(spam email), 스팸 차단(spam blocking). Note: also means canned meat.

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: My account was hacked, so I changed my password.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Loanword from English 'hacking.' Related: 해킹당하다(be hacked), 해커(hacker), 보안(security). Common: 계정이 해킹당했다(account was hacked).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: My computer got a virus.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Loanword from English 'virus' (computer virus). Related: 백신 프로그램(antivirus), 바이러스에 감염되다(get infected). Common: 컴퓨터 바이러스(computer virus).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: Make sure to back up important files.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Loanword from English 'backup.' Related: 백업하다(back up), 자동 백업(auto backup), 복원(restore). Common: 중요한 파일을 백업하다(back up important files).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I can restore the deleted files.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: 복(復 return) appears in 회복(recovery), 복귀(return), 반복(repetition). 원(原 original) appears in 원래(originally), 원본(original), 자원(resource). Common: 삭제된 파일을 복원하다(restore deleted files).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: I write my to-do list in my phone's memo app.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: Loanword from English 'memo.' Related: 메모하다(take memo), 메모장(notepad app). Common: 핸드폰 메모에 적다(write in phone memo).

전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example: QR코드를 찍으면 메뉴를 볼 수 있어요.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).example_en: You can see the menu if you scan the QR code.
전화 & 인터넷 (Phone & Internet).notes: QR (Quick Response) + 코드(code). Related: QR코드를 스캔하다(scan QR code), QR코드 결제(QR code payment). Cultural: widely used for menus, payment, check-in in Korea.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I wash my face and go out.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Native Korean word. Related: 세수하다(wash face), 얼굴을 씻다(wash face), 표정(facial expression). Cultural: 얼굴이 작다(small face) is a compliment in Korea.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: Your skin is really nice.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: 피(皮 skin) appears in 가죽(leather), 피혁(leather), 껍질(peel). 부(膚 skin/flesh) appears in 살갗(skin), 기부(donation). Common: 피부가 좋다(good skin).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I'm losing a lot of hair.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Native compound: 머리(head/hair) + 카락(strand). Related: 머리를 자르다(cut hair), 머리숱(hair volume). Common: 머리카락이 빠지다(lose hair).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: Long hair suits you well.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Native phrase. 길다(to be long) + 머리(hair). Related: 머리를 기르다(grow hair), 긴 생머리(long straight hair). Common: 긴 머리가 어울려요(long hair suits you).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I cut my hair short.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Native phrase. 짧다(to be short) + 머리(hair). Related: 단발머리(bob cut), 숏컷(short cut). Common: 머리를 짧게 자르다(cut hair short).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I cut my bangs.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Native compound: 앞(front) + 머리(hair). Related: 앞머리를 자르다(cut bangs), 앞머리를 내리다(have bangs down). Common: 앞머리가 잘 어울려요(bangs suit you).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: Your makeup looks pretty today.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: 화(化 transform) appears in 변화(change), 문화(culture), 화학(chemistry). 장(粧 adorn) appears in 복장(attire), 의장(decoration). Common: 화장을 하다(put on makeup).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: It takes 30 minutes to put on makeup in the morning.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Verb form of 화장(makeup). Related: 진하게 화장하다(wear heavy makeup), 연하게 화장하다(wear light makeup). Common: 아침에 화장하다(put on makeup in morning).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I put on red lipstick.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Loanword from English 'lipstick.' Related: 립틴트(lip tint), 립글로스(lip gloss), 립밤(lip balm). Common: 립스틱을 바르다(apply lipstick).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I apply sunscreen every day.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Konglish: 선(sun) + 크림(cream). Also: 자외선 차단제(UV blocker). Cultural: sunscreen use essential in Korean skincare. Common: 선크림을 바르다(apply sunscreen).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I can see well when I wear glasses.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: 안(眼 eye) appears in 안구(eyeball), 안과(ophthalmology). 경(鏡 mirror) appears in 거울(mirror), 경찰(police), 망원경(telescope). Common: 안경을 쓰다(wear glasses).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I wear sunglasses when I go outside.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Konglish: 선(sun) + 글라스(glass). Also: 썬글라스. Related: 색안경(tinted glasses). Common: 선글라스를 끼다/쓰다(wear sunglasses).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I'm wearing contact lenses.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Loanword from English 'lens' (contact lenses). Related: 렌즈를 끼다(put in lenses), 렌즈를 빼다(take out lenses). Common: 콘택트 렌즈(contact lenses).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I bought pretty earrings.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Native compound: 귀(ear) + 걸이(hanger/hook). Related: 귀걸이를 하다(wear earrings), 피어싱(piercing). Common: 예쁜 귀걸이(pretty earrings).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I received a necklace as a birthday gift.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Native compound: 목(neck) + 걸이(hanger). Related: 목걸이를 하다(wear necklace), 펜던트(pendant). Common: 목걸이를 선물하다(gift necklace).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: The ring is so pretty.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Native Korean word. Related: 반지를 끼다(wear ring), 결혼반지(wedding ring), 커플링(couple ring). Common: 약혼 반지(engagement ring).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I gave a bracelet as a gift.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Native compound: 팔(arm) + 찌(ornament suffix). Related: 팔찌를 차다(wear bracelet), 팔찌를 하다. Common: 팔찌를 선물로 주다(give bracelet as gift).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I'm wearing a new watch.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: 시(時 time) appears in 시간(hour/time), 시각(moment), 때(time). 계(計 measure) appears in 계산(calculation), 온도계(thermometer), 계획(plan). Common: 시계를 차다(wear watch).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I'm wearing a white t-shirt.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Loanword from English 't-shirt.' Related: 반팔 티(short-sleeve tee), 긴팔 티(long-sleeve tee). Common: 편한 티셔츠(comfortable t-shirt).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I wore a shirt to the interview.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Loanword from English 'shirt.' Related: 와이셔츠(dress shirt), 남방(older Korean term for shirt). Common: 셔츠를 입다(wear shirt).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: The blue blouse suits you well.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Loanword from English 'blouse.' Women's formal/semi-formal top. Common: 블라우스에 치마(blouse with skirt).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I often wear dresses in summer.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Konglish from English 'one piece.' Related: 드레스(dress), 롱 원피스(long dress). Common: 여름 원피스(summer dress).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I wear a suit for interviews.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: 정(正 proper/formal) appears in 정식(formal), 정확(accurate), 정규(regular). 장(裝 attire) appears in 복장(clothing), 의장(decoration), 포장(packaging). Common: 정장을 입다(wear suit).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I wear a jacket in autumn.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Loanword from English 'jacket.' Related: 가죽 재킷(leather jacket), 봄 재킷(spring jacket). Common: 가을에 재킷을 입다(wear jacket in fall).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I wear a long coat in winter.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Loanword from English 'coat.' Related: 롱코트(long coat), 트렌치코트(trench coat). Common: 겨울 코트(winter coat).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: A padded jacket is essential for Korean winters.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Konglish from English 'padding/padded jacket.' Related: 롱패딩(long puffer), 숏패딩(short puffer). Cultural: essential for Korean winters.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: It was windy, so I wore a jumper.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Loanword from English 'jumper' (windbreaker). Related: 봄 점퍼(spring jacket), 바람막이(windbreaker). Common: 가벼운 점퍼(light jacket).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I wore jeans and a t-shirt.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: 청(靑 blue) appears in 파란색(blue), 청년(youth), 청록색(blue-green). 바지(pants) is native. Related: 스키니 청바지(skinny jeans), 데님(denim). Common: 청바지에 티셔츠(jeans with t-shirt).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I wear shorts when it's hot.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Native compound: 반(half) + 바지(pants). Related: 핫팬츠(hot pants), 반반이(half and half). Common: 여름에 반바지를 입다(wear shorts in summer).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I change into sportswear when I exercise.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: 운(運 move/luck) appears in 운동(exercise), 운전(driving), 행운(luck). 동(動 move) appears in 이동(movement), 활동(activity), 동작(action). 복(clothes) is native. Common: 운동복으로 갈아입다(change into sportswear).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I change into pajamas and go to sleep.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Native compound: 잠(sleep) + 옷(clothes). Also: 파자마(pajamas, loanword). Related: 편한 잠옷(comfortable pajamas). Common: 잠옷으로 갈아입다(change into pajamas).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I change my underwear every day.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Native compound: 속(inside/inner) + 옷(clothes). Related: 내의(underwear/undershirt), 팬티(panties). Common: 속옷을 갈아입다(change underwear).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I lost one sock.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Native Korean word. Related: 양말 한 짝(one sock), 짝짝이 양말(mismatched socks). Common: 양말을 신다(put on socks).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I wear dress shoes when I go to work.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Native Korean word. Related: 구두를 신다(wear dress shoes), 구두를 닦다(polish shoes), 하이힐(high heels). Common: 회사에 구두를 신다(wear dress shoes to work).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I often wear sneakers because they're comfortable.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: 운(運 move) appears in 운동(exercise), 운전(driving). 동(動 move) appears in 이동(movement), 활동(activity). 화(shoes) is native. Related: 스니커즈(sneakers). Common: 편한 운동화(comfortable sneakers).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I wear slippers at home.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Loanword from English 'slipper.' Related: 실내 슬리퍼(indoor slippers), 샤워 슬리퍼. Common: 집에서 슬리퍼를 신다(wear slippers at home).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I wear boots when it rains.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Loanword from English 'boots.' Related: 레인부츠(rain boots), 롱부츠(tall boots), 앵클부츠(ankle boots). Common: 겨울에 부츠를 신다(wear boots in winter).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: It was raining heavily, so I wore a raincoat.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Native compound: 우(雨 rain) + 비(cover/protect). Related: 우산(umbrella), 비옷(raincoat). Common: 비 올 때 우비를 입다(wear raincoat when it rains).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I go out wearing gloves in winter.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Native Korean word. Related: 장갑을 끼다(wear gloves), 벙어리장갑(mittens), 고무장갑(rubber gloves). Common: 겨울 장갑(winter gloves).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I wear a scarf when it's cold.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: 목도리 is native (목 neck + 도리 wrap). 스카프 is loanword (scarf). Also: 머플러(muffler). Common: 목도리를 하다/두르다(wear scarf).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: The pants are big, so I wear a belt.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Loanword from English 'belt.' Related: 가죽 벨트(leather belt), 벨트를 매다(wear belt). Common: 바지에 벨트를 매다(wear belt with pants).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: My father puts on a necktie and goes to work.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Loanword from English 'necktie.' Related: 넥타이를 매다(tie necktie), 보타이(bow tie). Common: 출근할 때 넥타이(necktie for work).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I left my wallet at home.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Native Korean word. Related: 지갑을 잃어버리다(lose wallet), 카드 지갑(card wallet), 장지갑(long wallet). Common: 지갑을 챙기다(grab wallet).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: Please take an umbrella.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Native Korean. From 우(雨 rain) + 산(umbrella). Related: 우산을 쓰다(use umbrella), 접이식 우산(folding umbrella). Common: 우산을 가져가다(take umbrella).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I carry a backpack when I travel.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Native Korean word. Related: 배낭을 메다(carry backpack), 배낭여행(backpacking), 백팩(backpack). Common: 학생 배낭(student backpack).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example: 저는 생머리라서 파마를 해 본 적이 없어요.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I have naturally straight hair, so I've never gotten a perm.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Native compound: 생(raw/natural) + 머리(hair). Related: 자연스러운 머리(natural hair), 파마(perm). Cultural: traditional Korean beauty standard.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I got a magic straight to straighten my curly hair.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Native compound. 곱슬곱슬하다(curly/wavy). Related: 파마(perm), 매직 스트레이트(magic straight/straightening). Common: 곱슬머리를 펴다(straighten curly hair).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I dyed my hair brown.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: 염(染 dye) appears in 전염(infection), 물들이다(dye/color), 염료(dye). 색(色 color) appears in 색깔(color), 색상(hue), 탈색(bleaching). Common: 머리를 염색하다(dye hair).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: Getting a perm totally changed the vibe.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Loanword from English 'perm' (permanent wave). Related: 파마를 하다(get perm), 볼륨 파마(volume perm), 펌(perm). Common: 파마 스타일(perm style).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I've gotten a few wrinkles around my eyes.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Native Korean word. Related: 주름살(wrinkle), 주름을 펴다(smooth wrinkles), 주름 방지(anti-wrinkle). Cultural: anti-aging products huge in Korea.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I have a mole next to my nose.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Native Korean word. Multiple meanings: 점(mole), 점(dot), 점(score). Related: 점을 빼다(remove mole), 점의 위치(mole position). Cultural: face reading based on mole location.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example: 어렸을 때 다쳐서 팔에 흉터가 있어요.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I have a scar on my arm from getting hurt as a child.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: 흉(凶 ugly/bad) appears in 흉악(atrocious), 흉측(ugly), 불길(ominous). 터(mark/place) is native. Related: 상처(wound), 흉터를 없애다(remove scar). Common: 흉터가 남다(leave scar).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example: 요즘 한국에서도 문신을 하는 사람이 많아요.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: These days, many people in Korea also get tattoos.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: 문(文 pattern/character) appears in 문양(pattern), 문학(literature), 문화(culture). 신(身 body) appears in 몸(body), 신체(physique), 자신(oneself). Also: 타투(tattoo). Common: 문신을 하다(get tattoo).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: Everyone has a different body type.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: 체(體 body) appears in 신체(physique), 몸체(body), 체육(physical education). 형(形 shape) appears in 모양(shape), 형태(form), 유형(type). Common: 체형이 다르다(different body types).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example: 너무 말라서 살을 좀 찌우고 싶어요.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I'm so skinny that I want to gain some weight.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Native Korean verb (irregular). Conjugates: 말라요/말랐어요. Related: 살이 빠지다(lose weight), 말랐다(skinny). Common: 너무 말랐어요(too skinny).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: The baby's cheeks are chubby and cute.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Native Korean adjective (onomatopoeia). Softer, cuter than 뚱뚱하다(fat). Related: 통통한 뺨(chubby cheeks), 아기처럼 통통하다. Often affectionate.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I've become slim from exercising.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Native Korean adjective. Related: 날씬한 몸매(slim figure), 몸매가 좋다(good figure). Common: 날씬해 보여요(look slim) - compliment in Korea.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: That person is tall and well-built.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: 건(健 healthy) appears in 건강(health), 건강하다(healthy), 건전(soundness). 장(壯 strong) appears in 장대(grand), 웅장(magnificent), 강장(tonic). Common: 체격이 건장하다(well-built physique).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example: 그 사람은 옷을 항상 세련되게 입어요.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: That person always dresses stylishly.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: 세(洗 refine/wash) appears in 세탁(laundry), 세제(detergent). 련(鍊 practice/refine) appears in 연습(practice), 단련(training), 숙련(skilled). Common: 세련된 스타일(sophisticated style).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example: 이 디자인이 좀 촌스러운 것 같아요.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I think this design is a bit tacky.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Native adjective from 촌(village). Means tacky/unfashionable/country-like. Related: 촌티(country look), 세련되다(sophisticated). Common: 디자인이 촌스럽다(design is tacky).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: That color really suits you.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Native Korean verb. Means to suit/match/blend. Related: 잘 어울려요(suits well), 안 어울려요(doesn't suit). Very common for appearance and fashion.

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I often wear warm knit sweaters in winter.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Loanword from English 'knit.' Related: 니트 스웨터(knit sweater), 울 니트(wool knit). Common: 따뜻한 니트(warm knit sweater).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I wear a hoodie when I want to be comfortable.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Konglish: 후드(hood) + 티(t-shirt). Related: 후드집업(zip-up hoodie), 맨투맨(sweatshirt without hood). Common: 편할 때 후드티(hoodie for comfort).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: I drape a cardigan over my shoulders in spring.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Loanword from English 'cardigan.' Related: 가디건(same), 카디건을 걸치다(drape cardigan). Common: 봄/가을 카디건(spring/fall cardigan).

외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).example_en: Wearing a vest with a suit looks cool.
외모 & 옷 (Appearance & Clothes).notes: Native Korean word. Related: 정장 조끼(formal vest), 구명조끼(life vest), 패딩 조끼(padded vest). Common: 조끼를 입다(wear vest).

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: I'm going to a cafe to meet a friend.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: 친(親 close/intimate) appears in 친절(kind), 친척(relative). 구(友 friend) appears in 우정(friendship), 벗(friend - poetic). Common: 남자친구(boyfriend), 여자친구(girlfriend), 절친(bestie).

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: My boyfriend is really good at cooking.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: 남(男 male) appears in 남편(husband), 남성(masculine). 자(者 person) appears in 여자(female), 작자(author). Often shortened to 남친 in casual speech.

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example: 여자친구 생일 선물을 아직 못 샀어요.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: I haven't bought a birthday gift for my girlfriend yet.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: 여(女 female) appears in 여성(feminine), 여권(women's rights). 자(者 person) appears in 남자(male), 작자(author). Often shortened to 여친 in casual speech.

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: My senior bought me lunch.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: 선(先 before/senior) appears in 선생(teacher), 먼저(first). 배(輩 generation/peer) appears in 후배(junior), 동배(same generation). Senior in school/work; important cultural concept.

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: I gave advice to my juniors.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: 후(後 after/junior) appears in 이후(after), 후기(later period). 배(輩 generation/peer) appears in 선배(senior), 동배(same generation). Junior; expected to show respect to 선배.

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: When a neighbor moves in, you greet them.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: Native Korean 이(this) + 웃(old form of neighbor). Neighbor. Formal: 이웃집. Traditional culture emphasized good neighbor relations.

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: A guest is coming to our house today.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: Native Korean 손(guest) + 님(honorific). Guest, customer, visitor. Used in hospitality, restaurants. Always respectful.

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example: 그 사람은 아는 사람이에요. 친구는 아니에요.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: That person is an acquaintance. Not a friend.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: Native Korean 알다(know) + 사람(person). Acquaintance, someone you know. More casual than 지인.

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example: 낯선 사람한테 말을 걸면 안 돼요.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: You shouldn't talk to strangers.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: Native Korean 낯(face/stranger) + 선(unfamiliar) + 사람(person). Stranger. Warning to children: 낯선 사람 조심!

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: I have plans with a friend tomorrow.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: 약(約 promise) appears in 약혼(engagement), 계약(contract). 속(束 bind/bundle) appears in 구속(restraint), 결속(unity). Promise, appointment. Punctuality is culturally important.

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: My friend set me up on a blind date.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: 소(紹 introduce) + 개(介 introduce) + English 'ting' from 'meeting'. Blind date, arranged date. Very common in Korean dating culture.

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: I'm going on a date with my boyfriend this weekend.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: English loanword: date. Romantic date. Verb: 데이트하다. Korean dating culture has specific stages and expectations.

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: I don't have time for dating these days.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: 연(戀 love/romance) appears in 연인(lover), 연모(love). 애(愛 love) appears in 사랑(love), 애정(affection). Dating, romance. Verb: 연애하다.

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: I'm going to my older sister's wedding next month.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: 결혼(結婚 marriage) + 식(式 ceremony) appears in 행사(event), 의식(ritual). Wedding ceremony. Traditional Korean weddings blend 한복 and Western styles.

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: Happy birthday! (Congratulations on your birthday!)
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: 축(祝 congratulate) appears in 축제(festival), 축복(blessing). 하(賀 congratulate) appears only in 축하. To congratulate. Common: 생일 축하합니다!

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: I invited friends to my birthday party.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: 초(招 invite) appears in 초청(invitation), 초빙(invitation). 대(待 treat/wait) appears in 대접(hospitality), 대기(waiting). To invite. Noun: 초대(invitation).

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: I visit my grandmother's house on weekends.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: 방(訪 visit) appears in 방문객(visitor), 내방(visit). 문(問 ask/inquire) appears in 질문(question), 문의(inquiry). To visit. Formal term; casual: 가다, 놀러가다.

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: What do you want to receive as a birthday present?
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: 선(膳 gift/offering) appears only in 선물. 물(物 thing) appears in 물건(object), 동물(animal). Gift, present. Korean gift-giving culture has specific etiquette.

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: When you meet an elder, you greet them first.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: 인(人 person) + 사(事 matter). To greet, to say hello. Noun: 인사(greeting). Bowing depth varies by relationship and formality.

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: We met for the first time and shook hands.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: 악(握 grasp) appears only in 악수. 수(手 hand) appears in 손(hand), 수화(sign language). Handshake. Less common than bowing in Korean culture.

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: We met after a long time and hugged.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: 포(抱 embrace/hug) appears in 포근(cozy), 품(bosom). 옹(擁 embrace) appears only in 포옹. Hug, embrace. Less common than Western cultures; reserved for close relationships.

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: You use formal speech with people you meet for the first time.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: 존(尊 respect) appears in 존경(respect), 존중(respect). 대(待 treat) appears in 대우(treatment), 대접(hospitality). Honorific/polite speech. Complex system in Korean.

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: I use casual speech with close friends.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: 반(半 half) appears in 반쪽(half), 절반(half). Native Korean 말(speech). Casual/informal speech. Only use with close friends or younger people.

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: Manners are very important in Korea.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: 예(禮 courtesy/manners) appears in 예절(etiquette), 무례(rudeness). 의(儀 propriety) appears in 의식(ceremony), 의례(ritual). Manners, courtesy. Very important in Korean culture.

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: It's important to be considerate of others.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: 배(配 distribute/consider) appears in 배치(arrangement), 배달(delivery). 려(慮 consideration) appears in 고려(consideration), 염려(worry). Consideration, thoughtfulness. Key cultural value.

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: When you make a mistake, apologize right away.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: 사(謝 apologize) appears in 감사(thanks), 사죄(apology). 과(過 fault/mistake) appears in 과오(error), 실수(mistake). To apologize. Korean apology culture emphasizes sincerity.

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: I'm really grateful that my friend forgave me.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: 용(容 forgive/allow) appears in 용납(acceptance), 허용(permission). 서(恕 forgive) appears only in 용서. To forgive. Common phrase: 용서해 주세요.

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: If you need help, please tell me.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: Native Korean 돕다(help) + 음(noun ending). Help, assistance. Related: 도와주다(to help), 도움이 되다(to be helpful).

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: Can I ask you just one favor?
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: 부(付 entrust) appears in 부여(grant), 교부(issue). 탁(託 entrust) appears in 위탁(consignment), 의탁(entrustment). Request, favor. Common: 부탁 하나만.

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: I'm sorry, but I have to decline that request.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: 거(拒 refuse) appears in 거부(refusal), 거역(defiance). 절(絶 cut off) appears in 절대(absolute), 단절(severance). To refuse, to decline. Korean culture makes direct refusal difficult.

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: I agree with that opinion too.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: 동(同 same/agree) appears in 동일(identical), 동료(colleague). 의(意 meaning/intention) appears in 의견(opinion), 의도(intention). To agree, to consent. Noun: 동의(agreement).

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: My parents oppose that plan.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: 반(反 oppose/reverse) appears in 반응(reaction), 위반(violation). 대(對 against/toward) appears in 대결(confrontation), 반응(reaction). To oppose, to object. Noun: 반대(opposition).

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: I want to hear everyone's opinions.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: 의(意 meaning/opinion) appears in 의미(meaning), 의도(intention). 견(見 view/opinion) appears in 견해(view), 소견(opinion). Opinion, view. Common: 의견을 나누다(exchange opinions).

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: Let's discuss this topic together.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: 토(討 discuss) appears in 검토(review), 토의(discussion). 론(論 discuss/theory) appears in 논쟁(argument), 이론(theory). To debate, to discuss. Noun: 토론(debate).

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: That's a misunderstanding. Let me explain.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: 오(誤 mistake/wrong) appears in 오류(error), 착오(mistake). 해(解 understand) appears in 이해(understanding), 해석(interpretation). Misunderstanding. Verb: 오해하다.

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: We made up quickly after fighting.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: 화(和 harmony/reconcile) appears in 평화(peace), 조화(harmony). 해(解 resolve) appears in 해결(solution), 이해(understanding). To reconcile, to make up. Noun: 화해(reconciliation).

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).english: to get along well; to be on good terms
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: Everyone in our family gets along well.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: Native Korean 사이(relationship/between) + 좋다(good). To be on good terms, to get along well. Used for any relationship type.

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: I had a fight with my friend yesterday.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: Native Korean. To fight, to quarrel. Related: 싸움(fight), 다투다(to argue). Can be physical or verbal.

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).english: to break up; to part ways
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: I broke up with my boyfriend last month.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: Native Korean. To part, to separate, to break up. Used for romantic breakups or general partings. More dramatic than 떠나다.

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).english: to date someone; to go out with
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: The two of them have been dating for 6 months.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: Native Korean. To date, to go out with. Also means to make friends: 친구를 사귀다. Common in relationship contexts.

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).english: to contact; to get in touch
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: I'll contact you later.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: 연(連 connect) appears in 연결(connection), 관련(related). 락(絡 connect) appears only in 연락. To contact, to get in touch. Noun: 연락(contact).

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: I heard news about my friend after a long time.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: 소(消 news/fade) appears in 소멸(extinction), 소화(digestion). 식(息 breath/news) appears in 호흡(breathing), 질식(suffocation). News, tidings. Common: 소식 전해주세요.

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: Please give my regards to your parents.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: 안(安 peaceful/safe) appears in 안전(safety), 안심(relief). 부(否 well-being/not) appears in 부정(denial), 부족(shortage). Regards, well-being. Common: 안부 전해주세요.

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: There's a university festival this weekend.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: 축(祝 celebrate) appears in 축하(congratulation), 축복(blessing). 제(祭 festival/ritual) appears in 제사(ancestral rite), 제전(festival). Festival. Korea has many local and seasonal 축제.

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example: 이번 주 금요일에 파티에 갈 거예요.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: I'm going to a party this Friday.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: English loanword: party. Party, celebration. More casual than 연회(banquet). Common: 생일 파티, 집들이 파티.

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: I ran into a high school classmate by chance yesterday.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: 동(同 same) appears in 동료(colleague), 동생(younger sibling). 창(窓 window) appears only in 동창. Alumni, former classmate. Important networking in Korean society.

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: I still keep in touch with my childhood friend.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: Native Korean 소꿉(play house - children's game) + 친구(friend). Childhood friend. Implies long, close friendship from early age.

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: We've been best friends for over 10 years.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: 베프: English 'best friend' loanword. 절친: 절(切 cut/close) + 친(親 intimate). Best friend, bestie. Modern slang, popular with younger generations.

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: That person is a work acquaintance.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: 지(知 know) appears in 지식(knowledge), 알다(to know). 인(人 person) appears in 사람(person), 인간(human). Acquaintance, someone you know professionally or socially.

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: It's important to meet a good mentor.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: English loanword: mentor. Mentor, adviser. Popular in Korean workplace and academic culture. Related: 멘티(mentee).

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).english: benefactor / someone you owe gratitude to
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: That person is my life's benefactor.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: 은(恩 grace/favor) appears in 은혜(grace), 감사(thanks). 인(人 person) appears in 사람(person), 인간(human). Benefactor, person who helped you greatly.

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: That athlete is a long-time rival.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: English loanword: rival. Rival, competitor. Can be friendly or hostile competition. Korean: 경쟁자(competitor).

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: I'm a passionate fan of that singer.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: English loanword: fan. Fan, supporter. Very strong fan culture in Korea, especially for K-pop. Related: 팬덤(fandom).

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: I made a library membership card.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: 회(會 meeting/society) appears in 회사(company), 회의(meeting). 원(員 member) appears in 직원(employee), 사원(company employee). Member. Common: 회원 가입(membership registration).

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: I got a Korean language proficiency certificate.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: 자(資 qualification) + 격(格 standard) + 증(證 certificate). Certification, license. Very important in Korean job market. Common: 자격증 따다.

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: I do volunteer work every Saturday.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: 봉(奉 serve) appears in 봉급(salary), 봉헌(offering). 사(仕 serve) appears in 사명(mission), 복무(service). Volunteer service. Important for students' university applications.

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: I donated for neighbors in need.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: 기(寄 donate) appears in 기증(donation), 기탁(deposit). 부(附 attach/give) appears in 부여(grant), 첨부(attachment). Donation. Verb: 기부하다. Common: 기부금(donation money).

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: I went to vote on election day.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: 투(投 throw/cast) appears in 투자(investment), 투입(input). 표(票 vote/ballot) appears in 득표(win votes), 표결(vote). Vote, voting. Democracy participation; voting age is 18.

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: Tax is deducted from my salary.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: 세(稅 tax) appears in 관세(customs duty), 과세(taxation). 금(金 money/gold) appears in 돈(money), 금액(amount). Tax. Common types: 소득세(income tax), 부가세(VAT).

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: It's important to follow the law.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: 법(法 law) appears in 법률(law), 법원(court). Law. Very broad term. Common: 법을 지키다(obey law), 불법(illegal).

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: You must follow the classroom rules well.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: 규(規 rule/standard) appears in 규정(regulation), 규범(norm). 칙(則 rule) appears in 원칙(principle), 법칙(law/principle). Rule, regulation. Differentiate from 법(law): 법 is legal, 규칙 is institutional.

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: Citizens gathered for environmental protection.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: 시(市 city) appears in 도시(city), 시장(market/mayor). 민(民 people) appears in 국민(citizen), 인민(people). Citizen. Common: 시민권(citizenship), 모범 시민(model citizen).

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: All people have equal rights.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: 권(權 power/right) appears in 권력(power), 인권(human rights). 리(利 benefit/advantage) appears in 이익(profit), 유리(advantage). Right, privilege. Paired with 의무(duty).

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: Paying taxes is a citizen's duty.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: 의(義 justice/duty) appears in 정의(justice), 의리(loyalty). 무(務 duty/task) appears in 임무(mission), 업무(work). Duty, obligation. Common: 의무 교육(compulsory education).

관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).example_en: Gender equality is a very important value.
관계 & 사회 (Relationships & Society).notes: 평(平 flat/equal) appears in 평화(peace), 평균(average). 등(等 equal/class) appears in 등급(grade), 차등(differential). Equality. Democratic value; 남녀평등(gender equality).

긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example_en: Is anyone there? Help!
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).notes: Native Korean 돕다(help) stem + 아 + 주세요(please do for me). Help! Emergency phrase. Even in urgencies, polite form is used, but 도와주세요! or 도와줘! both acceptable.

긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example_en: It's dangerous if you go there! Be careful!
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).notes: 위(危 danger) appears in 위기(crisis), 위협(threat). 험(險 dangerous) appears in 보험(insurance), 험난(perilous). It's dangerous! Can shout 위험해! in 반말 for urgency.

긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example_en: Fire! Get out quickly!
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).notes: Native Korean 불(fire). Fire! Shouted in 반말 even to strangers — emergencies override politeness rules. Related: 불이 나다(fire breaks out).

긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example_en: We need to report it to the police.
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).notes: 경(警 warn/guard) appears in 경고(warning), 경비(security). 찰(察 inspect) appears in 관찰(observation), 조사(investigation). Police. Emergency number: 112.

긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example_en: The firefighters put out the fire quickly.
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).notes: 소(消 extinguish) + 방(防 prevent) + 관(官 official). Firefighter. Also: 소방사. Call 119 for fire emergencies.

긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example_en: Please call an ambulance quickly!
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).notes: 구(救 rescue) appears in 구조(rescue), 구하다(to save). 급(急 urgent) appears in 긴급(emergency), 급히(urgently). 차(車 vehicle) appears in 자동차(car). Ambulance. Call 119.

긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example_en: If there's an accident, call 119.
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).notes: Korean emergency number for fire and medical emergencies. Say 일일구 or 백십구. Free call from any phone, including cell phones without credit.

긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example_en: If you saw a thief, report it to 112.
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).notes: Korean emergency number for police. Say 일일이 or 백십이. Free call from any phone. Available 24/7.

긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example_en: There was a traffic accident on the road.
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).notes: 사(事 matter/event) appears in 일(matter), 사건(incident). 고(故 reason/accident) appears in 고장(breakdown), 고의(intention). Accident. Common: 교통사고(traffic accident), 산업재해(industrial accident).

긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example_en: If you're sick at night, go to the emergency room.
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).notes: 응(應 respond) appears in 대응(response), 반응(reaction). 급(急 urgent) appears in 긴급(emergency), 급히(urgently). 실(室 room) appears in 교실(classroom). Emergency room (ER).

긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example_en: A thief stole my wallet.
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).notes: Native Korean. Thief, burglar. Different from 강도(robber - uses violence). Related: 도둑질(theft - act of stealing).

긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example_en: I went to the lost and found center and asked.
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).notes: 분(紛 scatter/lose) appears in 분산(dispersion), 혼란(confusion). 실(失 lose) appears in 잃다(lose), 실패(failure). Loss of item. Formal term; report: 분실 신고.

긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example_en: I lost my phone on the subway.
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).notes: Native Korean 잃다(lose) + 어버리다(completely). To lose something. Casual equivalent of 분실하다. Common: 지갑을 잃어버렸어요.

긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example_en: I found the bag I lost!
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).notes: Native Korean. To find, to look for. Multi-meaning: find lost items, visit someone, or search. Context determines meaning.

긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example_en: If you see a suspicious person, please report it.
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).notes: 신(申 report) + 고(告 tell/inform). To report (to authorities). Noun: 신고(report). Must provide: 신고자(reporter), 신고 내용(report details).

긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example_en: If there's an earthquake, evacuate outside.
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).notes: 대(待 stand by) + 피(避 avoid/evacuate). To evacuate. Noun: 대피(evacuation). Common: 대피소(evacuation shelter), 대피 경로(evacuation route).

긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example_en: Check the location of the emergency exit in advance.
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).notes: 비(非 not/emergency) + 상(常 normal/usual) + 구(口 opening). Emergency exit. Must remain unlocked and unblocked by law in Korea.

긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example_en: You need to know how to use a fire extinguisher.
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).notes: 소(消 extinguish) + 화(火 fire) + 기(器 device/tool). Fire extinguisher. Required in buildings. Know how to use: pull pin, aim, squeeze, sweep.

긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example_en: There was a small earthquake last night.
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).notes: 지(地 earth/ground) appears in 땅(ground), 지구(Earth). 진(震 quake) appears only in 지진. Earthquake. Korea has low seismic activity but awareness increased after recent events.

긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example_en: It rained a lot and there was a flood.
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).notes: 홍(洪 flood) appears only in 홍수. 수(水 water) appears in 물(water), 수영(swimming). Flood. Monsoon season (장마철) can cause 홍수 in Korea.

긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example_en: There was a power outage because of the typhoon.
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).notes: 정(停 stop) appears in 중지(suspension), 정지(stop). 전(電 electricity) appears in 전기(electricity), 전화(phone). Power outage, blackout. Report to KEPCO (한국전력).

긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example_en: The elevator broke down.
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).notes: 고(故 reason/fault) appears in 사고(accident), 고의(intention). 장(障 obstacle) appears in 장애(obstacle), 보장(guarantee). Breakdown, malfunction. Verb: 고장나다.

긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example_en: I signed up for insurance before my trip.
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).notes: 보(保 protect) appears in 보호(protection), 보존(preservation). 험(險 danger) appears in 위험(danger), 험난(perilous). Insurance. Common: 건강보험(health insurance), 자동차보험(car insurance).

긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example_en: Make sure to bring your passport.
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).notes: 여(旅 travel) appears in 여행(travel), 여정(journey). 권(券 ticket/passport) appears in 승차권(train ticket), 입장권(admission ticket). Passport. Essential for international travel; validity check: 유효기간.

긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example_en: You need a visa to study in Korea.
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).notes: English loanword: visa. Visa. Entry permit for foreign countries. Types: 관광 비자(tourist visa), 취업 비자(work visa).

긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example_en: Please show me your ID.
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).notes: 신(身 body/identity) + 분(分 part/status) + 증(證 certificate/proof). ID card, identification. Common types: 주민등록증(resident registration card), 운전면허증(driver's license).

긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example_en: If you lose your passport, go to the consulate.
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).notes: 영(領 territory/consulate) + 사(事 affairs) + 관(館 building/hall). Consulate. Provides assistance to citizens abroad. Larger than 대사관(embassy) network.

긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example_en: I need Korean interpretation.
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).notes: 통(通 pass through) appears in 소통(communication), 통화(phone call). 역(譯 translate) appears in 번역(translation). Interpretation (spoken). Verb: 통역하다. Person: 통역사.

긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example_en: Please translate this document into English.
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).notes: 번(飜 translate) appears only in 번역. 역(譯 translate) appears in 통역(interpretation). Translation (written). Verb: 번역하다. Person: 번역가.

긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).english: to make an appointment; to set up plans
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example_en: I made an appointment at the hospital.
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).notes: 약속(promise/appointment) + 잡다(catch/set). To make an appointment, to schedule. Casual phrase. Formal: 예약하다.

긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example_en: I'll make a reservation at the restaurant before going.
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).notes: 예(豫 beforehand) + 약(約 promise). To make a reservation. Very common for restaurants, hotels, services in Korea. Noun: 예약(reservation).

긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example_en: I canceled my plans because it rained.
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).notes: 취(取 take) + 소(消 cancel/erase). To cancel. Noun: 취소(cancellation). Check cancellation policy: 취소 수수료(cancellation fee).

긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example_en: I want to change my flight date.
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).notes: 변(變 change) appears in 변화(change), 변동(fluctuation). 경(更 change/renew) appears in 갱신(renewal), 경신(renewal). To change, to modify. Noun: 변경(modification).

긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example_en: Please confirm the reservation one more time.
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).notes: 확(確 certain) + 인(認 recognize). To confirm, to check. Noun: 확인(confirmation). Very common: 예약 확인(reservation confirmation).

긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example_en: Please sign here.
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).notes: 서(署 sign) appears in 경찰서(police station), 소방서(fire station). 명(名 name) appears in 이름(name), 성명(full name). To sign. Noun: 서명(signature).

긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example_en: It's good to learn first aid methods.
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).notes: 응급(emergency) + 처(處 handle) + 치(置 place/treat). First aid, emergency treatment. Essential skill; courses available through Red Cross.

긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example_en: Do you know how to perform CPR?
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).notes: 심(心 heart) + 폐(肺 lung) + 소(蘇 revive) + 생(生 life) + 술(術 technique). CPR (cardiopulmonary resuscitation). Life-saving skill; learn proper technique.

긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example_en: Please wrap the wound with a bandage.
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).notes: 붕(繃 bind/bandage) + 대(帶 band/belt). Bandage. First aid supply. Verb: 붕대를 감다(wrap with bandage).

긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example_en: Apply disinfectant to the wound first.
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).notes: 소독(消毒 disinfect) + 약(藥 medicine). Disinfectant, antiseptic. Common: 과산화수소(hydrogen peroxide), 알코올(alcohol).

긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example_en: They move the patient on a stretcher.
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).notes: Native Korean 들다(lift) + 것(thing). Stretcher, gurney. Used by paramedics. Also called 스트레처 (loanword).

긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example_en: What's your blood type? I'm type A.
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).notes: 혈(血 blood) + 액(液 liquid) + 형(型 type). Blood type. Know yours: A형, B형, O형, AB형. Important for emergencies and blood donation.

긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example: 수술 중에 수혈이 필요할 수 있어요.
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example_en: A blood transfusion may be needed during surgery.
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).notes: 수(輸 transport) + 혈(血 blood). Blood transfusion. Medical procedure. Related: 헌혈(blood donation).

긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example_en: My father was hospitalized.
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).notes: 입(入 enter) + 원(院 institution/hospital). Hospitalization, admission to hospital. Verb: 입원하다. Opposite: 퇴원(discharge).

긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example_en: They said I can be discharged next week.
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).notes: 퇴(退 leave/exit) + 원(院 institution/hospital). Discharge from hospital. Verb: 퇴원하다. Opposite: 입원(admission).

긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example_en: After the test, I was diagnosed with a cold.
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).notes: 진(診 examine/diagnose) appears in 진찰(medical examination), 진료(medical treatment). 단(斷 judge/conclude) appears in 판단(judgment), 결단(decision). Diagnosis. Verb: 진단하다.

긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example_en: The doctor gave me a prescription.
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).notes: 처(處 handle/prescribe) appears in 처리(processing), 대처(dealing with). 방(方 method/prescription) appears in 방법(method), 약방(pharmacy). Prescription. Noun: 처방전(prescription slip).

긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example: 이 약은 부작용이 있을 수 있어요.
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example_en: This medication may have side effects.
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).notes: 부(副 secondary/副) + 작용(作用 effect/action). Side effect. Important to ask about: 부작용이 있나요?

긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example_en: This area is off-limits.
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).notes: 금(禁 forbid) appears in 금연(no smoking), 금주(no alcohol). 지(止 stop) appears in 정지(stop), 중지(suspension). Prohibition. Common signs: 출입금지(no entry), 주차금지(no parking).

긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example_en: Be careful because it's slippery.
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).notes: 주(注 pay attention) appears in 주목(attention), 주시(watching). 의(意 meaning/intention) appears in 의미(meaning), 의도(intention). Caution, attention. Common signs: 주의!(caution!).

긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).example_en: You cannot bring hazardous materials onto the plane.
긴급 상황 & 안전 (Emergencies & Safety).notes: 위험(danger) + 물(物 thing/substance). Hazardous material, dangerous substance. Labels required. Restricted on public transportation.

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: I wear hanbok on Lunar New Year.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: 한(韓 Korean) appears in 한국(Korea), 한식(Korean food), 한글(Korean alphabet). 복(服 clothing) appears in 양복(suit), 교복(uniform), 의복(garments). Traditional Korean dress worn on holidays like 설날, 추석.

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: We make kimchi before winter comes.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: Native Korean 김치 + 장(making/storing). Annual kimchi-making tradition in late fall. Families/communities gather to prepare winter kimchi; UNESCO intangible cultural heritage.

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: We eat rice cake soup on the morning of Lunar New Year.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: Native Korean 떡(rice cake) + 국(soup). Rice cake soup eaten on 설날 (New Year). Eating 떡국 symbolizes gaining a year; sliced rice cakes resemble coins (prosperity).

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: We make songpyeon together with family on Chuseok.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: Native Korean. Half-moon shaped rice cake eaten during 추석. Filled with sweet ingredients; shape resembles full moon. Making 송편 is family tradition.

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: We bow to our elders for the New Year.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: 세(歲 year) + 배(拜 bow/worship). New Year's bow to elders. Children bow and receive 세뱃돈; shows respect and receives blessings.

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: I bowed and received New Year's money.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: 세배(New Year's bow) + 돈(money). New Year's money given to children by elders after 세배. Given in white envelope; amount varies by age/relationship.

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: On Chuseok, we go to our hometown.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: 추(秋 autumn) appears in 가을(autumn), 추수(harvest). 석(夕 evening) appears in 석양(sunset), 저녁(evening). Korean Thanksgiving, harvest festival. Major holiday with 성묘, 차례, family gatherings.

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: The whole family gathers on Lunar New Year.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: Native Korean 설(New Year's Day) + 날(day). Lunar New Year, most important holiday. Traditional activities: 세배, 떡국, 윷놀이, 한복 wearing.

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example: 한글날은 한글을 만든 것을 기념하는 날이에요.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: Hangul Day is a day to celebrate the creation of Hangul.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: 한글(Korean alphabet) + 날(day). Hangul Day, October 9th. Celebrates King Sejong's creation of 한글 in 1443. National holiday honoring linguistic heritage.

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: We give carnations to our parents on Parents' Day.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: Native Korean 어버이(parents) + 날(day). Parents' Day, May 8th. Children give carnations and gifts to parents; shows filial piety (효도).

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: We go to the amusement park on Children's Day.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: Native Korean 어린이(children) + 날(day). Children's Day, May 5th. National holiday; parents take children out for special activities and gifts.

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: There are many beautiful hanok in Bukchon.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: 한(韓 Korean) appears in 한국(Korea), 한복(hanbok). 옥(屋 house) appears in 집(house), 주택(housing). Traditional Korean house with 온돌, 마당, tiled roof.

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example: 한국 집에는 온돌이 있어서 바닥이 따뜻해요.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: Korean houses have ondol so the floor is warm.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: Native Korean 온(warm) + 돌(stone). Underfloor heating system; ancient Korean invention. Heated floors from flue; modern homes use electric/water heating.

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: I spent a night at the jjimjilbang with friends.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: Native Korean 찜질(steaming/heat treatment) + 방(room). Korean spa/sauna complex. Open 24/7; includes hot rooms, cold rooms, sleeping areas, snacks. Popular social activity.

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: We went to karaoke after the company dinner.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: Native Korean 노래(song) + 방(房 room). Karaoke room. Private rooms rented by hour; extremely popular social activity in Korea. Also called 가라오케.

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: Having chicken and beer at the Han River is the best.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: Native Korean 치킨(chicken) + 맥주(beer). Chicken and beer combo. Iconic Korean pairing; popular late-night food. Cultural phenomenon, especially during sports events.

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: Shall I make you a glass of somaek?
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: 소(焼 distilled) from 소주 + 맥(麥 barley) from 맥주. Soju-beer cocktail. Popular drinking mix; ratio matters (소맥 비율). Drinking culture staple.

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: In Korea, anything can be delivered.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: 배(配 distribute/deliver) appears in 배치(arrangement), 분배(distribution). 달(達 reach/deliver) appears in 달성(achievement), 전달(delivery). Delivery. Korea has extensive 배달 culture for all foods, 24/7.

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: I bought a triangle kimbap at the convenience store.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: 편(便 convenience) + 의(宜 suitable) + 점(店 store). Convenience store. Open 24/7; CU, GS25, 세븐일레븐. More than stores: bill payment, banking, seating.

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: People with quick nunchi are popular.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: Native Korean. Social awareness, reading the room. Important Korean cultural concept: understanding unspoken social cues. 눈치가 빠르다(quick), 눈치가 없다(oblivious).

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: We've worked together a long time, so I've developed jeong.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: Native Korean. Deep emotional bond, attachment. Untranslatable Korean concept: affection that develops through shared experiences. 정이 들다(to develop 정).

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: It's important to show filial piety to your parents.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: 효(孝 filial piety) appears in 불효(unfilial behavior). 도(道 way) appears in 도덕(morality), 길(way). Filial piety. Core Confucian value in Korean culture.

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: In Korea, the senior-junior culture is strong.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: 선배(senior) + 후배(junior). Senior-junior relationship system. Pervasive in schools, military, workplace. Age and entry year determine hierarchy.

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: There's a company dinner tonight.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: 회(會 meeting) appears in 회의(meeting), 회사(company). 식(食 eat/food) appears in 식사(meal), 음식(food). Company dinner, team dinner. Korean workplace culture; attendance often expected.

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: I rode a bicycle at Han River Park on the weekend.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: 한(漢 Han) + 강(江 river). Han River running through Seoul. Major landmark; parks along river for biking, picnics, festivals. '한강의 기적' (miracle of Han River) refers to economic development.

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: I saw the Seoul night view from Namsan Tower.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: 남(南 south) + 산(山 mountain) + tower. N Seoul Tower on Namsan mountain. Iconic Seoul landmark; observation deck, love locks, restaurants. Height: 236.7m (tower) + 243m (mountain).

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: I took photos wearing hanbok at Gyeongbokgung.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: 경(景 scenery/capital) + 복(福 fortune/blessing) + 궁(宮 palace). Gyeongbokgung Palace, main royal palace of Joseon Dynasty. Built 1395; changing of guard ceremony; major tourist site.

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example: 제주도는 한국에서 가장 인기 있는 여행지예요.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: Jeju Island is the most popular travel destination in Korea.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: 제주(濟州 Jeju) + 도(島 island). Jeju Island, largest island of Korea. Subtropical island; UNESCO sites, volcanic landscape, beaches. Popular honeymoon and vacation destination.

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example: 경주에 가면 불국사에 꼭 가 보세요.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: If you go to Gyeongju, definitely visit Bulguksa.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: 불(佛 Buddha) + 국(國 country/land) + 사(寺 temple). Bulguksa Temple in Gyeongju. UNESCO World Heritage Site; Silla Dynasty; architectural masterpiece. Houses national treasures.

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: Samulnori performances are really exciting.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: 사(四 four) + 물(物 thing/instrument) + 놀이(play). Traditional percussion quartet. Four instruments: 꽹과리, 장구, 북, 징. Dynamic rhythm; represents nature elements.

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: Pansori is a UNESCO cultural heritage.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: Native Korean 판(venue/public place) + 소리(sound/song). Traditional Korean narrative singing. One singer, one drummer; epic stories. UNESCO intangible cultural heritage.

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: Taekwondo is Korea's representative martial art.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: 태(跆 kick with foot) + 권(拳 fist/punch) + 도(道 way). Taekwondo, Korean martial art. Olympic sport; emphasizes kicking. Founded 1940s-50s; worldwide popularity.

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: I went to a Korean medicine clinic because my back hurt.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: 한(韓 Korean) + 의(醫 medicine) + 원(院 clinic). Traditional Korean medicine clinic. Treatments: 침(acupuncture), 한약(herbal medicine), 부항(cupping).

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: I go to the sauna after exercising.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: English/Finnish loanword: sauna. Sauna, public bath. Different from 찜질방 (more facilities); focuses on bathing/steaming. Gender-separated.

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: I went to the neighborhood bathhouse and got a scrub.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: 목욕(沐浴 bathing) + 탕(湯 hot water/bath). Public bathhouse. Traditional Korean bathing culture; scrub service (때밀이). Gender-separated; communal bathing.

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: I played games at the PC room with friends.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: PC (loanword) + 방(room). PC gaming cafe. Extremely popular; rent computers by hour. High-spec gaming PCs; social gaming space; snacks/drinks.

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: This is ten thousand won.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: 만(萬 ten thousand) + 원(元/圓 won). 10,000 won (about $7-8 USD). Also means 'full capacity': 만원 버스(packed bus).

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example: 요즘 아이돌 콘서트 표가 너무 비싸요.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: K-pop idol concert tickets are so expensive these days.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: English loanword: idol. K-pop idol. Highly trained performers; intense training system; massive fan culture. Groups debut through entertainment companies.

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: What K-drama are you watching these days?
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: K- (Korean) + drama (loanword). Korean TV drama. Global phenomenon; various genres; typically 16-20 episodes. Popular on Netflix/Viki.

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: Korea is famous for its 'hurry hurry' culture.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: Native Korean 빨리(quickly) repeated. 'Hurry hurry' culture. Korean cultural trait: emphasis on speed and efficiency. Can be positive (dynamic) or negative (rushing).

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example: 한류 덕분에 한국어를 배우는 사람이 많아요.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: Thanks to the Korean Wave, many people are learning Korean.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: 한(韓 Korean) + 류(流 wave/flow). Korean Wave, Hallyu. Global spread of Korean culture: K-pop, K-drama, K-beauty, K-food. Began late 1990s, accelerated 2010s.

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: K-pop is popular all around the world.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: K-pop (loanword). Korean pop music. Global phenomenon; synchronized choreography, visual focus, fandom culture. Major groups: BTS, BLACKPINK, etc.

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: I eat Korean food every day.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: 한(韓 Korean) + 식(食 food). Korean cuisine. Characteristics: fermented foods (김치), side dishes (반찬), communal eating. UNESCO recognized 김장 culture.

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: Korean traditional medicine considers body balance important.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: 한(韓 Korean) + 의(醫 medicine) + 학(學 study/science). Traditional Korean medicine. Based on Chinese medicine; yin-yang, five elements theory. Treatments: 침, 한약, 부항.

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example: 풍수에 따라 집을 배치하는 사람도 있어요.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: Some people arrange their homes according to feng shui.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: 풍(風 wind) + 수(水 water). Feng shui, geomancy. Influences Korean architecture, grave sites, city planning. Considers energy flow (기), direction, landscape.

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: My grandfather is good at calligraphy.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: 서(書 write/calligraphy) appears in 글씨(handwriting), 도서(book). 예(藝 art) appears in 예술(art), 기예(skill). Calligraphy. Traditional art form; brushwork using 붓, 먹.

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: Korean pottery is world-famous.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: 도(陶 pottery) appears in 도예(ceramics), 도공(potter). 자(瓷 porcelain) appears only in 자기. 기(器 vessel) appears in 그릇(bowl), 기구(equipment). Ceramics, pottery. Famous: 고려청자(Goryeo celadon), 조선백자(Joseon white porcelain).

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: They sell lots of delicious food at the traditional market.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: 전(傳 传) + 통(統 tradition) + 시(市 market) + 장(場 place). Traditional market. Contrast with 마트(supermarket); fresh produce, street food, haggling. Cultural experience.

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: Korean Buddhism has a very long history.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: 불(佛 Buddha) + 교(敎 religion/teaching). Buddhism. Major religion in Korea; temples in mountains. Key holidays: 부처님오신날(Buddha's birthday). Coexists with Christianity, shamanism.

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example: 유교 문화가 한국 사회에 큰 영향을 줬어요.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: Confucian culture has had a big influence on Korean society.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: 유(儒 Confucian scholar) + 교(敎 teaching/religion). Confucianism. Philosophy/ethical system; deeply influenced Korean culture: hierarchy, filial piety, education emphasis.

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: Elders give words of blessing on Lunar New Year.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: 덕(德 virtue/blessing) + 담(談 talk/words). Words of blessing, auspicious talk. Exchanged during 설날, new year. Examples: 건강하세요, 돈 많이 버세요.

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: I was invited to a baby's first birthday party.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: Native Korean 돌(first birthday) + 잔치(feast/celebration). First birthday party. Major celebration; 돌잡이 ceremony (baby grabs item predicting future). Traditional: 돌상.

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: We held a 60th birthday celebration for my father.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: 환(還 return/cycle) + 갑(甲 first of sexagenary cycle). 60th birthday. Completion of zodiac cycle; traditionally major celebration. Modern: also celebrate 칠순(70th).

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: Bossam is delicious when eaten with kimchi.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: Native Korean. Boiled pork wrapped in vegetables. Popular Korean dish; pork belly boiled with spices, wrapped in lettuce/kimchi. Also means 'kidnapping bride' historically.

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example: 비 오는 날에 막걸리를 마시고 싶어요.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: I want to drink makgeolli on a rainy day.
