한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: Native Korean 막(roughly) + 걸리다(filtered). Makgeolli, traditional rice wine. Milky, slightly sweet, low alcohol (6-8%). Often paired with 파전(green onion pancake).

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example: 이번 달 반상회에서 주차 문제를 이야기했어요.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: We discussed the parking problem at this month's neighborhood meeting.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: 반(班 class/neighborhood unit) + 상(常 regular) + 회(會 meeting). Neighborhood association meeting. Traditional community gathering; less common in modern apartments.

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: There are many good cafes in our neighborhood.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: Native Korean. Neighborhood. Casual term for local area. Common: 우리 동네(our neighborhood), 동네 사람(neighbor).

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: An ajumma sells fruit cheaply at the market.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: Native Korean 아주머니(married woman/aunt) shortened. Ajumma, middle-aged married woman. Can be neutral or slightly pejorative depending on tone. Characteristic: 아줌마 파마.

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: The ajusshi next door is very kind.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: Native Korean 아저씨(middle-aged man/uncle). Ajeossi, middle-aged man. Used for strangers (택시 아저씨), or for any adult man. Can be respectful or familiar.

한국 문화 (Korean Culture).example_en: I live in an officetel near my office.
한국 문화 (Korean Culture).notes: English 'office' + 'hotel' blend. Officetel. Studio/small apartment combining residential and office functions. Popular for young professionals, students.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: I'm going on a trip to Jeju Island this summer.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 여(旅 travel) appears in 여정(journey), 여관(inn), 여객(passenger). 행(行 go/conduct) appears in 행동(behavior), 여행(travel). Travel. Verb: 여행하다. Common: 해외여행(overseas travel).

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: There are really many places to sightsee in Seoul.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 관(觀 see/watch) appears in 관람(viewing), 관찰(observation). 광(光 light/scenery) appears in 풍광(scenery), 관광(sightseeing). Sightseeing, tourism. More casual than 여행; focus on seeing sites.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: I booked a package tour at the travel agency.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 여행(travel) + 사(社 company). Travel agency. Books flights, hotels, tours. Major Korean agencies: 하나투어, 모두투어.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example: 호텔 예약은 미리 하는 게 좋아요.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: It's good to make hotel reservations in advance.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 예(豫 beforehand) appears in 예상(expectation), 예정(plan). 약(約 promise) appears in 약속(promise), 계약(contract). Reservation, booking. Essential in Korea for popular restaurants/hotels.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: You can see the ocean from this hotel.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: English loanword: hotel. Hotel. Range from budget to luxury. Korean hotels have ondol rooms option. Ratings: 성급(star rating).

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: I met people from many countries at the guesthouse.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: English loanword: guesthouse. Guesthouse, hostel. Budget accommodation; often dorm-style. Popular with backpackers; social atmosphere.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: I stayed at a homestay in the countryside.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 민(民 people/民) appears in 국민(citizen), 시민(citizen). 박(泊 stay overnight) appears in 숙박(lodging), 외박(staying out overnight). Homestay, private lodging. Korean equivalent of bed & breakfast.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: Check-in is available from 3 PM.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: English loanword: check-in. Check-in. Hotel arrival process. Time usually 14:00-15:00 in Korea. Bring ID/passport.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: What time is check-out?
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: English loanword: check-out. Check-out. Hotel departure process. Time usually 11:00-12:00 in Korea. Return key, pay incidentals.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: The room is spacious and clean.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: Native Korean. Room. Context: hotel room, bedroom, any enclosed space. Counter: 방 하나 (one room). Honorific: 객실(guest room).

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: Please leave the room key at the front desk.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: Native Korean. Key. Hotel keys, house keys. Modern: 카드키(key card). Phrase: 열쇠를 잃어버렸어요(I lost my key).

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: The luggage is too heavy.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: Native Korean. Luggage, baggage. Common: 짐을 싸다(pack), 짐을 맡기다(check luggage). Storage: 짐 보관소.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: The suitcase wheel broke.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: English loanword: carrier (rolling suitcase). Wheeled luggage. More specific than 가방. Sizes: 기내용(carry-on), 위탁용(checked).

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: I put my passport in my bag.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: Native Korean. Bag, purse. General term for any bag: 여행 가방(travel bag), 핸드백(handbag), 백팩(backpack).

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: Backpacking is nice because it's freeing.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 배(背 back) appears in 등(back), 배경(background). 낭(囊 bag/sack) appears only in 배낭. Backpack. 배낭여행(backpacking trip), 배낭족(backpacker).

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: Please check the passport expiration date.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 여(旅 travel) appears in 여행(travel), 여정(journey). 권(券 ticket/document) appears in 승차권(train ticket), 입장권(admission ticket). Passport. Check validity: 유효기간 6 months minimum for international travel.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: Do I need a visa to go to Korea?
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: English loanword: visa. Visa, entry permit. Types: 관광 비자(tourist), 취업 비자(work), 학생 비자(student). Korea offers visa-free entry to many countries (90 days).

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: How long does it take to get to the airport?
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 공(空 sky/air) appears in 하늘(sky), 공군(air force). 항(港 port/harbor) appears in 항구(port), 항해(voyage). Airport. Major Korean airports: 인천(Incheon), 김포(Gimpo), 제주.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: Please show your boarding pass.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 탑(搭 board/ride) + 승(乘 board/ride) + 권(券 ticket). Boarding pass. Receive at check-in or print at kiosk. Mobile boarding pass: 모바일 탑승권.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example: 출국 수속은 2시간 전에 하는 게 좋아요.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: It's good to do departure procedures two hours in advance.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 출(出 exit/leave) appears in 출발(departure), 출입(entry/exit). 국(國 country) appears in 한국(Korea), 국가(nation). Departure from country, exit immigration. Opposite: 입국(entry).

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: I was asked questions at immigration.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 입(入 enter) appears in 입장(entry), 입학(school entrance). 국(國 country) appears in 한국(Korea), 국가(nation). Entry to country, immigration. Fill out 입국신고서(arrival card).

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: I went through a luggage inspection at customs.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 세(稅 tax/customs) appears in 세금(tax), 관세(customs duty). 관(關 gate/customs) appears in 관문(gateway), 기관(institution). Customs. Declare items; red channel (goods to declare) vs. green channel.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: I bought gifts at the duty-free shop.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 면(免 exempt) + 세(稅 tax) + 점(店 store). Duty-free shop. Popular at airports; save on luxury goods, cosmetics, alcohol. Limits apply.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: Exchange fees are cheaper if you exchange at a bank.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 환(換 exchange) appears in 교환(exchange), 전환(conversion). 전(錢 money) appears in 돈(money), 금전(money). Currency exchange. Better rates often at banks than airports.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: What is the exchange rate today?
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 환(換 exchange) + 율(率 rate). Exchange rate. Fluctuates daily. Check before exchanging: 환율이 좋다/나쁘다.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: I got a map at the tourist information center.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 안(案 information/guide) + 내(內 inside) + 소(所 place). Information center, help desk. Found at tourist sites, airports, stations. Free maps, advice.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: Are there any famous tourist spots nearby?
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 관광(sightseeing) + 지(地 place/area). Tourist destination, sightseeing spot. Popular 관광지: 경복궁, 제주도, 부산.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: Gyeongbokgung is a representative famous place in Seoul.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 명(名 famous/name) appears in 유명(famous), 이름(name). 소(所 place) appears in 장소(place), 주소(address). Famous place, attraction. 관광 명소(tourist attraction).

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: Can I take photos here?
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 사(寫 copy/photograph) + 진(眞 real/truth) + Native Korean 찍다(take/shoot). To take a photo. Common request: 사진 좀 찍어주세요?(Can you take my photo?).

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: I bought a souvenir to give to my friend.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 기(記 record/remember) + 념(念 thought/remembrance) + 품(品 item/goods). Souvenir, memento. Tourist shops sell 기념품; popular: magnets, keychains, local crafts.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: I found the way using a map app.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 지(地 land/地) appears in 땅(land), 지리(geography). 도(圖 map/diagram) appears in 도표(chart), 그림(picture). Map. Paper or digital; 구글지도(Google Maps) limited in Korea; use 네이버지도, 카카오맵.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: I planned the travel itinerary.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 일(日 day) appears in 날(day), 매일(every day). 정(程 schedule/course) appears in 과정(process), 여정(journey). Schedule, itinerary. Plan your 여행 일정 in advance.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: I took the city tour bus.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: English loanword: tour. Guided tour. Types: 도보 투어(walking tour), 버스 투어(bus tour), 자전거 투어(bike tour).

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: The guide explained in Korean.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: English loanword: guide. Tour guide, guidebook. Person: 관광 가이드. Book: 여행 가이드북. Free walking tours available in Seoul.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: The accommodation is close to the station.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 숙(宿 lodge/stay) appears in 숙박(lodging), 민숙(homestay). 소(所 place) appears in 장소(place), 주소(address). Accommodation, lodging. General term for any place to stay.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: I'd like to book a single room.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 1인(one person) + 실(室 room). Single room. Hotel room for one person. More expensive per person than shared.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: How much is a double room per night?
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 2인(two people) + 실(室 room). Double room, twin room. Hotel room for two people. Specify: 더블(double bed) vs. 트윈(twin beds).

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: This hotel includes breakfast.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 조(朝 morning) appears in 아침(morning), 조간(morning edition). 식(食 food/meal) appears in 식사(meal), 음식(food). Breakfast. Hotel breakfast: 조식 포함(breakfast included).

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: I swam at the hotel pool.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 수(水 water) + 영(泳 swim) + 장(場 place). Swimming pool. Hotels, gyms, public pools. Equipment: 수영복(swimsuit), 수영모(swim cap required in Korea).

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: I watched the sunrise at the beach.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 해(海 sea/ocean) appears in 바다(sea), 해안(coast). 변(邊 edge/side) appears in 주변(vicinity), 근처(nearby). Beach, seaside. Famous: 해운대(Haeundae), 광안리(Gwangalli).

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: Korean people really like hiking.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 등(登 climb/ascend) appears in 등반(climbing), 등록(registration). 산(山 mountain) appears in 산(mountain), 화산(volcano). Hiking, mountain climbing. National pastime in Korea; well-marked trails.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: Have you been to the National Museum of Korea?
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 박(博 extensive/museum) + 물(物 thing/object) + 관(館 building/hall). Museum. Major museums: 국립중앙박물관(National Museum), 전쟁기념관(War Memorial).

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: There are many historic sites in Gyeongju.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 유(遺 leave behind/remains) + 적(跡 trace/ruins) + 지(地 place). Historical site, ruins. Korea has many UNESCO sites: 석굴암, 불국사, 창덕궁.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: Everland is the biggest amusement park in Korea.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: Native Korean 놀이(play) + 공(公 public) + 원(園 park/garden). Amusement park, theme park. Popular: 에버랜드(Everland), 롯데월드(Lotte World).

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: I relieved my fatigue at the hot spring.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 온(溫 warm) appears in 따뜻하다(warm), 온도(temperature). 천(泉 spring/fountain) appears in 샘(spring), 천연(natural). Hot spring. Popular destinations: 온양, 유성, 부곡. Different from 찜질방.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: I'm going to the ski resort in winter.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: Ski (loanword) + 장(場 place). Ski resort. Korea has several resorts: 용평(Yongpyong), 평창(Pyeongchang - Olympics site). Season: Dec-Feb.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: The campground reservation filled up quickly.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: Camping (loanword) + 장(場 place). Campground, camping site. Popular in Korea; facilities often good. Glamping trend rising: 글램핑.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: A rental car is convenient in Jeju Island.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: Rental car (loanword blend). Rental car. Need international driving permit in Korea. Apps: 쏘카(Socar - car sharing).

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: What transportation is available to the airport?
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 교(交 交) + 통(通 pass through/transportation) + 편(便 convenience/means). Transportation, means of transport. Options: 버스, 지하철, 택시, 기차.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: I bought a round-trip train ticket.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 왕(往 go) appears in 왕래(coming and going). 복(復 return) appears in 복귀(return), 회복(recovery). Round trip. Ticket: 왕복표. Opposite: 편도(one-way).

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: One one-way ticket, please.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 편(片 one side) appears in 편지(letter), 한편(one side). 도(道 way/road) appears in 길(way), 도로(road). One-way trip. Ticket: 편도표. Opposite: 왕복(round trip).

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: Can I assign a seat in advance?
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 좌(座 sit/seat) appears in 좌석(seat), 좌우(left-right). 석(席 seat/mat) appears in 객석(audience seat), 자리(seat - native). Seat. Reserve: 좌석 예약.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: A window seat, please.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 창(窗 window) + 가(edge) + 석(seat). Window seat. Preferred on flights/trains for view. Opposite: 통로석(aisle seat).

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: Are there any aisle seats left?
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 통(通 pass through) + 로(路 road/aisle) + 석(席 seat). Aisle seat. Preferred for easy bathroom access, legroom. Opposite: 창가석(window seat).

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: Please put your bag in the luggage compartment.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: Native Korean 짐(luggage) + 칸(section/car). Luggage compartment, baggage car. On trains: overhead storage or dedicated car.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: You need to fill out the customs declaration form.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 세관(customs) + 신(申 report/declare) + 고(告 inform) + 서(書 document). Customs declaration form. Fill out on international flights; declare goods exceeding limits.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: The immigration line is really long.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 입국(entry to country) + 심(審 examine) + 사(査 investigate). Immigration inspection. Show passport, visa if required. Questions about purpose of visit.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: I'm going to transfer at Incheon Airport.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 환(換 change/transfer) appears in 교환(exchange), 전환(conversion). 승(乘 ride/board) appears in 탑승(boarding), 승객(passenger). Transfer, connection. Airport: 환승 구역. Public transport: 환승 할인(transfer discount).

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: What gate number is it?
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: English loanword: gate. Airport gate. Boarding location for flights. Check 탑승권 for gate number. Korean: 탑승구.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: We depart from Terminal 2.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: English loanword: terminal. Terminal. Airport terminal, bus terminal. Major Seoul terminals: 고속버스터미널, 동서울터미널.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: What time is the departure?
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 출발(departure) + 시간(time). Departure time. Check flight/train schedule. Arrive early: 국내선(1 hour), 국제선(2-3 hours).

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: The arrival time has been changed.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 도착(arrival) + 시간(time). Arrival time. Estimated arrival: 도착 예정 시간. Actual arrival may vary due to traffic/weather.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: The flight was delayed by two hours.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 지(遲 late/delay) appears in 늦다(late), 지각(tardiness). 연(延 延) appears in 연기(postponement), 연장(extension). Delay. Flight/train delay common. Announcement: 지연 안내.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: The flight was cancelled because of a typhoon.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 취(取 take) appears in 취득(acquisition), 채취(collection). 소(消 cancel/erase) appears in 소멸(extinction), 소화(digestion). Cancellation. Check 취소 수수료(cancellation fee) before booking.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: Did you receive the reservation confirmation email?
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 예약(reservation) + 확인(confirmation). Reservation confirmation. Always get confirmation number: 예약 번호. Verify before travel.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: Hotel prices go up a lot during peak season.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 성(盛 flourishing/peak) + 수(收 harvest/season) + 기(期 period). Peak season, high season. Higher prices, crowds. Korea: summer (Jul-Aug), holidays (설날, 추석).

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: It's much cheaper if you go during the off-season.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 비(非 not) + 수(收 season) + 기(期 period). Off-season, low season. Lower prices, fewer tourists. Better deals on 숙소, 항공권.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: This time I'm going on a package tour.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: Package (loanword) + 여행(travel). Package tour. All-inclusive: flights, hotels, meals, guides. Convenient but less flexible than 자유 여행.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: I prefer independent travel.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 자유(自由 freedom) + 여행(travel). Independent travel, free travel. Plan your own itinerary. More flexible than 패키지 여행 but requires more planning.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example: 해외여행 가기 전에 여행 보험에 가입했어요.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: I signed up for travel insurance before going abroad.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 여행(travel) + 보험(insurance). Travel insurance. Covers medical emergencies, cancellations, lost luggage. Recommended for international travel.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: I cook at home on weekends.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: 요(要 need/require) appears in 요청(request), 요구(demand), 필요(necessity). 리(理 reason/logic) appears in 관리(management), 처리(processing), 이치(logic). Verb form: 요리해요, 요리했어요.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: Boiling ramen is easy.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: Native Korean. From 끓다(to boil). Causative form: making something boil. Common: 물을 끓이다(boil water), 라면을 끓이다(cook ramen), 국을 끓이다(make soup).

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: Please stir-fry the vegetables first.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: Native Korean. Stir-fry action. Common: 김치를 볶다(stir-fry kimchi), 볶음밥(fried rice), 야채를 볶다(stir-fry vegetables). Conjugates: 볶아요, 볶았어요.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: I grill the meat over charcoal.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: Native Korean. Two meanings: to grill/bake or to bend. Context determines meaning. Common: 고기를 굽다(grill meat), 빵을 굽다(bake bread), 생선을 굽다(grill fish).

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: I steam dumplings and eat them.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: [TODO: Add note for '찌다' in category '요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen)']

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: I deep fry the chicken until it's crispy.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: Native Korean. From 튀다(to pop/jump). Causative form: making something jump in oil. Common: 닭을 튀기다(fry chicken), 감자튀김(french fries). Conjugates: 튀겨요, 튀겼어요.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: Please chop the onion finely.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: Native Korean. Cutting/slicing action. Common: 양파를 썰다(slice onions), 파를 썰다(chop green onions), 얇게 썰다(slice thinly). Conjugates: 썰어요, 썰었어요.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: You mix bibimbap well before eating.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: Native Korean. Mixing action. Common: 재료를 섞다(mix ingredients), 잘 섞다(mix well), 골고루 섞다(mix evenly). Conjugates: 섞어요, 섞었어요.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: Please prepare the ingredients in advance.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: 재(材 material) appears in 재질(material quality), 교재(textbook), 소재(subject matter). 료(料 materials) appears in 요리(cooking), 자료(data), 원료(raw materials).

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: I make the seasoning and marinate the meat.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: Native Korean. Seasoning. Common: 양념장(seasoning sauce), 양념을 넣다(add seasoning), 간장 양념(soy sauce seasoning).

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: I boil water in a big pot.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: Native Korean. General pot for cooking. Common: 냄비에 끓이다(boil in pot), 압력냄비(pressure cooker), 작은 냄비(small pot).

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: Coat the frying pan with oil.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: From English 'frying pan'. Korean also uses 팬 alone. Common: 프라이팬에 굽다(fry in pan), 프라이팬을 씻다(wash the pan).

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: I chop vegetables on the cutting board.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: Native Korean. Cutting board. Common: 도마 위에(on the cutting board), 도마를 씻다(wash cutting board). From 刀(칼 도) + 마(board).

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: I use the knife carefully.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: Native Korean. Knife. Common: 칼로 썰다(cut with knife), 날카로운 칼(sharp knife), 부엌칼(kitchen knife).

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: I scoop the soup with a ladle.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: Native Korean. Dish/bowl. Common: 큰 그릇(large bowl), 작은 그릇(small dish), 그릇을 씻다(wash dishes).

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: Please take out a clean plate.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: Native Korean. Plate. Common: 접시에 담다(put on plate), 작은 접시(small plate), 접시를 닦다(wipe plates).

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: Please pour water into the cup.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: From English 'cup'. Common: 물 한 컵(one cup of water), 종이컵(paper cup), 머그컵(mug).

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: Please turn on the gas stove.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: 가스 from English 'gas'. 레인지 from English 'range'. Common: 가스레인지로 요리하다(cook on gas stove), 가스레인지 불(gas stove flame).

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: I lost my wallet. What should I do!
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: Contraction of 어떻게 해요(how do/what do). Native Korean expression. Common: 어떡하지(what should I do - informal), 어떡해(casual form).

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: They say it'll rain tomorrow. — Really?
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: Native Korean. 그렇 + 아/어요. Agreement or question form. Common: 그래?(really? - informal), 그래, 그래(yeah, yeah), 그랬어요(it was so).

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: Studying Korean is fun, right? — That's right.
